original: de la log pa'i khams dang po dang ldan pa rnams la ni log par mos pa'i khams de gdul ba'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag go zhes 'du byed 'jig pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa ston to //
analyzed: de la log pa'i khams dang po dang ldan pa rnams la ni log par mos pa'i khams de gdul ba'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag go zhes 'du byed 'jig pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa ston to //
translated: For those who possess the first wrong element, he teaches the Truth of Impermanence by way of the destruction of conditioned things, saying: ‚ÄúThrough the cessation of the cause, conditioned things cease.‚Äù He teaches this in order to subdue the wrong element of belief in permanence.

original: de'i 'og ma khams gnyis pa dang ldan pa rnams la ni rgyu kun 'byung bas 'du byed kun 'byung ngo zhes 'du byed 'byung ba'i sgo nas mi rtag pa ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma khams gnyis pa dang ldan pa rnams la ni rgyu kun 'byung bas 'du byed kun 'byung ngo zhes 'du byed 'byung ba'i sgo nas mi rtag pa ston to //
translated: For those who possess the second wrong element, he teaches the Truth of Impermanence by way of the origin of conditioned things, saying: ‚ÄúThrough the cause of the origin of the cause, conditioned things originate.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og ma khams gsum pa dang ldan pa rnams la ni 'du byed sdug bsngal ba'i sgo nas ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma khams gsum pa dang ldan pa rnams la ni 'du byed sdug bsngal ba'i sgo nas ston to //
translated: For those who possess the third wrong element, he teaches the Truth of Impermanence by way of the suffering of conditioned things.

original: de'i 'og ma khams bzhi pa dang ldan pa 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu 'jig tshogs la lta ba la spyod pa rnams la ni stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma khams bzhi pa dang ldan pa 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu 'jig tshogs la lta ba la spyod pa rnams la ni stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas ston to //
translated: For those who practice the view of the transitory collection in a way that is separate from the four formless constituents, it is taught by way of emptiness.

original: 'du byed rnams nyid la 'jig tshogs la lta ba spyod pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i sgo nas bstan pa 'jug go //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams nyid la 'jig tshogs la lta ba spyod pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i sgo nas bstan pa 'jug go //
translated: For those who practice the view of the transitory collection in relation to the constituents themselves, it is taught by way of selflessness.

original: ma 'dres pa'i yan lag gsum gyis ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di las phyi rol ba rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i yan lag gsum gyis ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di las phyi rol ba rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa bstan te /
translated: The three unshared branches teach that this well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya is not shared with outsiders.

original: de legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su'ang 'gro'o //
analyzed: de legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su'ang 'gro'o //
translated: It is also counted as a ‚Äúwell-spoken‚Äù teaching.

original: de la yan lag rnam pa gsum ni yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su mthar thug pa'i thams cad las rnam par grol ba bstan pa dang / de nyid kyi thabs bstan pa dang / de nyid kyis so so rang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yan lag rnam pa gsum ni yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su mthar thug pa'i thams cad las rnam par grol ba bstan pa dang / de nyid kyi thabs bstan pa dang / de nyid kyis so so rang rig par bya'o //
translated: The three branches are the teaching of complete accomplishment, the teaching of complete final liberation from all, and the teaching of the method for that, which is to be known by each one individually.

original: yongs su grub pa dang yongs su mthar thug pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa dang yongs su mthar thug pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete liberation from all that is fully completed and all that is to be fully completed?

original: bya ba dang bcas pa dang / bya ba med pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: bya ba dang bcas pa dang / bya ba med pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three kinds of liberation:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang / slob pa'i dang / mi slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang / slob pa'i dang / mi slob pa'i'o //
translated: the mundane, that of the one still in training, and that of the one no longer in training.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni phyir ldog pas na yongs su grub pa ma yin no //üîΩslob pa'i bya ba dang bcas pa'i phyir mthar thug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni phyir ldog pas na yongs su grub pa ma yin no // slob pa'i bya ba dang bcas pa'i phyir mthar thug pa ma yin te /
translated: The mundane is not fully completed because it is subject to falling away.üîΩThat of the one still in training is not fully completed because it is still subject to action.

original: yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The one no longer in training is fully completed because it is no longer subject to action.

original: lhag ma ni gnyi ga yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gnyi ga yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as both.

original: thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the means?

original: 'du byed rnams kyi ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa yod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa yod pa las brtsams te /
translated: It is the means of knowing the existence of things as they are and all that exists.

original: mi rtag pa 'du shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la stong pa dang / bdag med par 'du shes pa bsgom pa @129b la brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe shes bya mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba thob bo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa 'du shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la stong pa dang / bdag med par 'du shes pa bsgom pa @129b la brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe shes bya mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba thob bo //
translated: When one realizes the truth by cultivating the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in impermanence, the perception of emptiness and selflessness in suffering, one obtains right view, because one directly perceives the object of knowledge.

original: lta ba de la brten nas sgom pa'i lam la 'du byed rnams la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes kyi gnas pas gnas par 'gyur ba'i de dang ldan pa'i tshor ba yul lkog tu gyur pa dran pa la rtog pa'i snang ba nye bar gnas pas dga' ba medüîΩpa dang / dga' ba med pa de'i sgo nas rgyu ba la gnas pa na /
analyzed: lta ba de la brten nas sgom pa'i lam la 'du byed rnams la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes kyi gnas pas gnas par 'gyur ba'i de dang ldan pa'i tshor ba yul lkog tu gyur pa dran pa la rtog pa'i snang ba nye bar gnas pas dga' ba med pa dang / dga' ba med pa de'i sgo nas rgyu ba la gnas pa na /
translated: Based on that view, when one is on the path of cultivation, one abides in the state of perceiving formations as disagreeable, and one has the feeling associated with that.

original: tshor ba de'i dmigs pa'i yul la lhag par zhen pa med de /
analyzed: tshor ba de'i dmigs pa'i yul la lhag par zhen pa med de /
translated: When one abides in the state of movement through that non-delight, one does not excessively cling to the object of that feeling.

original: de gang gi don du yul la zhen par 'gyur ba de'i don de nyid kyang med na mngon par zhen pa ltag la yod de /üîΩde de ltar gnas pa dang / rgyu ba gnyis kyi dga' ba dang / 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa yang dag par zad pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'i sems kyis gnas shing ji ltar thob pa'i lam de nyid lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus de'i phyogs kyis gnas ngan len gyi bag la nyal bcom pas yongs su grub pa dang
analyzed: de gang gi don du yul la zhen par 'gyur ba de'i don de nyid kyang med na mngon par zhen pa ltag la yod de / de de ltar gnas pa dang / rgyu ba gnyis kyi dga' ba dang / 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa yang dag par zad pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'i sems kyis gnas shing ji ltar thob pa'i lam de nyid lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus de'i phyogs kyis gnas ngan len gyi bag la nyal bcom pas yongs su grub pa dang
translated: If the object of attachment does not exist, how could there be attachment?

original: yongs su mthar thug par grol ba rjes su 'thob ste /
analyzed: yongs su mthar thug par grol ba rjes su 'thob ste /
translated: Thus, by the complete destruction of the bonds of pleasure and passion, whether in the state of composure or in activity, he dwells with a purified mind. By frequently cultivating the path as it has been attained, he destroys the latent dispositions of the resistances and attains complete and final liberation.

original: de thob na sems shin tu rnam par grol bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de thob na sems shin tu rnam par grol bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When he attains that, he is said to have a mind completely liberated.

original: so sor rig par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor rig par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete understanding?

original: de ni rnam par bzhir rig par bya ste /üîΩgal te slong ba'i rnam par grol ba la gnas /
analyzed: de ni rnam par bzhir rig par bya ste / gal te slong ba'i rnam par grol ba la gnas /
translated: It should be understood as fourfold:

original: na ni de rnam pa gnyis su rang gi shes rab kyis so sor rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: na ni de rnam pa gnyis su rang gi shes rab kyis so sor rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If he dwells in the liberation of the seeker, he has two kinds of complete understanding, by his own wisdom and by faith.

original: bdag gi ngan song rnams su 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi ngan song rnams su 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa zad do //
translated: I have exhausted the formation of my bad migrations.

original: skye ba bdun nam gnyis sam gcig ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed mngon par 'grub par zad de //
analyzed: skye ba bdun nam gnyis sam gcig ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed mngon par 'grub par zad de //
translated: I have exhausted the formation of my rebirth in other existences, except for one, two, or seven rebirths.

original: de zad par byed pa'i lam yang gtan du yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar bdag gis bsten to snyam mo //
analyzed: de zad par byed pa'i lam yang gtan du yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar bdag gis bsten to snyam mo //
translated: I have relied on the path that exhausts that, and I will not fall away from it forever.

original: gal te mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba las gnas na ni de yang rnam pa gnyis kho nas so sor rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba las gnas na ni de yang rnam pa gnyis kho nas so sor rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If he is situated in the nonlearner‚Äôs liberation, he knows it in two ways:

original: bdag gis nyon mongs pa ma lus par spang ba'i phyir bslab par bya ba thams cad byas zin to //
analyzed: bdag gis nyon mongs pa ma lus par spang ba'i phyir bslab par bya ba thams cad byas zin to //
translated: I have done all that is to be done, because I have abandoned all afflictions without exception.

original: bdag gi skye ba gcig kyang ma lus na gnyis sam bdun lta ga la yod snyam pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba gcig kyang ma lus na gnyis sam bdun lta ga la yod snyam pa ste /
translated: I have no more than one rebirth left, let alone two or seven.

original: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang lung ston par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni so sor rang rig zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang lung ston par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni so sor rang rig zhes bya'o //
translated: If he wishes, he can also prophesy to others. This is called ‚Äúself-realized.‚Äù

original: rnam par grol ba de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i chos ni 'di gnyis @130a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i chos ni 'di gnyis @130a * //
translated: These two are the factors that precede that liberation:

original: yin te / lta ba'i sngon du 'gro ba dang / lam gyi 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //üîΩlta ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni rnam par grol ba de dang / de'i thabs dang / de'i so so rang rig pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol gyi sgra thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba /
analyzed: yin te / lta ba'i sngon du 'gro ba dang / lam gyi 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba'o // lta ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni rnam par grol ba de dang / de'i thabs dang / de'i so so rang rig pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol gyi sgra thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba /
translated: the factor that precedes the view and the factor that precedes the result of the path.

original: dge ba rigs dang ldan pa yid la byed pa ste /üîΩyang dag pa'i skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba rigs dang ldan pa yid la byed pa ste / yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The factor that precedes the view is the attention that is virtuous and endowed with the lineage, which is derived from hearing, reflection, and meditation on the words of another and on one's own thorough analysis, and which is governed by the direct intuition that is the individual's intuitive awareness of that liberation and its means.üîΩIt is the factor that precedes the view because it is the cause of the correct view.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba ni de ltar thob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba ni de ltar thob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de yin te /
translated: The factor that precedes the result of the path is the correct view that has been attained, which is supramundane and is the correct view of things as they are.

original: de ma yin pa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / de'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i lam skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong ba rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / de'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i lam skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong ba rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The path of conclusion is the end of the process, at which point the defilements have been completely eliminated.üîΩThe path of insight is the first supramundane mind.

original: rnam par grol ba de ma thob par bya ba la brtag pa'i gzhi rnam pa brgyad yod de /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de ma thob par bya ba la brtag pa'i gzhi rnam pa brgyad yod de /
translated: The path of cultivation is the repetition of that realization in order to eliminate the rest of the defilements.üîΩThe path of conclusion is the end of the process, at which point the defilements have been completely eliminated.üîΩThe path of insight is the first supramundane mind.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the repetition of that realization in order to eliminate the rest of the defilements.üîΩThe path of conclusion is the end of the process, at which point the defilements have been completely eliminated.üîΩThe path of insight is the first supramundane mind.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the repetition of that realization in order to eliminate the rest of the defilements.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba brtag pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / so sor brtag pa'i stobs dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba brtag pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / so sor brtag pa'i stobs dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam brtag pa'o //
translated: The path of conclusion is the end of the process, at which point the defilements have been completely eliminated.üîΩThe path of insight is the first supramundane mind.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the repetition of that realization in order to eliminate the rest of the defilements.

original: de la 'du byed rnams kyi ro myang ba la rtog na 'du byed kyi rnams kyi ro myang ba las rang gi mtshan nyid mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyi ro myang ba la rtog na 'du byed kyi rnams kyi ro myang ba las rang gi mtshan nyid mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The path of conclusion is the end of the process, at which point the defilements have been completely eliminated.üîΩThe path of insight is the first supramundane mind.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the repetition of that realization in order to eliminate the rest of the defilements.üîΩThe path of conclusion is the end of the process, at which point the defilements have been completely eliminated.üîΩThe path of insight is the first supramundane mind.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the repetition of that realization in order to eliminate the rest of

original: de dag nyid kyi nyes pa dmigs la rtog na tshor ba gsum gyis gnas skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes dmigs de la nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas spyi'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi nyes pa dmigs la rtog na tshor ba gsum gyis gnas skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes dmigs de la nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas spyi'i mtshan nyid du yongs su shes te /
translated: If one reflects on the faults of those very feelings, one understands the general characteristics of the faults that pertain to the three feelings in terms of their faults.

original: 'di la mngon ni chung la nyes dmigs 'ba' zhig mang ba dang ro la lhag par zhen pa'i nyes dmigs dang yang ldan no snyam du rig nas ro'i gnas 'du byed rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags byung ngo cog sel ba dang / rnam par gnon pa'i spong bas spangs pas kun tu mi spyod par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la mngon ni chung la nyes dmigs 'ba' zhig mang ba dang ro la lhag par zhen pa'i nyes dmigs dang yang ldan no snyam du rig nas ro'i gnas 'du byed rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags byung ngo cog sel ba dang / rnam par gnon pa'i spong bas spangs pas kun tu mi spyod par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúHere, the faults are few but the disadvantages are many, and there is the disadvantage of excessive attachment to taste,‚Äù one eliminates all occurrences of the desire and attachment that are inclinations toward the formations that are the basis of taste, and one abandons them through the abandonment that is the suppression of desire and attachment.

original: de'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags de kun tu mi spyod par spangs pas de'i dngos po'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags de kun tu mi spyod par spangs pas de'i dngos po'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gyur te /
translated: Through the abandonment of the desire and attachment that are inclinations toward the formations that are the basis of taste, one becomes free from attachment in terms of the thing itself,

original: sems rnam par grol ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of the mind being liberated.

original: de'i bdag la nyal las yang dag @130b par 'das pas ni 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur la sems rnam par grol bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bdag la nyal las yang dag @130b par 'das pas ni 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur la sems rnam par grol bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: Since the self of that is completely transcended, one becomes free from attachment and the mind becomes liberated.

original: 'di ni rnams grangs gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni rnams grangs gcig go //
translated: This is the first enumeration.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pa 'du byed rnams la rtog pa na thog ma kho nar thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pa 'du byed rnams la rtog pa na thog ma kho nar thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa'am /
translated: Moreover, when a yogin investigates formations, he first understands formations as impermanent through the wisdom arisen from listening.

original: mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Or, he understands impermanence as suffering,

original: sdug bsngal ba la stong pa dang / bdag med par lung ji lta ba bzhin du mos pa kho nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la stong pa dang / bdag med par lung ji lta ba bzhin du mos pa kho nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: or he understands suffering as empty and selfless, just as it is taught in the scriptures.

original: des de ltar mngon par rtogs nas dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsams pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ches zhib bas shes pa de nyid yongs su shes so //
analyzed: des de ltar mngon par rtogs nas dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsams pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ches zhib bas shes pa de nyid yongs su shes so //
translated: Having understood in that way, he fully understands that knowledge through the mental attention arisen from reflection, which is associated with investigation and is much more subtle.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang yongs su shes pa de nyid kyi sgo nas de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i nyes dmigs yang dag par mthong nas so sor brtag pa'i stobs la brten pas byung ba dang du
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang yongs su shes pa de nyid kyi sgo nas de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i nyes dmigs yang dag par mthong nas so sor brtag pa'i stobs la brten pas byung ba dang du
translated: Through that very realization and thorough understanding, one sees the faults of the present life and future lives in the occurrence of the afflicted states associated with that realization and thorough understanding.

original: mi len par spong bar byed do //
analyzed: mi len par spong bar byed do //
translated: One abandons them by not tolerating them and by relying on the power of thorough analysis.

original: des mngon par rtogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang so sor rtog pa ma na du byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: des mngon par rtogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang so sor rtog pa ma na du byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go //
translated: Through the cause of not tolerating that realization, thorough understanding, and thorough analysis, one enters the faultless state.üîΩHaving entered the faultless state, one becomes free from attachment through the power of the path of meditation.

original: skyon med pa la zhugs nas gang bsgom pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis 'dod chags dang bral bar byed de des so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / mthong ba'i lam gnyis kyis kun tu mi spyod pa'i spong ba dang / phyogs gcig spong ba ci rigs par spong bar byed do //
analyzed: skyon med pa la zhugs nas gang bsgom pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis 'dod chags dang bral bar byed de des so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / mthong ba'i lam gnyis kyis kun tu mi spyod pa'i spong ba dang / phyogs gcig spong ba ci rigs par spong bar byed do //
translated: Through that, one abandons the occurrence of afflicted states by means of the power of thorough analysis and the path of seeing, and one abandons the partial abandonment of afflicted states, as is appropriate.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni 'dod chags dang bral bar byed do //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni 'dod chags dang bral bar byed do //
translated: The path of meditation causes one to become free from attachment.

original: de ltar snga ma gnyis kho nas 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa la bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni sems rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar snga ma gnyis kho nas 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa la bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni sems rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, the first two paths alone cause one to become free from attachment, but the path of meditation causes one to become liberated from the mind.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The result of abandoning afflictions is twofold:

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'bras bu gang rtogs pas sems can dmyal ba rnams zad pa dang / dud 'gro rnams zad pa dang / yi dags rnams zad pa rgyun du zhugs pa log par ltung ba ma yin pa'i chos can la zhugs pa yin no zhes rgyas par sbyar ba dang /üîΩbsgoms pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i 'bras bu ni gang rtogs pas lus tha ma 'dzin pa'i dgra bcom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'bras bu gang rtogs pas sems can dmyal ba rnams zad pa dang / dud 'gro rnams zad pa dang / yi dags rnams zad pa rgyun du zhugs pa log par ltung ba ma yin pa'i chos can la zhugs pa yin no zhes rgyas par sbyar ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i 'bras bu ni gang rtogs pas lus tha ma 'dzin pa'i dgra bcom par 'gyur te /
translated: The result of abandoning objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering is the realization that the hells are exhausted, animals are exhausted, ghosts are exhausted, and so on, and one enters the stream, one who is not subject to falling back, and so on.

original: srid pa @131a * //
analyzed: srid pa @131a * //
translated: The result of abandoning objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation is the realization that one becomes an arhat who holds the final body,

original: gnyis pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and one does not establish a second existence.

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the truth of suffering is twofold:

original: de ltar gyi rgyu can ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / 'das pa'i rgyu can da ltar gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyi rgyu can ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / 'das pa'i rgyu can da ltar gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of future suffering is due to that cause, and the cessation of present suffering is due to past causes.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds of cessation:

original: sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: the cessation of mental suffering and the cessation of physical suffering.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds of cessation:

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: the cessation of the suffering of change and the cessation of the suffering of pain, and the cessation of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds of cessation:

original: mi sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: the cessation of the suffering that is the result of unwholesome action and the cessation of the suffering that is the result of wholesome action.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos zhi ba mthong ba ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa las 'das pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang de'i kun tu sbyor ba yongs su ma zad pa'i phyir phyi ma la so so'i skye bo dang thun mongs du gyur pa'i skye ba
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos zhi ba mthong ba ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa las 'das pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang de'i kun tu sbyor ba yongs su ma zad pa'i phyir phyi ma la so so'i skye bo dang thun mongs du gyur pa'i skye ba
translated: aging, and death that is shared in common with ordinary beings because they have not completely eliminated the fetters.

original: dang rga shi'i 'jigs pa gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir des 'dun pa drag po nas dran pa dang bag yod pa'i bar du brtson par bya ba yang yod do //
analyzed: dang rga shi'i 'jigs pa gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir des 'dun pa drag po nas dran pa dang bag yod pa'i bar du brtson par bya ba yang yod do //
translated: In order to abandon that fear, they must strive with intense aspiration and so on up to mindfulness and vigilance.

original: 'di gnyis ni byis pa'i rtags yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni byis pa'i rtags yin te /
translated: These two are the signs of a fool.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes la mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes la mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: Not knowing what is desirable as it really is and manifesting what is undesirable.

original: byis pa ci 'dod ce na /
analyzed: byis pa ci 'dod ce na /
translated: What do fools desire?

original: mya ngan las 'das pas skrag nas phyi ma la 'du byed rnams mngon par mi 'grub pa mi 'dod de 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pas na de 'dod pa yin la 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pas skrag nas phyi ma la 'du byed rnams mngon par mi 'grub pa mi 'dod de 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pas na de 'dod pa yin la 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin
translated: They are afraid of nirvana and do not wish to stop the future arising of formations. Since they only wish for the arising of formations, they desire that. But the arising of formations is suffering.

original: na sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: na sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: They do not fully understand suffering as it truly is.

original: mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de mngon par 'grub pa ni rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de mngon par 'grub pa ni rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
translated: The arising of what is not desired is aging, sickness, death, encountering the unpleasant, being separated from the pleasant, being deprived of what one wants, sorrow, lamentation,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams ni mi 'dod la de 'du byed de rnams mngon par 'grub pa la mngon par mos shing skye ba'i rtsa ba @131b can gyi 'du byed rnams la mngon par dga' bas skye ba'i rtsa ba can gyi las rnams byas shing bsags pas skye bar 'gyur
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams ni mi 'dod la de 'du byed de rnams mngon par 'grub pa la mngon par mos shing skye ba'i rtsa ba @131b can gyi 'du byed rnams la mngon par dga' bas skye ba'i rtsa ba can gyi las rnams byas shing bsags pas skye bar 'gyur
translated: The suffering, mental dissatisfaction, and agitation are undesirable, and he is attracted to the manifestation of those formations. Since he delights in formations that are rooted in birth, he performs and accumulates actions that are rooted in birth.

original: te / de skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba'i rtsa ba can gyi rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: te / de skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba'i rtsa ba can gyi rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, he is not liberated from the suffering of birth and the suffering of aging, etc., which are rooted in birth.

original: de ltar na mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de mngon par 'grub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de mngon par 'grub ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that ‚Äúwhat is undesirable is manifested.‚Äù

original: 'du byed rnams kyi nges pa ni bzhi yod de /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi nges pa ni bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four certainties with regard to formations:

original: mi rtag par nges pa dang / sdug bsngal bar nges pa dang / stong par nges pa dang / bdag med par nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag par nges pa dang / sdug bsngal bar nges pa dang / stong par nges pa dang / bdag med par nges pa'o //
translated: the certainty of impermanence, the certainty of suffering, the certainty of emptiness, and the certainty of selflessness.

original: de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rnam pa gsum gyis mi rtag par rig par bya na /
analyzed: de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rnam pa gsum gyis mi rtag par rig par bya na /
translated: Moreover, past and future formations should be understood as impermanent in three ways.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams lta ci smos te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention present formations?

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod pa dang / yod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i med pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod pa dang / yod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i med pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The existence that precedes nonexistence, the existence that precedes nonexistence, and the possession of arising and destruction.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed ma byung ba rnams gtan med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed ma byung ba rnams gtan med pa kho na yin te /
translated: If future formations that have not yet arisen were absolutely nonexistent,

original: med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod pa ma yin na ni de dag mi rtag par nges pa ma yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir de dag snga ma ni med la phyis ni med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod par 'gyur bar snang bas na de'i phyir
analyzed: med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod pa ma yin na ni de dag mi rtag par nges pa ma yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir de dag snga ma ni med la phyis ni med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod par 'gyur bar snang bas na de'i phyir
translated: and the existence that precedes nonexistence did not exist, then they would not be ascertained as impermanent. But because it appears that what previously did not exist later becomes existent,

original: de dag mi rtag par nges so //
analyzed: de dag mi rtag par nges so //
translated: therefore they are ascertained as impermanent.

original: gal te da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed skyes pa rnams yod pa kho na yin te yod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i med pa kho na ma yin na ni 'di dag mi rtag par nges pa ma yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir 'di dag snga na ni
analyzed: gal te da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed skyes pa rnams yod pa kho na yin te yod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i med pa kho na ma yin na ni 'di dag mi rtag par nges pa ma yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir 'di dag snga na ni
translated: If present formations that have arisen definitely exist and do not definitely exist due to prior existence, they would not definitely be impermanent.

original: yod la phyis ni yod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i med pa kho nar 'gyur bar snang bas na de'i phyir 'di dag mi rtag par nges so //
analyzed: yod la phyis ni yod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i med pa kho nar 'gyur bar snang bas na de'i phyir 'di dag mi rtag par nges so //
translated: But because they appear to exist prior to their destruction, they definitely are impermanent.

original: gal te 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa mi snang na ni de dag mi rtag par nges pa ma yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir de dag skyes pa dang zhig par gyur bas na de'i phyir de dag mi rtag par nges te
analyzed: gal te 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa mi snang na ni de dag mi rtag par nges pa ma yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir de dag skyes pa dang zhig par gyur bas na de'i phyir de dag mi rtag par nges te
translated: If the arising and destruction of past formations did not appear, they would not definitely be impermanent. But because they have arisen and been destroyed, they definitely are impermanent.

original: / 'di ni 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / 'di ni 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ascertainment of the impermanence of formations.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa'i 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal ba yang snang la 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ba dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba yang snang ba 'di ni sdug bsngal bar nges pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde ltar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i 'du byed rnams tshogs pa de dang de la brten nas rgyu dang @132a * //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa'i 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal ba yang snang la 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ba dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba yang snang ba 'di ni sdug bsngal bar nges pa zhes bya'o // de ltar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i 'du byed rnams tshogs pa de dang de la brten nas rgyu dang @132a * //
translated: Thus, the appearance of the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces in impermanent formative forces is called the certainty of suffering.

original: rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye la dbang phyug dang skye dgu'i bdag po'i rgyu la sogs pa dang bral ba 'di ni stong par nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye la dbang phyug dang skye dgu'i bdag po'i rgyu la sogs pa dang bral ba 'di ni stong par nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of impermanent and suffering formative forces in dependence on this and that aggregation, by the power of causes and conditions, free from a cause such as a divine creator or the Lord of creatures, is called the certainty of emptiness.

original: byed pa med pa'i 'du byed rnams 'jug pa yod la byed pa po dang tshor ba po med cing /
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i 'du byed rnams 'jug pa yod la byed pa po dang tshor ba po med cing /
translated: The activity of formative forces without an agent, without an experiencer,

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba 'di ni 'du byed thams cad kyi bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba 'di ni 'du byed thams cad kyi bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and free from the notions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is called the selflessness of all formative forces.

original: de la 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The impermanence of formative forces should be understood in two ways:

original: 'das pa'i dus dang sbyar na ni zhig par gyur pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus dang sbyar na ni 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus dang sbyar na ni zhig par gyur pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus dang sbyar na ni 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to be associated with the past, it would have already ceased; if it were to be associated with the future or present, it would be subject to destruction.

original: de la 'du byed rnams kyis sdug bsngal ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyis sdug bsngal ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The suffering of conditioned being should be understood as twofold:

original: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba'i chos can yin pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te de yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba'i chos can yin pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te de yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: as having the nature of suffering and as having the nature of the three kinds of suffering.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni rnam par gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni rnam par gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Emptiness should be understood as twofold:

original: gtan med pa'i stong pa nyid dang / phyis bral ba'i stong pa'o //
analyzed: gtan med pa'i stong pa nyid dang / phyis bral ba'i stong pa'o //
translated: as the emptiness of non-existence and as the emptiness of separation.

original: gtan med pa'i stong pa ni 'di lta ste 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gtan med pa'i stong pa ni 'di lta ste 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of non-existence is the emptiness of conditioned being, which is empty of self and what belongs to self.

original: phyis bral ba'i stong pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i sems 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyis bral ba'i stong pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i sems 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of separation is the mind which is separated from all the defilements, i.e.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis stong zhing rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis stong zhing rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is empty of all afflictions and is completely liberated.

original: de la bdag med pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bdag med pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The absence of self should be understood in two ways:

original: 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dug cing mang po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dug cing mang po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the variety and multiplicity of formations and because of the absence of independence in dependent origination.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam pa bcur yang rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam pa bcur yang rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: These four aspects should be understood as ten aspects:

original: 'jig pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / 'gyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / chos nyid kyi rnam pa rnams dang / phrad pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / grub pa dang / bde ba med pa dang / 'bral ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rnam pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / 'gyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / chos nyid kyi rnam pa rnams dang / phrad pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / grub pa dang / bde ba med pa dang / 'bral ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rnam pa rnams te /
translated: the aspects of destruction, change, separation, non-arising, and reality, and the aspects of contact, repulsiveness, non-establishment, absence of pleasure, separation, and incompatibility.

original: sngar nyan thos kyi sa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nas brtsams te yid la byed pa bsgoms pa las bstan pa bzhin na //
analyzed: sngar nyan thos kyi sa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nas brtsams te yid la byed pa bsgoms pa las bstan pa bzhin na //
translated: This is taught in the cultivation of attention that begins with the supramundane path in the ≈örƒÅvaka Stage.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni 'bral ba'i phyogs kyi khams te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni 'bral ba'i phyogs kyi khams te /
translated: These five are the elements of separation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: spong ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog @132b pa'i khams dang / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams so //
analyzed: spong ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog @132b pa'i khams dang / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams so //
translated: the element of abandonment, the element of freedom from attachment, the element of cessation, the element of nirvana with a remainder of aggregates, and the element of nirvana without a remainder of aggregates.

original: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spangs pas na spong ba'i khams so //
analyzed: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spangs pas na spong ba'i khams so //
translated: The element of abandonment is the abandonment of all formations that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spangs pas na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spangs pas na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams so //
translated: The element of freedom from attachment is the abandonment of all formations that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de nyid phung po tsam zhig lus pas na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de nyid phung po tsam zhig lus pas na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams so //
translated: The element of nirvana with a remainder of aggregates is the same as the previous one, but with the mere remainder of the aggregates.

original: de'i phung po 'gag pa ni 'gog pa'i khams dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de'i phung po 'gag pa ni 'gog pa'i khams dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams so //
translated: The element of cessation is the cessation of those aggregates, and the element of nirvana without a remainder of aggregates.

original: 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi bas na khams lnga po 'di dag la 'du byed zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi bas na khams lnga po 'di dag la 'du byed zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since all formations are completely extinguished, these five elements are called the extinction of formations.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang bral bas na stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang bral bas na stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since they are free from the grasping of self, the grasping of mine, the pride of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù the clinging, and the latent tendencies, they are called emptiness.

original: de'i mtshan ma dang bral bas na dmigs su med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩspong ba'i khams la zag pa'i gnas kyi chos thams cad la sred pa dang bral bas na sred pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma dang bral bas na dmigs su med pa zhes bya'o // spong ba'i khams la zag pa'i gnas kyi chos thams cad la sred pa dang bral bas na sred pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are free from their signs, they are called signless.üîΩSince the element of abandonment is free from craving for all phenomena that are the basis of defilements, it is called the extinction of craving.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams la 'dod chags med par gyur pas na 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams la 'dod chags med par gyur pas na 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the element of detachment is free from attachment, it is called detachment.

original: 'gog pa'i khams phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ni go rims bzhin du 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ni go rims bzhin du 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The two cessations, the cessation with a remainder of the aggregates and the cessation without a remainder of the aggregates, are called, respectively, cessation and nirvana.

original: de la spong ba'i khams ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ni 'du byed rnams la skyo bar bya ba la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la spong ba'i khams ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ni 'du byed rnams la skyo bar bya ba la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort to attain the realm of abandonment that has not been attained is called the effort to become disenchanted with the formative forces.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams ma thob pa ma thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ni 'du byed rnams la 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams ma thob pa ma thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ni 'du byed rnams la 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort to attain the realm of freedom from passion that has not been attained is called the effort to become dispassionate towards the formative forces.

original: 'gog pa'i khams ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ni 'du byed rnams 'gag par bya ba la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ni 'du byed rnams 'gag par bya ba la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort to attain the realm of cessation that has not been attained is called the effort to cause the formative forces to cease.

original: sems rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa la go rims rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa la go rims rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two kinds of effort to liberate the mind:

original: shes pa'i go rims dang / shes pa'i 'bras bu'i go rims so //
analyzed: shes pa'i go rims dang / shes pa'i 'bras bu'i go rims so //
translated: the order of the knowledges, and the order of the results of the knowledges.

original: shes pa'i go rims gang zhe na /üîΩthog ma kho nar 'du byed rnams la skye @133a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i go rims gang zhe na / thog ma kho nar 'du byed rnams la skye @133a * //
translated: What is the order of the knowledges?

original: ba dang 'jig pa rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa'i shes pa skye'o //üîΩde'i 'og tu skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa 'di dag ni skye ba'i chos nyid dang / rga ba'i chos nyid nas yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i chos nyid kyis sdug bsngal lo zhes mi rtag par shes pa snga ma la brten nas /
analyzed: ba dang 'jig pa rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa'i shes pa skye'o // de'i 'og tu skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa 'di dag ni skye ba'i chos nyid dang / rga ba'i chos nyid nas yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i chos nyid kyis sdug bsngal lo zhes mi rtag par shes pa snga ma la brten nas /
translated: First, the knowledge of impermanence arises with regard to formations through the mode of discerning their origination and cessation.

original: sdug bsngal bar shes pa phyi ma skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar shes pa phyi ma skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the knowledge of suffering arises with regard to formations that possess origination and cessation, based on the previous knowledge of impermanence, through the mode of discerning the nature of their origination and cessation, up to the mode of discerning the nature of their discouragement and agitation.

original: skye ba'i chos can nas 'khrug pa'i chos can gyi bar gyi 'du byed gang yin pa 'di dag ni 'chi 'pho dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par zhugs pas rang dbang med pa'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis bdag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can nas 'khrug pa'i chos can gyi bar gyi 'du byed gang yin pa 'di dag ni 'chi 'pho dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par zhugs pas rang dbang med pa'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis bdag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal
translated: All formations, from those subject to arising to those subject to conflict, are suffering because they are without self, in the sense that they are not autonomous, since they are engaged in the process of the continuity of death and rebirth and dependent origination.

original: shes pa snga ma la brten nas phyis bdag med pa'i shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: shes pa snga ma la brten nas phyis bdag med pa'i shes pa skye ste /
translated: The knowledge of selflessness arises later, based on the previous knowledge.

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: What is impermanent is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: What is suffering is selfless.

original: de ltar na 'di ni shes pa'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni shes pa'i go rims yin no //
translated: This is the order of the knowledges.

original: shes pa'i 'bras bu'i go rims gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bu'i go rims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the results of the knowledges?

original: skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / yongs su grol ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / yongs su grol ba'o //
translated: They are disenchantment, detachment, liberation, and complete liberation.

original: skyo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyo ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is disenchantment?

original: gnyen po mngon du gyur ba na mi mthun pa'i 'du shes kyis nyon mongs pa kun tu mi spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po mngon du gyur ba na mi mthun pa'i 'du shes kyis nyon mongs pa kun tu mi spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: When the antidote is present, it is the non-functioning of the defilement by the notion of incompatibility.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment?

original: skyo bas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyis gnyen po yid la ma byas su zin kyang chags par bya ba'i dngos po la 'dod chags kun tu mi spyod pa gang yin pa ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyo bas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyis gnyen po yid la ma byas su zin kyang chags par bya ba'i dngos po la 'dod chags kun tu mi spyod pa gang yin pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the non-functioning of craving in regard to the object of attachment, by the mind imbued with disgust, even without the practice of the antidote.

original: rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba'i dbang las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba'i dbang las byung ba'o //
translated: It is, for example, the abandonment due to the power of the suppression of the defilement.

original: rnam par grol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is liberation?

original: rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba de nyid mang du byas pa'i rgyus de'i bag la nyal ba yang dag par bcom pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba de nyid mang du byas pa'i rgyus de'i bag la nyal ba yang dag par bcom pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the destruction of the envelopment of the defilement by the practice of the very same abandonment due to the power of suppression.

original: 'di ni re zhig skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rnam grangs gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rnam grangs gcig go //
translated: This is one way of classifying disgust, detachment and liberation.

original: gzhan yang skyo ba'i gnas skabs ni spong ba'i khams yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyo ba'i gnas skabs ni spong ba'i khams yin te /
translated: Moreover, the stage of disgust is the element of abandonment.

original: skyo ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the completion of disgust.

original: des skyo ba de dag la brten nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ma gtogs par de ma yin pa'i sa rnams la mi chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas @133b skabs so //
analyzed: des skyo ba de dag la brten nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ma gtogs par de ma yin pa'i sa rnams la mi chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas @133b skabs so //
translated: In the state of freedom from attachment, he is free from attachment to all stages except for the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, on the basis of that disgust.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur ba las ni rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs su gdags te 'di ni skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur ba las ni rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs su gdags te 'di ni skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnams kyi rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the state of liberation, he is free from attachment to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the second formulation of disgust, freedom from attachment and liberation.

original: yongs su grol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grol ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete liberation?

original: de de ltar nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang rnam par grol la /
analyzed: de de ltar nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang rnam par grol la /
translated: Thus, he is liberated from the defilement of the defilements and

original: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol ba 'di yongs su grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol ba 'di yongs su grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: he is also liberated from the suffering of birth, etc. This is called complete liberation.

original: de ltar shes pa'i dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams la skyo ba dang / skyo ba'i rgyus 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyus rnam par grol ba dang / yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba 'di ni shes pa'i 'bras bu'i go rims so //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams la skyo ba dang / skyo ba'i rgyus 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyus rnam par grol ba dang / yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba 'di ni shes pa'i 'bras bu'i go rims so //
translated: The order of the results of knowledge is as follows: from knowledge, one becomes disenchanted with the formative forces; from disenchantment, one becomes dispassionate; from dispassion, one becomes liberated; and from liberation, one becomes completely liberated.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni nyes par bzung bas te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni nyes par bzung bas te /
translated: These four are misapprehensions.

original: bzhi po gang zhe na ;
analyzed: bzhi po gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the four?

original: lta ba nyes par bzung ba dang / nga rgyal nyes par bzung ba dang / rang gi nyes par bzung ba dang / gzhan gyi tshig las nyes par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba nyes par bzung ba dang / nga rgyal nyes par bzung ba dang / rang gi nyes par bzung ba dang / gzhan gyi tshig las nyes par bzung ba'o //
translated: Misapprehension of the view, misapprehension of pride, misapprehension of self, and misapprehension of the words of others.

original: de la lta ba nyes par bzung ba ni 'du byed rnams la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba nyes par bzung ba ni 'du byed rnams la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, misapprehension of the view is the apprehension of the formative forces as a self and as belonging to a self.

original: de la nga rgal nyes par bzung ba ni 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nga rgal nyes par bzung ba ni 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Among them, misapprehension of pride is the apprehension of the formative forces as ‚ÄòI‚Äô.

original: de la lta ba nyes par bzung ba ni bden pa rtogs pa la gegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba nyes par bzung ba ni bden pa rtogs pa la gegs byed pa'o //
translated: The wrong view is the obstacle to the realization of the truth.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal nyes par bzung ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba la gegs byed pa'o //üîΩde la rang gi nyes par bzung ba ni gcig pu'i rtog pa ngan pa la brten pa 'di ni bdag yin no snyam ste lta ba nyes par bzung ba'am /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal nyes par bzung ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba la gegs byed pa'o // de la rang gi nyes par bzung ba ni gcig pu'i rtog pa ngan pa la brten pa 'di ni bdag yin no snyam ste lta ba nyes par bzung ba'am /
translated: The wrong pride is the obstacle to the abandonment of the object of meditation.üîΩThe wrong view is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.üîΩThe wrong pride is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.üîΩThe wrong view is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.

original: nga rgyal nyes par bzung ba'o //üîΩde la gzhan gyi tshig las nyes pa bzung ba ni gzhan dag gi tshig las mngon par zhen par gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal nyes par bzung ba'o // de la gzhan gyi tshig las nyes pa bzung ba ni gzhan dag gi tshig las mngon par zhen par gyur te /
translated: The wrong pride is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.üîΩThe wrong view is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no snyam du rnam pa de lta bu la zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag yin no snyam du rnam pa de lta bu la zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wrong pride is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.üîΩThe wrong view is the wrong conception of the self, which is based on the bad idea of the self as a single entity.

original: yang 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag tu nyes par bzung ba yang yin /
analyzed: yang 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag tu nyes par bzung ba yang yin /

analyzed: rang gi nyes par bzung ba yang yin /üîΩgzhan dag gi tshig las nyes par bzung ba yang yin te /
