original: 'dzin pa de dag thams cad spong ba gang yin @134a * //
analyzed: 'dzin pa de dag thams cad spong ba gang yin @134a * //
translated: It is the relinquishing of all such grasping.

original: pa ni shes pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa ni shes pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of all these graspings should be understood as the result of knowledge.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni rnam pa gsum gyis chad pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni rnam pa gsum gyis chad pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: All formations should be understood as neither annihilated nor eternal in three ways.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'du byed kyi rgyu mi gnas pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyu'i ngo bo 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyu mi gnas pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyu'i ngo bo 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of formations does not endure, there is no cause for the endurance of those that have arisen, and the nature of the cause of those that have not yet arisen is stopped.

original: de la rgyu mi rtag pa dang / skyes pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu mi rtag pa dang / skyes pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not eternal because the cause is impermanent and because the cause of the endurance of those that have arisen is not perceived.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la da ltar byung ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo rnams 'gag pas na chad na ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la da ltar byung ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo rnams 'gag pas na chad na ma yin no //
translated: They are not annihilated because the nature of the cause of those that have not yet arisen is stopped when they arise.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnam gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'jug pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnam gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'jug pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: These four are the conditions for the transmission of formations from one state to another.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: rkyen bzhi po de dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi po de dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: These four conditions are included in the two conditions, cause and condition.

original: de'i rgyu'i rkyen nyid ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i rkyen nyid ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The causal condition is the cause.

original: lhag ma gsum ni rkyen kho na'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni rkyen kho na'o //
translated: The remaining three are conditions.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon gang yin pa'o //üîΩmtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon gang yin pa'o // mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni /
translated: The causal condition is the seed of all formations.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa 'gag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa 'gag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the cessation of the six collections of consciousness together with their associated factors, which is immediately followed by the six collections of consciousness together with their associated factors.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i nges pa'i yul lnga dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i nges pa'i yul lnga dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition is the five specific objects of the five collections of consciousness and all phenomena for the sixth collection of consciousness.

original: de la bdag po'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i nges pa'i rten te /
analyzed: de la bdag po'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i nges pa'i rten te /
translated: The dominant condition is the specific support of the five collections of consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa dang / de las byung ba'i yid la byed pa rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i lus dang / de las byung ba'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang / de las byung ba'i yid la byed pa rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i lus dang / de las byung ba'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The dominant condition of the eye consciousness is the eye, and so on. The dominant condition of mental consciousness is the four great elements that make up the body, and the mental activity that arises from them.

original: sngon gyi las sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa gang yin pa de yang de'i bdag po'i rkyen yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa gang yin pa de yang de'i bdag po'i rkyen yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the dominant condition of the five collections of consciousness is also the previous karma that produces the results of pleasure and pain.

original: de bzhin du tshogs ni lam gyi bdag po'i rkyan yin no //üîΩlam ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs ni lam gyi bdag po'i rkyan yin no // lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the path is the dominant condition for attaining nirvana.üîΩThe dominant condition of the path is the three bases and the two aspects.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @134b par byang ba rtag pa ni gzhi gsum dang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @134b par byang ba rtag pa ni gzhi gsum dang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: The three bases are:

original: mnog la mnog gi sgo nas rtog pa na 'du byed rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur rtog pa dang / nyes dmigs la nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas rtog pa na 'du byed rnams la rnam par byang ba'i rgyur rtog pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la nges par 'byung ba'i sgo nas rtog pa na 'du byed rnams la rnam par byang bar rtog pa 'di dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: mnog la mnog gi sgo nas rtog pa na 'du byed rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur rtog pa dang / nyes dmigs la nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas rtog pa na 'du byed rnams la rnam par byang ba'i rgyur rtog pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la nges par 'byung ba'i sgo nas rtog pa na 'du byed rnams la rnam par byang bar rtog pa 'di dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: When one considers the escape in terms of the escape, one considers the formations as purification.

original: rnam par byang ba rtag pa'i gzhi gsum yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rtag pa'i gzhi gsum yin no //
translated: These three are the basis of the permanence of affliction and purification.

original: rtag pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of permanence?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa'o //
translated: the existence of reality and the existence of multiplicity.

original: de la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi mnog gang yin pa dang / nyes dmigs gang yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi mnog gang yin pa dang / nyes dmigs gang yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the existence of reality is the essence, the danger, and the escape of the formations.

original: de la ji snyed yod pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi mnog ji snyed pa dang / nyes dmigs ji snyed pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la ji snyed yod pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi mnog ji snyed pa dang / nyes dmigs ji snyed pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ji snyed pa'o //
translated: The extent of the existence of things is the extent of the reality of the formations, the extent of their disadvantages, and the extent of their escape.

original: de la 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyis bde ba 'byung ba dang / yid bde ba 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni de dag gi mnog yin la /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyis bde ba 'byung ba dang / yid bde ba 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni de dag gi mnog yin la /
translated: The extent of the reality of the formations is the extent of the pleasure and joy that arise from the formations.

original: mnog 'di dag ni chung ngu zhes bya bas te /
analyzed: mnog 'di dag ni chung ngu zhes bya bas te /
translated: This extent of reality is called ‚Äúsmall.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, in two ways, one comprehends the extent of the existence of things, namely,

original: mnog ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa la nye bar rtog go //
analyzed: mnog ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa la nye bar rtog go //
translated: the extent of the reality of the formations.üîΩThe extent of the disadvantages of the formations is the extent of their impermanence, suffering, and change.

original: de la 'du byed rnams kyis mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa 'di ni de dag gi nyes pa dmigs pa yin nyes dmigs 'di ni che'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyis mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa 'di ni de dag gi nyes pa dmigs pa yin nyes dmigs 'di ni che'o zhes bya ste /
translated: This extent of disadvantages is called ‚Äúgreat.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, in two ways, one comprehends the extent of the existence of things, namely,

original: nyes dmigs ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nye bar rtog go //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nye bar rtog go //
translated: the extent of the disadvantages of the formations.

original: de la 'du byed rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa 'dod chags spong ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba gang yin pa 'di ni de dag las nges par 'byung ba yin la grub pa dang bde ba de ni zhi ba dang bla na med pa dang gzhan rdzas yin te /üîΩde ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa 'dod chags spong ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba gang yin pa 'di ni de dag las nges par 'byung ba yin la grub pa dang bde ba de ni zhi ba dang bla na med pa dang gzhan rdzas yin te / de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: The renunciation of the craving for volitions, the abandonment of the craving for volitions, the complete transcendence of the craving for volitions, that is their renunciation. That accomplishment and happiness is peace, supreme, and unsurpassed.

original: nges par 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa la nye bar rtog go //üîΩ'du byed 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / nang @135a * //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa la nye bar rtog go // 'du byed 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / nang @135a * //
translated: Thus, in two ways, one should investigate existence as it is, that is, as renunciation.

original: dang / phyi rol rnams dang / rags pa dang phra ba rnams dang / bzang po dang ngan pa rnams dang / ring ba rnams dang / nye ba rnams la 'di ni mnog dang nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: dang / phyi rol rnams dang / rags pa dang phra ba rnams dang / bzang po dang ngan pa rnams dang / ring ba rnams dang / nye ba rnams la 'di ni mnog dang nyes dmigs so //
translated: One should investigate the faults and the disadvantages of past, future, and present volitions, of internal and external volitions, of gross and subtle volitions, of good and bad volitions, of distant and near volitions.

original: 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'o snyam du rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'o snyam du rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The idea that this is the way out is the idea of the escape from them.

original: de dag gi mnog dang nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba rnams ji snyed yod pa la rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mnog dang nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba rnams ji snyed yod pa la rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the idea of the escape from them is the idea of the escape from the three bases of the idea of the self.üîΩThe three bases of the idea of the self are the three groups of beings.

original: gzhi gsum po 'di dag yod par brda sprad par bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs gsum yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhi gsum po 'di dag yod par brda sprad par bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs gsum yin par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three groups of beings?

original: 'dod pa dag la lhag par zhen pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dag las dben pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dag dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la lhag par zhen pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dag las dben pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dag dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: They are the group of beings who are attached to sense objects, the group of beings who are detached from sense objects, and the group of beings who are free from sense objects.

original: gnas gsum po 'di dag la lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gsum kun tu rmongs so //
analyzed: gnas gsum po 'di dag la lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gsum kun tu rmongs so //
translated: The world with its gods, its MƒÅras, and its BrahmƒÅs, this world with its ascetics and brahmins, with its gods and humans, is completely confused about these three bases.

original: 'jig rten gsum po 'di dag kyang rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po 'di dag kyang rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The three worlds are established by three causes.üîΩWhat are the three?

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i dbang phyug dang / dga' ba'i dbang phyug thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i dbang phyug dang / dga' ba'i dbang phyug thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the attainment of the lordship of desire and the lordship of joy is as follows.üîΩ

original: bdud du bcas pa dang / tshangs par bcas pa'i 'jig rten gnyis so //
analyzed: bdud du bcas pa dang / tshangs par bcas pa'i 'jig rten gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the attainment of the lordship of desire and the lordship of pleasure is the attainment of the two worlds, that is, the world of Mara and the world of Brahma.

original: de thob par bya ba'i rgyu la brtson pa ni dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i rgyu la brtson pa ni dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'o //
translated: The exertion for the cause of that attainment is the attainment of the world of ascetics and brahmins.

original: las dang rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs pa khas len pa ni lha dang mir bcas pa'o //
analyzed: las dang rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs pa khas len pa ni lha dang mir bcas pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of the various kinds of action, cause, and effect is the attainment of the world of gods and humans.

original: gnas gsum po 'di dag ci rigs par spang ba dang / mngon sum du byas pa la lam gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gnas gsum po 'di dag ci rigs par spang ba dang / mngon sum du byas pa la lam gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two paths for the relinquishment and realization of these three realms, respectively.

original: mthong ba'i sa la zhugs pa'i phyin ci log bzhi spong bar gtogs pa'i sems dang / gong du bsgom pa'i lam la de la shas cher gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa la zhugs pa'i phyin ci log bzhi spong bar gtogs pa'i sems dang / gong du bsgom pa'i lam la de la shas cher gnas pa'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the mind that is included in the relinquishment of the four errors, and the path of cultivation is the mind that is mostly established in that.

original: lam rnam pa de gnyis kyis sems rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: lam rnam pa de gnyis kyis sems rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: The result of the liberation of the mind by these two kinds of paths is of four kinds.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i rnam pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa 'dul ba dang / spong ba dang / yang dag par 'da' ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i rnam pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa 'dul ba dang / spong ba dang / yang dag par 'da' ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dang /
translated: the aspect of being liberated from the bonds of desire, hatred, and ignorance; the aspect of subduing, abandoning, completely transcending, and definitely emerging from the desire for sense objects;

original: kun tu sbyor ba dgu dang bral ba'i rnam pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las rnam par thar pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dgu dang bral ba'i rnam pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las rnam par thar pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the aspect of being free from the nine fetters; and the aspect of being liberated from the suffering of birth and so forth.

original: de la rgyu lta bu'i @135b rnam pa gsum gyis ni nyon mongs pa las rnams pa grol ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la rgyu lta bu'i @135b rnam pa gsum gyis ni nyon mongs pa las rnams pa grol ba bstan to //
translated: Among these, the three aspects that are like causes teach liberation from afflictions.

original: tha ma'i 'bras bu lta bu'i rnam pa gcig gis ni sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba bstan te /
analyzed: tha ma'i 'bras bu lta bu'i rnam pa gcig gis ni sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba bstan te /
translated: The one aspect that is like the final result teaches liberation from suffering.

original: dper na mi la la zhig bcing ba rnam pa sna tshogs shing sgrob bam /
analyzed: dper na mi la la zhig bcing ba rnam pa sna tshogs shing sgrob bam /
translated: For example, suppose someone is bound in various ways with ropes

original: rtsva la dza'i thag pa'am /
analyzed: rtsva la dza'i thag pa'am /
translated: made of the grass called ‚Äúhemp‚Äù or

original: lcags thag rnams kyis btags la de srung ma'i mi gzhan dag kyang bkod nas de btson byed pa de las bros te rgyang ring du song zin kyang phyir khrid de 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lcags thag rnams kyis btags la de srung ma'i mi gzhan dag kyang bkod nas de btson byed pa de las bros te rgyang ring du song zin kyang phyir khrid de 'ong ba'am /
translated: Even if he escapes and goes far away, he will be brought back.

original: yang na 'gul du yang mi ster na /
analyzed: yang na 'gul du yang mi ster na /
translated: Or, if he is not allowed to move,

original: 'bros su lta ga la yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'bros su lta ga la yod pa'am /
translated: how could he possibly escape?

original: gzhan yang brtson byed pa de la 'dod pa'i yon tan rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs su chags su rung zhing kun tu sbyor bar byed pa dag dang ldan par byas na de dag la sems chags pas rang nyid 'bros par mi sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang brtson byed pa de la 'dod pa'i yon tan rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs su chags su rung zhing kun tu sbyor bar byed pa dag dang ldan par byas na de dag la sems chags pas rang nyid 'bros par mi sems te /
translated: Or, if he is given various kinds of extensive and desirable objects to which he becomes attached and with which he becomes involved, he will not think of escaping because his mind is attached to them.

original: de ltar mi bcing ba rnam pa thams cad kyis legs par bsrung ba dang / legs par bsdams pa'i bcing bas dam por bcings pa la ni dgras 'di lta ste /üîΩbrdeg pa dang / gnod par bya'am /
analyzed: de ltar mi bcing ba rnam pa thams cad kyis legs par bsrung ba dang / legs par bsdams pa'i bcing bas dam por bcings pa la ni dgras 'di lta ste / brdeg pa dang / gnod par bya'am /
translated: In this way, those who are not bound in every way are well protected and well restrained.üîΩBut those who are bound tightly with the bonds of restraint can be harmed by their enemies in various ways:üîΩthey can be beaten,üîΩpunished,

original: chad pas gcad pa'am /üîΩyang na gtan du gsad pa la ci dga' dgur byar yod la /
analyzed: chad pas gcad pa'am /üîΩyang na gtan du gsad pa la ci dga' dgur byar yod la /
translated: or killed at will.

original: de gang gi tshe brtson byed pa de las shor bar gyur na /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe brtson byed pa de las shor bar gyur na /
translated: When they are engaged in the practice and they slip up,üîΩthey are said to have slipped up from the four bonds.

original: bcing ba rnam pa bzhi las shor ba zhes brjod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gnas gsum po dag la kun tu rmongs pa'i sems can 'di dag kyang bcing ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcing ba rnam pa bzhi las shor ba zhes brjod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gnas gsum po dag la kun tu rmongs pa'i sems can 'di dag kyang bcing ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, these beings who are confused about the three realms are bound by various bonds, namely,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bcing ba rnams kyis bcings so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bcing ba rnams kyis bcings so //
translated: the bonds of desire, hatred, and delusion.üîΩTheir practice and protection are like the practice and protection of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe bad thoughts are like the bad thoughts of the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag gi brtson srung lta bu ni rtog pa ngan pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi brtson srung lta bu ni rtog pa ngan pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma bsal ba'o //
translated: The latent afflictions are like the latent afflictions of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la rtog pa ngan pa rnams kyis ni 'gul du'ang mi ster na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa ngan pa rnams kyis ni 'gul du'ang mi ster na /
translated: The bad thoughts prevent them from even moving,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bas 'bros su lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bas 'bros su lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they escape from desire?

original: bag la nyal rnams kyis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bros te /
analyzed: bag la nyal rnams kyis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bros te /
translated: The latent afflictions prevent them from escaping by the worldly path,

original: srid pa'i rtsi mo man chad du song du zin kyang phyir khrid de 'ong ngo //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtsi mo man chad du song du zin kyang phyir khrid de 'ong ngo //
translated: even if they go as far as the peak of existence, they are brought back.

original: de'i kun tu sbyor ba dgu ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lta bu yin te /üîΩde dag gi 'du byed rnams la rang nyid dga' bas bdag nyid bcings pa las rnam par thar par mi 'dod pa de ni de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs su legs par bsrung ba dang / shin tu thabs legs par dam por bcings pa dang /
analyzed: de'i kun tu sbyor ba dgu ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lta bu yin te / de dag gi 'du byed rnams la rang nyid dga' bas bdag nyid bcings pa las rnam par thar par mi 'dod pa de ni de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs su legs par bsrung ba dang / shin tu thabs legs par dam por bcings pa dang /
translated: The nine fetters are like the sense objects of desire.

original: @136a * // shin tu bsdoms nas bcings pa yin te /
analyzed: @136a * // shin tu bsdoms nas bcings pa yin te /
translated: He is not liberated from the bondage of his own delight in the formative forces of those fetters. He is well guarded in various ways, well bound with the best of bonds, and well restrained with the tightest of bonds.üîΩHe is liberated from the four bonds, like a person who is bound with a rope, a snare, a chain, and an iron fetter.

original: bdud bzhi'i dgra rnams kyis skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsgrub pa la ci dga' dgur byar yod pa de de las thar bar gyur na de kho na dang 'dra bar bcing ba rnam pa bzhi las rnam par grol ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i dgra rnams kyis skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsgrub pa la ci dga' dgur byar yod pa de de las thar bar gyur na de kho na dang 'dra bar bcing ba rnam pa bzhi las rnam par grol ba zhes brjod do //
translated: When he is liberated from those, he is said to be completely liberated from the four bonds.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni ; man ngag bsdus dang man ngag 'bras //
analyzed: sdom ni ; man ngag bsdus dang man ngag 'bras //
translated: The instruction is summarized as the result of the instruction.

original: 'chi dang grangs su 'gro ba dang // yongs su shes dang spong ba gsum //
analyzed: 'chi dang grangs su 'gro ba dang // yongs su shes dang spong ba gsum //
translated: Death, going to the number, and the three thorough understandings and abandonments.

original: 'ching dang shin tu rnam par grol //
analyzed: 'ching dang shin tu rnam par grol //
translated: Bondage and complete liberation.

original: lta dang nga rgyal kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: lta dang nga rgyal kun nyon mongs //
translated: View, pride, and all the afflictions

original: rnam par byang ba brjod pa'i gnas //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba brjod pa'i gnas //
translated: are the basis for the expression of purification.

original: rab tu dben pa rnam bzhi dang // phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa rnam bzhi dang // phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum //
translated: The four kinds of solitude and the three kinds of excellenceüîΩare the basis for the expression of the vehicle.

original: nyan thos ni rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis ston pa las gdams ngag bsdus te tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos ni rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis ston pa las gdams ngag bsdus te tshol bar byed do //
translated: The disciple seeks instruction from the teacher for three reasons.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: thos pa lhur byed cing de ma yin pa'i nan tan du bsgrub pa dag la mi phyogs pa rnams ni bsdus pa'i chos thos pa tsam gyis kyang rang gi don thob par 'gyur bas na thos pa lhur len pa don med pa dang / nan tan du bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig gces par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir thos pa lhur len pa las mos pa bzlog pa'i don dang /
analyzed: thos pa lhur byed cing de ma yin pa'i nan tan du bsgrub pa dag la mi phyogs pa rnams ni bsdus pa'i chos thos pa tsam gyis kyang rang gi don thob par 'gyur bas na thos pa lhur len pa don med pa dang / nan tan du bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig gces par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir thos pa lhur len pa las mos pa bzlog pa'i don dang /
translated: Those who are devoted to listening to the teachings and who are not inclined to practice the teachings other than those they have heard, will attain their goal simply by listening to the teachings. Therefore, the teacher should discourage their devotion to listening to the teachings and should encourage them to practice the teachings.

original: bya ba mang po'am skrag ste 'jug pa la mi phyogs pa rnams thabs kyis 'jug par bya ba'i don dang / yang na de nyid chos mang po legs par thos shing legs par bsams pa yin pas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bya ba mang po'am skrag ste 'jug pa la mi phyogs pa rnams thabs kyis 'jug par bya ba'i don dang / yang na de nyid chos mang po legs par thos shing legs par bsams pa yin pas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or else, since he has heard and properly contemplated many teachings, he thinks as follows.

original: bdag ni chos mang po legs par thos shing legs par bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni chos mang po legs par thos shing legs par bsams pa yin te /
translated: I have heard and properly contemplated many teachings.

original: gal te bdag chos rnam ji snyed bdag gis thos shing bsams pa de dag thams cad la brten nas sems gnas pa'i dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te bdag chos rnam ji snyed bdag gis thos shing bsams pa de dag thams cad la brten nas sems gnas pa'i dmigs pa'am /
translated: If I were to focus my mind on all the teachings I have heard and contemplated,

original: rnam par grol ba'i dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'dogs na ni bdag gi yid la byed pa yang rnam par 'khrug par 'gyur ba sems gnas pa yang thob par mi 'gyur na /üîΩrnam par grol bar lta ga la 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'dogs na ni bdag gi yid la byed pa yang rnam par 'khrug par 'gyur ba sems gnas pa yang thob par mi 'gyur na / rnam par grol bar lta ga la 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: my attention would be disturbed and I would not achieve mental stability, let alone liberation.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos de dag las gang la brten na dmigs pa la sems gnas pa'am /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos de dag las gang la brten na dmigs pa la sems gnas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, he focuses his mind on the meaning of the teachings he has heard and contemplated.

original: rnam par thar par bya ba la mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / myur du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang nges pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par thar par bya ba la mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / myur du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty that one will quickly attain the superknowledges in order to liberate others, or that one will quickly attain liberation.

original: de de ltar @136b bdag nyid la nges pa med par ston pa'am /
analyzed: de de ltar @136b bdag nyid la nges pa med par ston pa'am /
translated: Thus, one should not be certain about oneself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos mkhas pa mngon sum du gyur par mthong nas tha dad du song ste gdams ngag bsdus pa tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos mkhas pa mngon sum du gyur par mthong nas tha dad du song ste gdams ngag bsdus pa tshol bar byed do //
translated: Or, having seen a learned disciple of the Tathagata, one should go to him and seek the condensed instructions.

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi 'bras bu ni rang gi don thob pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi 'bras bu ni rang gi don thob pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The result of the true instructions should be understood as the four kinds of attainment of one's own goal.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: gang gi don du rab tu 'byung ba dang / ji ltar rab tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du rab tu 'byung ba dang / ji ltar rab tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: the goal for which one goes forth, and how one goes forth;

original: cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas gtong zhing len pa phun sum tshogs pa de la brten nas bla na med pa 'thob pa dang / tshe 'di la 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas gtong zhing len pa phun sum tshogs pa de la brten nas bla na med pa 'thob pa dang / tshe 'di la 'thob pa dang /
translated: the perfection of one's appearance, the perfection of one's actions, the perfection of one's thoughts, and the perfection of one's relinquishment and acceptance of one's dwelling place; based on that, the attainment of the unsurpassed, the attainment in this life, and the attainment in other lives.

original: bdag gis 'thob pa dang / so so rang rig pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'thob pa dang / so so rang rig pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the attainment of the self, and the attainment of the self-realization.

original: drug po 'di dag ni 'chi ba yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: drug po 'di dag ni 'chi ba yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are six kinds of death:

original: 'das pa'i 'chi ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'chi ba dang / ma dul ba'i 'chi ba dang / dul ba'i 'chi pa dang / 'dra ba'i 'chi ba dang / mi 'dra ba'i 'cho ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'chi ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'chi ba dang / ma dul ba'i 'chi ba dang / dul ba'i 'chi pa dang / 'dra ba'i 'chi ba dang / mi 'dra ba'i 'cho ba'o //
translated: death in the past, death in the present, death of the untamed, death of the tamed, death of the like, and death of the unlike.

original: de la 'das pa'i 'chi ba ni 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams 'pho ba nas /
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i 'chi ba ni 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams 'pho ba nas /
translated: Death in the past is the death of past formations, from the time of their passing away

original: srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i bar gyi 'chi ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i bar gyi 'chi ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: until the cessation of the life faculty.üîΩDeath in the present is the death of present formations, from the time of their passing away

original: de la da ltar byung ba'i 'chi ba ni da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams 'pho ba dang / srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i bar gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la da ltar byung ba'i 'chi ba ni da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams 'pho ba dang / srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i bar gang yin pa'o //
translated: until the cessation of the life faculty.

original: de la ma dul ba'i 'chi ba ni 'das pa'i dus na ma dul zhing ma zhi la bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams gcig la gcig bag la nyal ba dang / tha snyad du gdags pa'i skyes bu'i bag la nyal ba rnams kyis shi nas da ltar byung ba'i dus na nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de la ma dul ba'i 'chi ba ni 'das pa'i dus na ma dul zhing ma zhi la bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams gcig la gcig bag la nyal ba dang / tha snyad du gdags pa'i skyes bu'i bag la nyal ba rnams kyis shi nas da ltar byung ba'i dus na nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Undisciplined death is when undisciplined, unpacified formations with latent states link with latent states in the present from past latent states of an individual designated conventionally after death.üîΩWhen the life span is exhausted in the present, the body is fully grasped by formations with latent states and is established.

original: bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus mngon par 'grub pa la da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang tshe'i mtha' zad par byas nas de bzhin dum dul zhing rnam par ma dul ba nas rgyas par shi nas ma 'ongs pa na
analyzed: bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus mngon par 'grub pa la da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang tshe'i mtha' zad par byas nas de bzhin dum dul zhing rnam par ma dul ba nas rgyas par shi nas ma 'ongs pa na
translated: Undisciplined death is when undisciplined, unpacified formations with latent states link with latent states in the future from undisciplined, unpacified formations with latent states in the present after death.

original: lus mngon par 'grub cing bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams nye bar len pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lus mngon par 'grub cing bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams nye bar len pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The body is fully grasped by formations with latent states and is established.

original: de dag nye bar blangs pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba chen po rnams kyis bcings so //
analyzed: de dag nye bar blangs pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba chen po rnams kyis bcings so //
translated: Because they appropriate them, they are bound by the specific sufferings of birth and so on, and by the great bonds of attachment and so on.

original: de la dul ba'i 'chi ba ni da @137a * //
analyzed: de la dul ba'i 'chi ba ni da @137a * //
translated: Death of the tamed is as follows.

original: ltar gyi dus na dul zhing rnam par dul la bag la nyal med pa shi nas ma 'ongs pa na lus mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ltar gyi dus na dul zhing rnam par dul la bag la nyal med pa shi nas ma 'ongs pa na lus mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: At the time of death, one is tamed, fully tamed, and without latent tendencies. After death, one does not form a body in the future.

original: bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams nye bar mi len pa ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams nye bar mi len pa ste /
translated: One does not appropriate the formations that have latent tendencies.

original: de dag nye bar ma blangs pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba chen po rnams las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nye bar ma blangs pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba chen po rnams las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not appropriate them, they are liberated from the specific sufferings of birth and so on, and from the great bonds of attachment and so on.

original: de la 'dra ba'i 'chi ba ni gal te 'das pa'i dus na ji ltar ma dul ba bzhin du shi ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang 'chi ba de ni de 'dra ba'i 'chi ba yin te ;
analyzed: de la 'dra ba'i 'chi ba ni gal te 'das pa'i dus na ji ltar ma dul ba bzhin du shi ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang 'chi ba de ni de 'dra ba'i 'chi ba yin te ;
translated: Similar death is when one dies in the present just as one was undisciplined in the past.

original: mtshungs pa'i 'chi ba dang / mthun pa'i 'chi ba yang de yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i 'chi ba dang / mthun pa'i 'chi ba yang de yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is similar death, and it should be understood as equal death and compatible death.

original: de ma yin pa 'das pa'i dus na ma dul ba'i 'chi ba'i dus byas la da ltar byung ba'i dus na dul bar 'gyur te /üîΩshi ba de ni de'i mi 'dra ba'i 'chi ba yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa 'das pa'i dus na ma dul ba'i 'chi ba'i dus byas la da ltar byung ba'i dus na dul bar 'gyur te / shi ba de ni de'i mi 'dra ba'i 'chi ba yin te /
translated: Different death is when one dies in the present disciplined, but was undisciplined in the past.

original: mi mtshungs pa'i 'chi ba dang ; mi mthun pa'i 'chi ba yang de yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed bag la nyal dang bcas pa rnams ni gcig la gcig bag la nyal bzhin du 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa'i 'chi ba dang ; mi mthun pa'i 'chi ba yang de yin par rig par bya'o // de la da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed bag la nyal dang bcas pa rnams ni gcig la gcig bag la nyal bzhin du 'pho ba ste /
translated: This is different death, and it should be understood as unequal death and incompatible death.üîΩIn this regard, the present formations with their latent tendencies are transferred to one another.

original: 'das pa ni de kho na bzhin du 'dra ba'i 'chi bas 'chi 'pho zhing mthun par 'chi la /
analyzed: 'das pa ni de kho na bzhin du 'dra ba'i 'chi bas 'chi 'pho zhing mthun par 'chi la /
translated: Past formations with their latent tendencies are transferred to the present.

original: 'das pa na mthun par 'chi ba de dang 'dra ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyud la nying mtshams sbyor zhing ma 'ongs pa nye bar len to //
analyzed: 'das pa na mthun par 'chi ba de dang 'dra ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyud la nying mtshams sbyor zhing ma 'ongs pa nye bar len to //
translated: The death of the past is similar to the death of the present, and the death of the present is similar to the death of the future.

original: 'chi ba rnam pa drug po de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba rnam pa drug po de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: These six kinds of death should be understood as two kinds:

original: 'du byed 'jug pa'i nyes dmigs dang / 'du byed ldog pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: 'du byed 'jug pa'i nyes dmigs dang / 'du byed ldog pa'i phan yon no //
translated: the disadvantage of the engagement of the formative forces and the benefit of the cessation of the formative forces.

original: de la 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma dul ba dang / 'dra ba'i 'chi ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i nye bar len pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i phyir ni 'du byed 'jug pa'i nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: de la 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma dul ba dang / 'dra ba'i 'chi ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i nye bar len pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i phyir ni 'du byed 'jug pa'i nyes dmigs so //
translated: The disadvantage of the engagement of the formative forces refers to the death of the past and present, the death of the undisciplined, the appropriation of the future, the suffering of birth, etc. and the bondage of moral defilement such as passion.

original: da ltar byung ba na dul ba dang mi 'dra ba'i 'chi ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na nye bar mi len pa dang / sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ni 'du byed ldog pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na dul ba dang mi 'dra ba'i 'chi ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na nye bar mi len pa dang / sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ni 'du byed ldog pa'i phan yon no //
translated: The benefit of the cessation of formations is that one is disciplined in the present, unlike those who are not disciplined; one is free from appropriation in the future; and one is liberated from the bonds of suffering and the afflictions.

original: 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa la ni rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis gdags pa'i skyes @137b bu'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa la ni rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis gdags pa'i skyes @137b bu'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: The enumeration of the individual who is designated as the one who establishes formations is due to these eight aspects.

original: ming ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: Name is such and such.üîΩLineage is such and such.

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: Clan is such and such.

original: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: Food is such and such.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong /
translated: One experiences such and such happiness and suffering.

original: tshe ni 'di ltar ring /
analyzed: tshe ni 'di ltar ring /
translated: Life is such and such.

original: yun ni 'di srid du gnas /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid du gnas /
translated: One remains for such and such a duration.

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig ces bya ba ste /
translated: The limit of life is such and such.

original: rnam pa 'di dag gi dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gi dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification of these aspects is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i sngon gyi gnas las brtsams pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i sngon gyi gnas las brtsams pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi in the section on the recollection of former abodes.

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag med par yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag med par yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of compounded things and the abandonment of it should be understood as threefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nang yongs su shes pa dang / phyi rol yongs su shes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: nang yongs su shes pa dang / phyi rol yongs su shes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the internal, the knowledge of the external, and the knowledge of the internal and external.

original: spong ba yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩde yang 'du byed 'di dag ni bdag ma yin no //üîΩ'di dag ni bdag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: spong ba yang de dang 'dra'o // de yang 'du byed 'di dag ni bdag ma yin no // 'di dag ni bdag gi ma yin no //
translated: Abandonment is similar to that.üîΩMoreover, one should understand the knowledge and abandonment of the internal, external, and both as appropriate, thinking:

original: 'di dag ni gzhan su'i yang ma yin no snyam du nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzhan su'i yang ma yin no snyam du nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese compounded things are not the self.üîΩThey are not mine.üîΩThey are not the self of another.‚Äù

original: de la chos kyi lugs shes pas nges par byas pa ni yongs su shes so //
analyzed: de la chos kyi lugs shes pas nges par byas pa ni yongs su shes so //
translated: Therein, the knowledge of the Dharma is the ascertainment of the knowledge of the internal, external, and both.

original: de la goms pas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bag la nyal spangs pa ni de spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la goms pas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bag la nyal spangs pa ni de spong ba yin no //
translated: By becoming familiar with that, the latent tendency that is associated with that is abandoned, and that is the abandonment of that.

original: de la gang gis 'du byed rnams yongs su ma shes pa de la ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ston pa chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de la gang gis 'du byed rnams yongs su ma shes pa de la ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ston pa chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Teacher teaches the Dharma in order to bring about complete knowledge for those who have not completely known formations.

original: gang gis yongs su shes la ma spangs pa de ni ji ltar thob pa'i yongs su shes pa la goms pa tsam gyis de spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par 'dzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gis yongs su shes la ma spangs pa de ni ji ltar thob pa'i yongs su shes pa la goms pa tsam gyis de spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par 'dzud par mdzad do //
translated: He also causes those who have completely known but not abandoned to enter into the abandonment of that by means of the mere cultivation of the complete knowledge that has been obtained.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'khor bar 'jug pa na 'ching ba yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'khor bar 'jug pa na 'ching ba yin te /
translated: These three are bonds when entering into sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: de dag las sems rnam par grol bar dka'o //
analyzed: de dag las sems rnam par grol bar dka'o //
translated: and it is difficult for the mind to be liberated from them.

original: de yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi nyes par bshad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi nyes par bshad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, one is liberated from them through the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, not through the poorly proclaimed.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ma gtogs pa de ma yin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyis kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ma gtogs pa de ma yin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyis kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is the fetters other than the fetter of attachment, which fetter the mind to the object.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gang yin pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor bas kun tu chags par byed pa ste /üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gang yin pa dang / phyi @138a * //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gang yin pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor bas kun tu chags par byed pa ste / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gang yin pa dang / phyi @138a * //
translated: It is the object that is defiled by the fetter of attachment, which is the cause of the arising of the future existence.

original: ma la yang srid pa 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: ma la yang srid pa 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: It is the formations that bring about the arising of the future existence.

original: 'ching ba rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis sems rnam par grol bar dka' ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis sems rnam par grol bar dka' ste /
translated: Among these three kinds of bonds, the mind is difficult to liberate from the three causes.

original: dang po ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir ro //
translated: The first is difficult to liberate because of its various aspects.

original: gnyis pa ni khong du zhen pa dang 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni khong du zhen pa dang 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is difficult to liberate because it is the object of attachment and desire.

original: gsum pa ni cha phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni cha phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is difficult to liberate because it is subtle.

original: rnam pa lngas yang srid par 'ching bas bcings pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa lnga kun tu spyod par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas yang srid par 'ching bas bcings pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa lnga kun tu spyod par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: They are the basis, the object, the companion, the nature, and the cause and effect.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas yod pa dang med pa la dmigs te /üîΩphyi ma la bdag yod par 'gyur ram //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas yod pa dang med pa la dmigs te / phyi ma la bdag yod par 'gyur ram //
translated: The basis is the perishable collection view. The object is existence and non-existence.üîΩOne thinks, ‚ÄúWill I exist in the future or not?

original: 'on te med par 'gyur snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te med par 'gyur snyam pa'o //
translated: Or will I not exist?‚Äù

original: de la med pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa gcig tu zad do //üîΩyod pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la med pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa gcig tu zad do // yod pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The object of non-existence is exhausted in one way.üîΩThe object of existence is fivefold.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩbdag gzugs can du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag gzugs can du 'gyur ram /
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pas 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus dang brtson pa mi 'dor ba ste /

analyzed: ngan ngon gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus so //
