original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The secondary defilements of calm abiding and insight are to be applied in order.

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa spangs nas chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yang dag par zhugs so //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa spangs nas chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yang dag par zhugs so //
translated: Having abandoned torpor, sleep, excitement, and regret, one enters into calm abiding and insight in a way that is not wasted.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba'i phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba'i phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: These three are the perfections of the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya:

original: gsum gang zhe na /üîΩnan tan du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras @140a * //
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na / nan tan du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras @140a * //
translated: What are the three?üîΩThe perfection of practice,üîΩthe perfection of result,

original: bu phun sum tshogs pa dang // ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bu phun sum tshogs pa dang // ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of the teacher.

original: de la nan tan du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i khams rnams thob par bya ba dang / reg par bya ba'i phyir chos nyan zhing gzhan dag la yang ston par byed la bdag nyid kyang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nan tan du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i khams rnams thob par bya ba dang / reg par bya ba'i phyir chos nyan zhing gzhan dag la yang ston par byed la bdag nyid kyang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of practice is listening to the Dharma and teaching others in order to attain and touch the realms of abandonment, freedom from attachment, and cessation.

original: 'di ni nan tan du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nan tan du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of practice.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of result?

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Based on that very practice of the Dharma that accords with the Dharma,

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: one's mind becomes completely liberated.

original: tshe de nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa 'di ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa 'di ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Attaining nirvana in that very life is the perfection of result.

original: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni tshangs bar spyod pa dang chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba bcom ldan 'das yin la ;
analyzed: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni tshangs bar spyod pa dang chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba bcom ldan 'das yin la ;
translated: The perfect teacher is the Lord, the one who practices pure conduct and is the root of all Dharmas.

original: de'i tshul 'jug par mdzad cing de'i rjes su 'brang bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i tshul 'jug par mdzad cing de'i rjes su 'brang bar mdzad de /
translated: He is the one who introduces the way of life and follows it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung na bstan pa de dag yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung na bstan pa de dag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the Tathagata appears, these teachings exist.

original: de bas na de dag gi rtsa ba ni bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi rtsa ba ni bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord is their root.

original: byung nas kyang de dang de dag tu 'dul bar gzigs te bstan pas na /üîΩgang gi phyir dam pa'i chos kyi tshul 'di slob dpon dang slob ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi tshul can no //
analyzed: byung nas kyang de dang de dag tu 'dul bar gzigs te bstan pas na / gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos kyi tshul 'di slob dpon dang slob ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi tshul can no //
translated: Having appeared, he sees what is to be disciplined in this and that place and teaches it.üîΩSince this way of the true Dharma has come down through a succession of teachers and disciples, it is the way of the Lord.

original: de ltar chos kyi tshul zhugs par byas pa'i the tshom skyes pa thams cad la bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'brang bas na de'i phyir de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi tshul zhugs par byas pa'i the tshom skyes pa thams cad la bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'brang bas na de'i phyir de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: Since all doubts that arise in those who have entered the way of the Dharma follow only the Lord, they are followers of the Lord.

original: chos smra ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis yod de gzhan las thos nas ston pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis yod de gzhan las thos nas ston pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: The Dharma teacher is of two kinds, from the point of view of scriptural instruction and personal realization.

original: ston pa ni tshul bzhin du zhugs pa'i dus gsum du legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mdzad de mngon par 'du byed pa dang / thad du 'ong ba dang / zhu ba'i dus rnams su'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni tshul bzhin du zhugs pa'i dus gsum du legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mdzad de mngon par 'du byed pa dang / thad du 'ong ba dang / zhu ba'i dus rnams su'o //
translated: The teacher is one who has entered the way properly, and at the three times gives his approval, in the three times of preparation, actual accomplishment, and completion.

original: sdom ni / 'du shes rnam pa byis pa'i rtags //
analyzed: sdom ni / 'du shes rnam pa byis pa'i rtags //
translated: The summary for this chapter is: The signs of the childish are the discriminations,

original: mig dang phan yon 'gyur ba dang / shes pa dgu dang brjed mi ngas //
analyzed: mig dang phan yon 'gyur ba dang / shes pa dgu dang brjed mi ngas //
translated: The eye, the benefit, the change, the nine knowledges, the unforgettings,

original: khyad par dag tu 'gro ba dang // bdag tu lta ba'i bye brag dang // 'du byed mtshan nyid @140b rnam pa gsum //üîΩchos kyi mdo la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: khyad par dag tu 'gro ba dang // bdag tu lta ba'i bye brag dang // 'du byed mtshan nyid @140b rnam pa gsum // chos kyi mdo la sogs pa yi //
translated: The progress to the distinctions, the varieties of the view of self, and the three aspects of the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: sde tshan rgya chen tha ma yin //
analyzed: sde tshan rgya chen tha ma yin //
translated: The last of the great divisions is the Dharma chapter, etc.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgom pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgom pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: These five are the aspects of the contemplation of impermanence with regard to the conditioned.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi rtag pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / ther zug ma yin pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / ther zug ma yin pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: and subject to change.

original: de la skad cig re re la 'jig pas na mi rtag pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la skad cig re re la 'jig pas na mi rtag pa rnams so //
translated: They are impermanent because they perish from moment to moment.

original: tshe'i tshad nges pa dang 'brel pa'i lus su gnas pas na mi brtan pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad nges pa dang 'brel pa'i lus su gnas pas na mi brtan pa rnams so //
translated: They are unstable because they exist in a body that is connected with a limited life span.

original: phyi rol pa rnams kyang bskal ba gcig las ring du mi gnas par nges par na ther zug ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams kyang bskal ba gcig las ring du mi gnas par nges par na ther zug ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: They are not eternal because even non-Buddhists are certain to not remain for more than one eon.

original: tshe'i mthar ma phyin par yang dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rkyen rnams kyis 'jig par 'gyur ba srid pas na yid brtan du mi rung ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshe'i mthar ma phyin par yang dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rkyen rnams kyis 'jig par 'gyur ba srid pas na yid brtan du mi rung ba rnams so //
translated: They are not reliable because it is possible for them to be destroyed by the conditions of untimely death before the end of their life span.

original: ji srid tsam gyi bar du 'khor ba de srid tsam gyi bar du yang gcig tu nges par bde ba med pas na de'i phyir 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: ji srid tsam gyi bar du 'khor ba de srid tsam gyi bar du yang gcig tu nges par bde ba med pas na de'i phyir 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: They are subject to change because there is no certainty of happiness for even as long as one remains in cyclic existence.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni byis pa rnams kyi byis pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni byis pa rnams kyi byis pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: These three are the childish characteristics of the childish.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: byis pas de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa rnam pa lnga yid la ma byas pas ngan pa dang bzang po yongs su ma grub pa rnams la ngan pa dang bzang por rtog pa'i sgo nas gzhan rnams dang bdag la yongs su 'jal bar byed de
analyzed: byis pas de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa rnam pa lnga yid la ma byas pas ngan pa dang bzang po yongs su ma grub pa rnams la ngan pa dang bzang por rtog pa'i sgo nas gzhan rnams dang bdag la yongs su 'jal bar byed de
translated: Because fools do not contemplate the five aspects of impermanence of conditioned entities in this way, they conceive of the good and bad that are not established as good and bad, and they compare themselves to others.

original: / bdag che'o snyam du rlom sems su byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni byis pa'i rtags dang pa'o //
analyzed: / bdag che'o snyam du rlom sems su byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni byis pa'i rtags dang pa'o //
translated: The pride that thinks, ‚ÄúI am great,‚Äù is the first sign of a fool.

original: che ba ji lta ba bzhin du mtshungs pa dang / chung ngu yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: che ba ji lta ba bzhin du mtshungs pa dang / chung ngu yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as with the great, so it is with the equal and the small.

original: snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Connect this as before.

original: de nyid las bzlog pa gsum ni mkhas pa rnams kyi mkhas pa'i rtags yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las bzlog pa gsum ni mkhas pa rnams kyi mkhas pa'i rtags yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three that are the opposite of those should be known as the signs of the wise.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The eye of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas should be known as twofold purity.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang bral bas na rdul med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang bral bas na rdul med pa'o //
translated: It is without dust because it is free from the entanglements of the defilements to be destroyed by insight.

original: de'i bag la nyal dang bral bas na dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bag la nyal dang bral bas na dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from the propensities to those.

original: gzhan yang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe yid la byed pa la zhugs pa na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rags pa spel mar 'dug ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe yid la byed pa la zhugs pa na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rags pa spel mar 'dug ste /
translated: Moreover, when one enters into mental attention at the time of realization, the gross pride of ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is eliminated.

original: de'i gzung ba'i 'dzin pa la dmigs pa mgo mnyam du yongs su shes pas spong bar 'gyur la de spangs pas na rdul med pa'o //üîΩmthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la @141a * //
analyzed: de'i gzung ba'i 'dzin pa la dmigs pa mgo mnyam du yongs su shes pas spong bar 'gyur la de spangs pas na rdul med pa'o // mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la @141a * //
translated: It is without dust because it is eliminated by the complete knowledge of the equality of the object of the grasping of its objective support.

original: nyal thams cad spangs pas na dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyal thams cad spangs pas na dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from all the propensities to the defilements to be destroyed by insight.

original: rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba des chos rnams la chos kyi mig thob pa'i mod la phan yon bcu 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba des chos rnams la chos kyi mig thob pa'i mod la phan yon bcu 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Immediately upon attaining the Dharma eye with regard to phenomena, one should know that ten benefits arise.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams legs par mthong bas na chos mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams legs par mthong bas na chos mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called one who sees the Dharma because one sees well the four noble truths.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang yang rung ba thob pas na chos thob pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde dag nyid kyis thob par rig par 'gyur to //üîΩbdag gi sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams zad do //üîΩbdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no snyam pa nas rgyas par sbyar te /üîΩde ltar na chos rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang yang rung ba thob pas na chos thob pa zhes bya'o // de dag nyid kyis thob par rig par 'gyur to // bdag gi sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams zad do // bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no snyam pa nas rgyas par sbyar te / de ltar na chos rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called one who obtains the Dharma because one obtains any of the fruits of the sramana.üîΩOne is called one who knows the Dharma because one knows the Dharma as it truly is.

original: shes nas dang ba thob pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas na chos kyi gting slebs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes nas dang ba thob pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas na chos kyi gting slebs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called one who has reached the depths of the Dharma because one has reached the depths of the Dharma.

original: de ni bdag gis thob pa la yang som nyi med la gzhan rnams kyis thob pa la the tshom med do //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis thob pa la yang som nyi med la gzhan rnams kyis thob pa la the tshom med do //
translated: One is called one who has attained confidence because one has attained confidence in the three jewels.üîΩOne is called one who has attained the certainty of perfection because one has attained the certainty of perfection.üîΩOne is called one who has attained the certainty of the stage because one has attained the certainty of the stage.üîΩOne is called one who has attained the certainty of the lineage because one has attained the certainty of the lineage.üîΩOne is called one who has attained the certainty of the result because one has attained the certainty of the result.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod pa la yang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod pa la yang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ste /
translated: He is not dependent on others for the teaching of the truths of the noble ones.

original: gzhan dag gi ngor lta zhing ngor rtog pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ngor lta zhing ngor rtog pa med do //
translated: He does not look to others, does not rely on others.

original: pha rol rgol ba la sogs pa thams cad kyis kyang chos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba la sogs pa thams cad kyis kyang chos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not carried away by any opponents.

original: de ni bdag gis thob pa'i shes pa brda sprod pa la yang 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis thob pa'i shes pa brda sprod pa la yang 'jigs pa med do //
translated: He is fearless in proclaiming his own knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i brda dang / don dam pa'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis kyang bstan pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i brda dang / don dam pa'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis kyang bstan pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is engaged in teaching with the two kinds of knowledge: conventional knowledge and ultimate knowledge.

original: shes pa dgu po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams yongs su shes pa dang / yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa dgu po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams yongs su shes pa dang / yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These nine knowledges are the knowledge of the compositional factors, and the transcendence of the compositional factors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa shes pa dang / ldog pa shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu shes pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu shes pa dang / rnam par byang ba shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa shes pa dang / ldog pa shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu shes pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu shes pa dang / rnam par byang ba shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang /
translated: Knowledge of the engagement of formations, knowledge of their cessation, knowledge of the cause of defilement, knowledge of the cause of purification, knowledge of purification, knowledge of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of the origin of suffering, knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and knowledge of the path.

original: de la 'jug pa shes pa ni mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gsum byung bas 'du byed thams cad kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa shes pa ni mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gsum byung bas 'du byed thams cad kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of engagement is the knowledge that all formations originate from the occurrence of three kinds of causes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: dga' ba byung ba dang / reg pa byung ba dang / ming dang gzugs byung ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba byung ba dang / reg pa byung ba dang / ming dang gzugs byung ba ste /
translated: the occurrence of joy, the occurrence of contact, and the occurrence of name-and-form.

original: @141b gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: @141b gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied appropriately to form, feeling, etc., and consciousness.

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum po nyid 'gags pas 'du byed rnam pa gsum po 'gag par 'gyur bas na ldog pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum po nyid 'gags pas 'du byed rnam pa gsum po 'gag par 'gyur bas na ldog pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of cessation is the knowledge that the cessation of three kinds of formations occurs through the cessation of three kinds of causes.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu dang rnam par byang ba shes pa rnams ni mnog dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba rnams kyi skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu dang rnam par byang ba shes pa rnams ni mnog dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba rnams kyi skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The causes of defilement and the causes of purification and the knowledge of purification should be understood as the occasion of the disadvantages, the disadvantages, and the renunciation, as previously explained.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi shes pa yang snga ma kho na bzhin du bden pa rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi shes pa yang snga ma kho na bzhin du bden pa rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the noble truths of suffering, etc. should be understood as the method of discerning the truths, as previously explained.

original: de la shes pa snga ma lnga so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su kun tu bstan pa las ni phyi ma'i bden pa shes pa bzhi thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la shes pa snga ma lnga so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su kun tu bstan pa las ni phyi ma'i bden pa shes pa bzhi thob par 'gyur te /
translated: From the teaching of the first five knowledges in the stage of ordinary people, the four subsequent knowledges of the truths are obtained.

original: de dag thob pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed rnams yongs su shes so //üîΩshes pa snga ma de dag ma tshang bar gyur na ni bden pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de dag thob pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed rnams yongs su shes so // shes pa snga ma de dag ma tshang bar gyur na ni bden pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: By obtaining them, one fully understands the conditioned things as they are.

original: 'du byed rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba'i skal pa med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba'i skal pa med do //
translated: If those previous knowledges are incomplete, one does not have the fortune to fully understand the conditioned things by the method of the truths.

original: tshad bar yod na ni bden pa'i tshul gyis skal ba yod de /
analyzed: tshad bar yod na ni bden pa'i tshul gyis skal ba yod de /
translated: If one has the capacity, one has the fortune in terms of reality.

original: gzhan yang 'du byed yongs su shes pa med na ni gong du bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i skal ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du byed yongs su shes pa med na ni gong du bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i skal ba med do //
translated: Moreover, if one does not fully understand the formative forces, one does not have the fortune to transcend all the formative forces by abandoning all the defilements through the power of meditative development as described above.

original: de las bzlog pa la ni skal ba yod de /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la ni skal ba yod de /
translated: But if it is the opposite of that, one has the fortune.

original: de bas na shes pa dgu 'du byed rnams yongs su shes pa dang / yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa dgu 'du byed rnams yongs su shes pa dang / yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the formative forces is described as the nine-fold understanding and the transcendence of the formative forces.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni gnas gsum gyis 'du byed thams cad la brjed ngas pa med par gnas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni gnas gsum gyis 'du byed thams cad la brjed ngas pa med par gnas te /
translated: The spiritual practitioner dwells without forgetfulness in regard to all the formative forces through three stations.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la ni mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la ni mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands as it really is that the formative forces of the past are impermanent.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams la ni 'jig pa'i chos can dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni skye ba dang 'jig par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams la ni 'jig pa'i chos can dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni skye ba dang 'jig par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that present formations have the nature of destruction.

original: de de ltar dus gsum gyi 'du byed rnams la rmongs pa med cing kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas bde ba la reg par gnas te /
analyzed: de de ltar dus gsum gyi 'du byed rnams la rmongs pa med cing kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas bde ba la reg par gnas te /
translated: He dwells in bliss, being free from delusion and affliction with regard to the formations of the three times.

original: reg pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su yang 'gro'o //üîΩde las bzlog pa ni brjed ngas par gnas pa dang / ma rig pa dang / @142a * //
analyzed: reg pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su yang 'gro'o // de las bzlog pa ni brjed ngas par gnas pa dang / ma rig pa dang / @142a * //
translated: He is also counted among those who are ‚Äúendowed with contact.‚Äù

original: ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is to be ‚Äúendowed with forgetfulness‚Äù and ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: gsum po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: These three are synonyms for affliction.

original: de dag ni phal cher kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su bstan par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni phal cher kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su bstan par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are taught as being mostly on the side of affliction.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod chags kyi rnam grangs dang / zhe sdang gi rnam grangs dang / gti mug gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rnam grangs dang / zhe sdang gi rnam grangs dang / gti mug gi rnam grangs so //
translated: the synonyms for desire, the synonyms for hatred, and the synonyms for delusion.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi rnam grangs ni /üîΩdga' ba dang / 'dod chags dang / lta ba yod pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / 'dun pa dang / byams pa dang / 'phangs pa dang / kun gnas pa dang / nges par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi rnam grangs ni / dga' ba dang / 'dod chags dang / lta ba yod pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / 'dun pa dang / byams pa dang / 'phangs pa dang / kun gnas pa dang / nges par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang /
translated: The synonyms for desire are:

original: 'dod pa dang / chags pa dang / sred pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang / skom pa'o //üîΩde la zhe sdang gi rnam grangs ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / chags pa dang / sred pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang / skom pa'o // de la zhe sdang gi rnam grangs ni /
translated: joy, desire, having a view, delight, aspiration, love, attachment, complete dwelling, firm adherence, and excessive adherence.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩkhong khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems dang / khro ba dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / mi bzod pa dang / yid mi ches pa dang / drag pa dang / 'chur ba dang / rtsub por smra ba dang / nang pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / khong khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems dang / khro ba dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / mi bzod pa dang / yid mi ches pa dang / drag pa dang / 'chur ba dang / rtsub por smra ba dang / nang pa dang /
translated: The synonyms for anger are:üîΩanger, hostility, malice, wrath, complete resentment, intolerance, lack of confidence, violence, harshness, harsh speech, and

original: 'khrug pa dang / gnod par sems pa dang / dom zum gnag ste 'dug pa dang / 'khrugs pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa dang / gnod par sems pa dang / dom zum gnag ste 'dug pa dang / 'khrugs pa skyed pa'o //
translated: quarrelsomeness.

analyzed: de la gti mug gi rnam grangs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The synonyms for delusion are:

analyzed: mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtogs pa dang / mun pa lta bu dang / rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa dang / mun nag lta bu ste /
translated: ignorance, non-vision, non-penetration, darkness, delusion, nescience, and blindness.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba ni rnam grangs bsdu ba las rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba ni rnam grangs bsdu ba las rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Their differentiation should be understood in detail from the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: dga' ba dang 'dod chags gnyis kyi khyad par yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang 'dod chags gnyis kyi khyad par yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: The difference between joy and attachment should also be explained.

original: lus la yod pa'i tshor ba'i dmigs pa la kun tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lus la yod pa'i tshor ba'i dmigs pa la kun tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the delight in the object of feeling that exists in the body.

original: dmigs pa gang yin pa de'i tshor ba skyes pa'i yul de la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin pa de'i tshor ba skyes pa'i yul de la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment is the excessive adherence to the object that has arisen from the object of feeling.

original: gzhan yang 'thob tu cha ba'i yul gyi tshe'i ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'thob tu cha ba'i yul gyi tshe'i ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Moreover, joy is with regard to the object that is to be obtained.

analyzed: thob zin pa'i tshe'i ni 'dod chags so // gzhan yang thob zin pa la nye bar spyod du cha ba'i tshe ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Attachment is with regard to the object that has been obtained.üîΩMoreover, joy is with regard to the object that has been obtained and is to be enjoyed.

original: de nyid la nye bar spyod pa'i tshe ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de nyid la nye bar spyod pa'i tshe ni 'dod chags so //

analyzed: gzhan yang yul dang phrad par bya ba'i thabs kyi tshe'i ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, joy is the means of attaining the object.

original: yul nyid kyi tshe'i ni 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: yul nyid kyi tshe'i ni 'dod chags pa'o //

original: gzhan yang srid par skye ba'i tshe'i ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang srid par skye ba'i tshe'i ni dga' ba'o //

original: yul gyi tshe'i @142b ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: yul gyi tshe'i @142b ni 'dod chags so //

analyzed: bdag phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i tshe'i ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Passion is one's own excellence.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin du brtson pa'i khyad par du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin du brtson pa'i khyad par du 'gro ba yin no //

original: khyad par du 'gro ba'i 'du shes ni gsum ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i 'du shes ni gsum ste /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ma thob pa thob pa dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du byed pa dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: de la sngon ma thob pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang po thob pas na ma thob pa thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the first fruit of stream-entry, which has not been previously attained, is attained by that.üîΩIt should be understood that the realization of the higher fruits of the training is based on that.

analyzed: mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir brtson par zad do //

translated: The four kinds of views of self are the cause of the arising of the conceit ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and they function as the condition for the arising of the conceit ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩWhat are the four?

original: rnam par brtags pa ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
