original: lhan cig skyes pa ni tha na ri dags dang bya rnams la yang yod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni tha na ri dags dang bya rnams la yang yod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The innate is that of even animals and birds.

original: rang gi gnas la dmigs pa ni so so rang gi lus rnams la yod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas la dmigs pa ni so so rang gi lus rnams la yod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The objective reference to one‚Äôs own body is that which occurs in regard to one‚Äôs own body.

original: gzhan gyi gnas la dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi lus rnams la yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnas la dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi lus rnams la yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The objective reference to another‚Äôs body is that which occurs in regard to another‚Äôs body.

original: gal te rnam par brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba la brten nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal skyed na ni de lta bu des rang gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus la bdag tu mthong nas bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis la brten nas skyed par byed de
analyzed: gal te rnam par brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba la brten nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal skyed na ni de lta bu des rang gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus la bdag tu mthong nas bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis la brten nas skyed par byed de
translated: If pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù arises in dependence on the view of self that is investigated, then it arises in dependence on the two views of self that see the self in one‚Äôs own body and in the bodies of others.

original: / dper na bzhin la brten nas yongs su dag pa'i me long gi ngos la gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: / dper na bzhin la brten nas yongs su dag pa'i me long gi ngos la gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: For example, a reflection arises in a completely clear mirror in dependence on a face,üîΩand in dependence on that reflection, one has the conception that one‚Äôs own face is inferior, average, or superior.

original: gzugs brnyan la brten nas rang gi gnas la tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog tu 'du shes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rtog pa'i ngan pas rang gi gnas la yod pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i rkyen las byung ba'i bzhin lta bu dang / gzhan gyi gnas la dmigs pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la brten nas rang gi gnas la tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog tu 'du shes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rtog pa'i ngan pas rang gi gnas la yod pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i rkyen las byung ba'i bzhin lta bu dang / gzhan gyi gnas la dmigs pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in dependence on the condition of the view of self that exists in one‚Äôs own continuum, a reflection arises that is like a face and that is like a reflection that is observed in another‚Äôs continuum.

original: de'i rkyen las kyang gzhan rnams pas bdag che'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen las kyang gzhan rnams pas bdag che'o //
translated: In dependence on that condition, one thinks, ‚ÄúI am superior to others,‚Äù

original: bdag mtshungs so //
analyzed: bdag mtshungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúI am equal,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI am inferior.‚Äù

original: bdag chung ngo snyam du nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal skye'o //
analyzed: bdag chung ngo snyam du nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal skye'o //
translated: The thought I am small is the pride of thinking I am.

original: de ste lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i @143b rkyen gyis skyed na ni de la ni dpe'i khyad par du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ste lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i @143b rkyen gyis skyed na ni de la ni dpe'i khyad par du rig par bya ste /
translated: If it is produced by the condition of the innate view of a self, then it should be understood as a special example.

original: dper na mig dang ldan pa'i mi snod na 'dug pa'i chu dang ba'i nang du mig dang rna ba gnyis la lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig dang ldan pa'i mi snod na 'dug pa'i chu dang ba'i nang du mig dang rna ba gnyis la lta ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a person with eyes looking at water and milk in a vessel with the two eyes.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as before.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de ni rnam pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de ni rnam pa thams cad ni /
translated: That view of the transitory collection is abandoned by

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'ba' zhig gis spong bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'ba' zhig gis spong bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: only the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, not by anything else.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi phan pa'i lan ni nyan thos sam tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas ston pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi phan pa'i lan ni nyan thos sam tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas ston pa'am /
translated: Thus, the benefit to the Tathagatas and the learned practitioners of pure conduct is shown by the disciples or practitioners of pure conduct.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang rnam pa gcig pus lan lon par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang rnam pa gcig pus lan lon par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: One can repay the favor of a fellow practitioner of pure conduct only in one way, not in any other.

original: gal te gzhan la phan pa'i phyir lam de kho na la zhugs par gyur na ni de lta na des de dag gi bzhed pa yongs su bskang bas lan du phan btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la phan pa'i phyir lam de kho na la zhugs par gyur na ni de lta na des de dag gi bzhed pa yongs su bskang bas lan du phan btags pa yin no //
translated: If one enters that very path in order to benefit others, then one repays their favor by fulfilling their wishes.

original: mtshan nyid gsum pa'i 'du byed rnams 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum pa'i 'du byed rnams 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the formations that have the three characteristics have ceased.

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bskyed pa rnams dang / rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: bskyed pa rnams dang / rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: those that are produced, those that perish by nature, and those that are free from afflictions.

original: de la sngon gyi yang srid par skye ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyis mngon par 'phangs pas na da ltar bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi yang srid par skye ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyis mngon par 'phangs pas na da ltar bskyed pa yin no //
translated: It is produced by the karma and afflictions that are the cause for rebirth into a previous existence, and it is projected by the previous aspiration.

original: de ltar skyes nas kyang rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'i phyir gtan du mi gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar skyes nas kyang rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'i phyir gtan du mi gnas so //
translated: Having been produced in this way, it does not endure forever because it is naturally perishable.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pas na nyon mongs pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pas na nyon mongs pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: It is free from afflictions because all afflictions are abandoned.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar 'gags nas phyis mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar 'gags nas phyis mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not arise again after having ceased in the present.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid gsum pa'i 'du byed 'di 'gag pa'i phyir 'gog pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid gsum pa'i 'du byed 'di 'gag pa'i phyir 'gog pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Therefore, this conditioning that has three characteristics is called cessation because it ceases.

original: mtshan nyid gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ni 'gog par gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ni 'gog par gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: If any of the characteristics are incomplete, it is not suitable to designate it as cessation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sgo nas chos kyi mdo bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sgo nas chos kyi mdo bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four summaries of the Dharma should be understood from the perspective of the three gates of liberation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mchan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mchan ma med pa'o //
translated: emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness.

original: de la 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: All formations are impermanent.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba @144a * //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba @144a * //
translated: All formations are painful.

original: ni smon pa med pa'i sgo nas chos kyi mdo dang po dang gnyis pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ni smon pa med pa'i sgo nas chos kyi mdo dang po dang gnyis pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the first and second Dharma-instruction established by way of the wishless.üîΩAll dharmas are without self.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas gsum pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas gsum pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the third established by way of emptiness.üîΩNirvana is peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i sgo nas bzhi po rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i sgo nas bzhi po rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth established by way of signlessness.

original: chos kyi mdo'i dbang gis byung ba'i 'du byed 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo'i dbang gis byung ba'i 'du byed 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The desire for the formations that arise from the power of the Dharma-instruction should be known as twofold:

original: mos pa dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: that which is accompanied by aspiration and that which is accompanied by intention.

original: de la mos pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod pas ni chos kyi mdo bzhis 'du byed rnams 'dod de /
analyzed: de la mos pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod pas ni chos kyi mdo bzhis 'du byed rnams 'dod de /
translated: Therein, the desire accompanied by aspiration is the desire for the formations by means of the four Dharma-instructions.

original: 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni de 'dod pa de lkog dben par song nas bsam pa thag pa nas yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni de 'dod pa de lkog dben par song nas bsam pa thag pa nas yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The complete pacification of all conditioned things is the desire for nirvana.

original: rnam pa bzhis de las yid ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis de las yid ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind turns away from that in four ways:

original: de la phan yod ma mthong bas mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de thob par yid mi ches pas ma dad pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa de la mngon par mi dga' bas mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / de la mngon par mi dga' bas rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phan yod ma mthong bas mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de thob par yid mi ches pas ma dad pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa de la mngon par mi dga' bas mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / de la mngon par mi dga' bas rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not engage, not seeing any benefit in that; because of lack of faith, not believing that one can attain that; because of lack of delight, not remaining in that objective support; and because of lack of liberation, not delighting in that.

original: de las bzlog pa ni bsam pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni bsam pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the desire for nirvana in terms of intention.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis ni mos pa'i bdag med pa 'dod pa la brten pas mya ngan las 'das pa las sems phyir ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis ni mos pa'i bdag med pa 'dod pa la brten pas mya ngan las 'das pa las sems phyir ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind turns away from nirvana for two reasons:

original: yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of complete discouragement.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'dod pa de yang legs par byang ba ma yin la tshar phyin par yang ma gyur ba dang / de yid la byed pa'i tshe yang rgyu de nyid kyis brjed ngas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa de yang legs par byang ba ma yin la tshar phyin par yang ma gyur ba dang / de yid la byed pa'i tshe yang rgyu de nyid kyis brjed ngas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, that desire is not well purified and not fully completed, and when he attends to it, he becomes forgetful due to that cause.

original: bzod pa de la yongs su ma byang ba'i phyir ni de'i tshe 'du byed rnams la 'du byed tsam du shes pa la sems rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzod pa de la yongs su ma byang ba'i phyir ni de'i tshe 'du byed rnams la 'du byed tsam du shes pa la sems rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of not purifying that patience, at that time his mind is confused about knowing formations as just formations.

original: bdag gi bdag gang yin zhig gu snyam du bdag yongs su tshol ba'i rnam pas de zhib pa dang ldan pa'i bar du gcod pa 'jug par 'gyur te /üîΩdes na de 'di snyam du bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems kyi /
analyzed: bdag gi bdag gang yin zhig gu snyam du bdag yongs su tshol ba'i rnam pas de zhib pa dang ldan pa'i bar du gcod pa 'jug par 'gyur te / des na de 'di snyam du bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems kyi /
translated: With the aspect of thoroughly searching for a self, thinking ‚ÄúWhat is the self of mine?‚Äù the obstacle of thorough search engages.

original: 'di snyam du 'du byed tsam po 'di ni med par 'gyur ro snyam du ni mi sems so //
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'du byed tsam po 'di ni med par 'gyur ro snyam du ni mi sems so //
translated: Therefore, he thinks, ‚ÄúI will be annihilated,‚Äù but he does not think, ‚ÄúThis mere formation will be annihilated.‚Äù

original: de de ltar rjes su 'brel ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas rnam par 'gyur ba dang / rjes su @144b 'brel ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de de ltar rjes su 'brel ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas rnam par 'gyur ba dang / rjes su @144b 'brel ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed de /
translated: In this way, on the basis of the view of the transitory collection, which is the cause of the transformation of consciousness, the consciousness that is the result of that transformation is produced.

original: yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir 'gog pa las yid phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //üîΩyongs su yi 'chad pa de spang ba la dben pa'i chos ni gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir 'gog pa las yid phyir ldog par 'gyur ro // yongs su yi 'chad pa de spang ba la dben pa'i chos ni gnyis yod de /
translated: Because of the regret that arises from that, the mind turns away from cessation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to abandon that regret, there are two things that are conducive to seclusion:

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag la bdag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu ston pa dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i phyir shes par 'dod pa'i sems dang / mnyan zhing las su rung ba'i sems so //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag la bdag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu ston pa dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i phyir shes par 'dod pa'i sems dang / mnyan zhing las su rung ba'i sems so //
translated: the mind that desires to understand, because of the aspiration for virtuous qualities, and the mind that is fit for listening.

original: de ltar shes par 'dod pa'i sems kyis chos nyan pa na rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes par 'dod pa'i sems kyis chos nyan pa na rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: When one listens to the Dharma with a mind that desires to understand, mental satisfaction arises in three ways:

original: gang zag gi dbang gis byung ba dang / chos kyi dbang gis byung ba dang / bdag gi dbang gis byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi dbang gis byung ba dang / chos kyi dbang gis byung ba dang / bdag gi dbang gis byung ba'o //
translated: 1. arising from the power of persons, 2. arising from the power of things, and 3. arising from the power of oneself.

original: de la gang zag gi nus pa dang / mthu yod pa dang / 'tsham pa dang / ston pas bsngags pa'i ston pa po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gang zag gi nus pa dang / mthu yod pa dang / 'tsham pa dang / ston pas bsngags pa'i ston pa po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the power and ability of persons is seen in the teacher who is praised by the Buddha.

original: chos bstan pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal nges par 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir mchog gi don yin no snyam du mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bstan pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal nges par 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir mchog gi don yin no snyam du mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is the highest meaning because it is the definite deliverance from suffering.

original: bdag nyid kyang chos de rtogs par bya ba la nus pa dang / mthu yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang chos de rtogs par bya ba la nus pa dang / mthu yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One also realizes that one has the power and ability to understand that Dharma.

original: de ltar sems nyams bde bar 'gyur ba la ni lta ba gsum yod de /
analyzed: de ltar sems nyams bde bar 'gyur ba la ni lta ba gsum yod de /
translated: Thus, there are three views in the joy of mind.üîΩThe view of the highest meaning is the view of the Dharma that is taught.üîΩThe view of the highest object is the view of the teacher who teaches that Dharma.

original: gang la gnas pa dang / des yongs su shes par bya ba gang yin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang la gnas pa dang / des yongs su shes par bya ba gang yin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: The view of the highest self is the view that one has the power and ability to understand that Dharma.

original: bden pa mngon par ma rtogs pa rnams mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par ma rtogs pa rnams mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of those who have not realized the truths in order to realize them.

original: de la mos pa dang ldan pa shin tu yongs su byang ba'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa la ni gnas so //
analyzed: de la mos pa dang ldan pa shin tu yongs su byang ba'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa la ni gnas so //
translated: Among them, those who are devoted to the realization of the pure mundane knowledge that is completely purified abide in the realization of the pure mundane knowledge that is completely purified.

original: gzhi gsum la bdag tu mngon par zhen pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba bag la nyal dang bcas pa rtag pa dang chad pa lta ba'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu dang bcas par yongs su shes te /
analyzed: gzhi gsum la bdag tu mngon par zhen pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba bag la nyal dang bcas pa rtag pa dang chad pa lta ba'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu dang bcas par yongs su shes te /
translated: The three bases are the basis of the view of the transitory composite, together with its latent impressions, which is the support for the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: gang len pa dang / gang gis len pa dang / ji ltar len pa de dag ni gzhi gsum yin no //
analyzed: gang len pa dang / gang gis len pa dang / ji ltar len pa de dag ni gzhi gsum yin no //
translated: The three bases are that which is appropriated, that by which it is appropriated, and the manner in which it is appropriated.

original: de la ci len zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci len zhe na /
translated: What is appropriated?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams so //
translated: It is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: gang gis len zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis len zhe na /
translated: That by which it is appropriated?

original: len pa bzhi po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: len pa bzhi po rnams kyis so //
translated: It is the four appropriators.

original: ji ltar len zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar len zhe na /
translated: The manner in which it is appropriated?

original: rnam par shes pa'i @145a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i @145a * //
translated: It is the appropriation of the aggregates by consciousness.

original: gnas bzhi po rnams kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gnas bzhi po rnams kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The four stations are:

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du phung po dang / nye bar len pa dang / sems kyi gnas rnams yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du phung po dang / nye bar len pa dang / sems kyi gnas rnams yin te /
translated: The aggregates, the appropriators, the abodes of mind, and the bases.

original: de dag la kun nas dkris pa mi rigs pa dang ldan pas de'i dmigs pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la kun nas dkris pa mi rigs pa dang ldan pas de'i dmigs pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The afflicted view of the self is the adherence to the self and what pertains to the self in regard to the five appropriative aggregates qualified by the four stations.

original: bag la nyal ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The latent tendency is as explained above.

original: de la lam mngon par sgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lam mngon par sgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of the path?

original: gang la gnas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gzhi gsum la mngon par zhen pa bag la nyal dang bcas par spong bar 'gyur la bden pa shes pa la yang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gzhi gsum la mngon par zhen pa bag la nyal dang bcas par spong bar 'gyur la bden pa shes pa la yang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the practice of the path by which one abandons the afflicted view of the self together with its latent tendencies in regard to the three stations, and by which one becomes independent with regard to the knowledge of the truths.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i lta ba de la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gi sgo nas gnas gsum la mngon par zhen pa yang yin la bag la nyal dang bcas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i lta ba de la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gi sgo nas gnas gsum la mngon par zhen pa yang yin la bag la nyal dang bcas pa yang yin te /
translated: The afflicted view of the self which is to be completely understood is the adherence to the three stations by way of the self and what pertains to the self, together with the latent tendencies.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / nub par 'gyur ba mi shes pas dbu ma'i lam la 'jug pa'i skal ba yang med na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / nub par 'gyur ba mi shes pas dbu ma'i lam la 'jug pa'i skal ba yang med na /
translated: Since they do not know the origination and cessation of formations, they do not have the good fortune to enter the middle way.

original: des nges pa 'byung bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des nges pa 'byung bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How then could they have the good fortune to attain liberation?

original: de la mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa la gnas pa ni gzhi gsum po dag la bdag gi sgo nas mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de la mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa la gnas pa ni gzhi gsum po dag la bdag gi sgo nas mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Those who abide in the realization that accords with the truth are free from attachment to the three bases as a self.

original: de'i bag la nyal dang ldan no //
analyzed: de'i bag la nyal dang ldan no //
translated: They possess the latent impressions of that attachment.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / nub par shes pa ni mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam la zhugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / nub par shes pa ni mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam la zhugs par 'gyur te /
translated: The knowledge of the origination and cessation of formations is the entry into the middle way that abandons the two extremes.

original: des nges par 'byung ba ni ma yin la nges par 'byung ba'i skal ba can ni yin no //
analyzed: des nges par 'byung ba ni ma yin la nges par 'byung ba'i skal ba can ni yin no //
translated: That is not liberation, but it does have the good fortune to attain liberation.

original: de la bden pa mngon par rtogs pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i yang dag pa'i lta bas ni gzhi gsum po rnams la bdag gi sgo nas mngon par zhen pa med cing bag la nyal med de dbu ma'i lam la snga nas kyang zhugs la des nges par 'byung
analyzed: de la bden pa mngon par rtogs pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i yang dag pa'i lta bas ni gzhi gsum po rnams la bdag gi sgo nas mngon par zhen pa med cing bag la nyal med de dbu ma'i lam la snga nas kyang zhugs la des nges par 'byung
translated: The right view that is accomplished by realizing the truths is the middle way that is free of the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: bar 'gyur te lta ba de rnams la gnas pa rnams kyi khyad par ni de yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar 'gyur te lta ba de rnams la gnas pa rnams kyi khyad par ni de yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the middle way that is free of the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.üîΩThe summary:üîΩSuperknowledge, swift, entire,üîΩknowledge, object, samsara,

original: sdom ni / mngon shes myur dang lus kun dang // shes dang shes bya 'khor ba dang / chog 'dzin spyod dang rgyun phyogs dang // yongs su shes pa nyams dang rtags //
analyzed: sdom ni / mngon shes myur dang lus kun dang // shes dang shes bya 'khor ba dang / chog 'dzin spyod dang rgyun phyogs dang // yongs su shes pa nyams dang rtags //
translated: satisfaction, conduct, stream,üîΩcomplete knowledge, degeneration, and signs.

original: 'du shes rnam par gzhag pa dang // tshogs dang mi mthun gang yin dang / ston pa'i phrin las la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'du shes rnam par gzhag pa dang // tshogs dang mi mthun gang yin dang / ston pa'i phrin las la sogs pa'i //
translated: Cognition,

original: sde tshan chen po tha ma @145b yin //
analyzed: sde tshan chen po tha ma @145b yin //
translated: and the final great section on the teacher‚Äôs activity and so on.

original: yongs su grub cing yongs su mthar thug pa'i rnam par grol ba ma thob pa thob par bya ba la chos gsum gyis mngon par shes pa myur bar byed de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub cing yongs su mthar thug pa'i rnam par grol ba ma thob pa thob par bya ba la chos gsum gyis mngon par shes pa myur bar byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: The three qualities that cause the rapid attainment of the superknowledges are:üîΩ1. the power of knowledge,

original: shes pa'i stobs dang / bag yod pa'i stobs dang / goms pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: shes pa'i stobs dang / bag yod pa'i stobs dang / goms pa'i stobs so //
translated: 2. the power of heedfulness, andüîΩ3. the power of practice.

original: de la shes pa'i stobs ni gang la gnas na de'i mod la zag pa rnams zad pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i stobs ni gang la gnas na de'i mod la zag pa rnams zad pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: The power of knowledge is the power of knowledge that, when one abides in it, one becomes fit to destroy the defilements immediately.

original: de yang slob pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang slob pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the knowledge and insight of the learner.

original: de la bag yod pa'i stobs ni de ltar shes pa dang mthong ba thob pa de nyid kyi lam de ltar thob pa bsgom pa la brtson pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las sems kun tu srung ba'o //
analyzed: de la bag yod pa'i stobs ni de ltar shes pa dang mthong ba thob pa de nyid kyi lam de ltar thob pa bsgom pa la brtson pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las sems kun tu srung ba'o //
translated: The power of heedfulness is the protection of the mind from sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas by one who is intent on cultivating the path that has been attained by the attainment of that knowledge and insight.

original: de la goms pa'i stobs ni bsgom pa la brtson pa de nyid la rtag tu byed pa dang / rtag tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la goms pa'i stobs ni bsgom pa la brtson pa de nyid la rtag tu byed pa dang / rtag tu gnas pa ste /
translated: The power of practice is the constant practice and constant abiding of one who is intent on cultivation.

original: deng ngam sang ngam gnangs nyid du bdag gi sems len pa med par zag pa rnams las rnam par grol bar gyur cig snyam nas phyin ci log gi sems mngon par 'du byed pas skyo bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: deng ngam sang ngam gnangs nyid du bdag gi sems len pa med par zag pa rnams las rnam par grol bar gyur cig snyam nas phyin ci log gi sems mngon par 'du byed pas skyo bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: I will be liberated from the defilements without grasping, today, tomorrow, or the next day. He does not become discouraged by the formation of the mind in error.

original: skyo ba med na yongs su yi 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba med na yongs su yi 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If he is not discouraged, he does not become weary.

original: yongs su yi 'chad pa med na zag pa zad par bya ba'i sbyor ba mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: yongs su yi 'chad pa med na zag pa zad par bya ba'i sbyor ba mi gtong ngo //
translated: If he does not become weary, he does not abandon the practice of exhausting the defilements.

original: de la shes pa dang mthong ba gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang mthong ba gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between knowledge and vision?

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the wisdom which has as its object the past and future which are hidden.

original: da ltar byung ba'i yul can gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i yul can gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Vision is that which has as its object the present.

original: gzhan yang gzung ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzung ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, knowledge is that which has as its object the apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Vision is that which has as its object the apprehender.

original: gzhan yang thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, what is derived from hearing and reflection is knowledge.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
translated: What is derived from meditation is seeing.

original: gzhan yang gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba de ni shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, what eliminates the afflictions is knowledge.

original: spong ba dang rnam par grol ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba dang rnam par grol ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
translated: The wisdom that eliminates and is liberated is seeing.

original: gzhan yang rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, what focuses on specific characteristics is knowledge.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //
translated: What focuses on general characteristics is seeing.

original: gzhan yang gdags pa la brten te nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gdags pa la brten te nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, based on designation, there are internal and external formations, such as

original: bdag @146a * //üîΩces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag @146a * // ces bya ba'am /
translated: self,

original: sems can zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba'am /
translated: sentient being,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po zhes bya ba'am /
translated: gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, asuras, garu·∏ças, ki·πÉnaras, and mahoragas,

original: dmag dang / nags tshal dang / khang khyim dang / ri zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dmag dang / nags tshal dang / khang khyim dang / ri zhes bya ba'am /
translated: army, forest, house, mountain,

original: de la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i brda'i tshul gyis shes bya de dang de dag la dmigs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i brda'i tshul gyis shes bya de dang de dag la dmigs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: and so on. The wisdom that observes those objects of knowledge through the method of symbolic expressions is knowledge.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'dzin pa ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'dzin pa ni mthong ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of specific and general characteristics is seeing.

original: gzhan yang chos rnams yongs su tshol ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnams yongs su tshol ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the investigation of phenomena is knowledge.

original: yongs su btsal zin pa rnams las so sor rtog pa ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su btsal zin pa rnams las so sor rtog pa ni mthong ba'o //
translated: The discernment of those that have been investigated is seeing.

original: gzhan yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the observation of a non-conceptual image is knowledge.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni mthong ba'o //
translated: The observation of a conceptual image is seeing.

original: gzhan yang shes bya gzugs can gyi gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes bya gzugs can gyi gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the observation of an image of a physical object of knowledge is seeing.

original: shes bya gzugs can ma yin pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya gzugs can ma yin pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The observation of an image of a non-physical object of knowledge is knowledge.

original: de de ltar shes pa dang mthong ba la brten pas bsgom pa la zhugs pa ni mkhas pa'i gzhi bzhis sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar shes pa dang mthong ba la brten pas bsgom pa la zhugs pa ni mkhas pa'i gzhi bzhis sbyor bar byed de /
translated: The one who has entered into cultivation on the basis of such knowledge and insight applies himself with the four bases of spiritual power.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: nye bar rtog pa'i gzhi dang / gtong ba dang len pa'i gzhi dang / tshor ba rnams las nges par 'byung ba'i gzhi dang / thabs kyi gzhis so //
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa'i gzhi dang / gtong ba dang len pa'i gzhi dang / tshor ba rnams las nges par 'byung ba'i gzhi dang / thabs kyi gzhis so //
translated: the base of thorough investigation, the base of relinquishment and acceptance, the base of definite emergence from the feelings, and the base of means.

original: de la nye bar rtog pa'i gzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar rtog pa'i gzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: The base of thorough investigation is the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po'i sgo nas shes bya thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po'i sgo nas shes bya thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the antidotes to the four errors and are for the sake of thoroughly knowing all objects of knowledge just as they are.

original: gtong ba dang len pa'i gzhi ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: gtong ba dang len pa'i gzhi ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi ste /
translated: The base of relinquishment and acceptance is the four right efforts,

original: mi dge ba'i chos spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are for the sake of relinquishing non-virtuous dharmas and accomplishing virtuous dharmas.

original: tshor ba rnams las nges par 'byung ba'i gzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams las nges par 'byung ba'i gzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste /
translated: The base of definite emergence from the feelings is the four bases of supernatural powers,üîΩbecause they are for the sake of definite emergence from the feelings of pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, and mental pain.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po rnams la yid mi bde ba'i dbang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po rnams la yid mi bde ba'i dbang po nas bzung ste /
translated: The four meditative concentrations are the basis of the faculty of mental pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i bar gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i bar gyi phyir ro //
translated: up to the faculty of complete knowledge, because they are the foundation for the transcendence of both pleasure and pain.

original: thabs kyi gzhi ni dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam @146b gyi yan lag rnams yin par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: thabs kyi gzhi ni dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam @146b gyi yan lag rnams yin par rig par bya ste //
translated: The basis of skillful means should be understood as the faculties, the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, and the limbs of the path,

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the skillful means for abandoning the moral defilements that are to be relinquished by means of the path of vision and meditative development.

original: de ltar mkhas pa la zhugs pa la ni rten dang / brten pa'i don bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mkhas pa la zhugs pa la ni rten dang / brten pa'i don bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, in regard to the one who has entered into the skills, there are four things that should be understood as the basis and that which is based upon it.

original: de la rten gyi don ni rnal 'byor pa yang dag par zhugs pa gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: de la rten gyi don ni rnal 'byor pa yang dag par zhugs pa gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: Herein, the meaning of the basis is that of the yogiÃÑ who has entered into reality.

original: de la brten pa'i don ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos de dag dang ni ldan la rnam par dag pa rnams dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i don ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos de dag dang ni ldan la rnam par dag pa rnams dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That which is based upon it is the possession of the learner‚Äôs uncontaminated dharmas, but not the possession of the pure ones.

original: ma rig pa'i lhag ma'i sbubs kyis kun nas bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i lhag ma'i sbubs kyis kun nas bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is completely surrounded by the cocoon of the remaining obscurations of the knowable.

original: chos de dag nyid rnam par dag pa'i lam gyis phyis rnam par dag pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid rnam par dag pa'i lam gyis phyis rnam par dag pa dang ldan no //
translated: However, later, those same phenomena are endowed with purity by the path of purity.

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i lam yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i lam yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The path of purity should be understood as fourfold:

original: dam pa'i chos yang dag par brtag pa ni lhag par brten pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yang dag par brtag pa ni lhag par brten pa'o //
translated: the investigation of the true Dharma is the basis of excellence.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni yongs su bsten pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni yongs su bsten pa'o //
translated: The reliance on a spiritual teacher is the basis of service.

original: tshul khrims dang dbang po bsdams pa dang / 'dod pa nyung ba la sogs pas ni sems bsro bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang dbang po bsdams pa dang / 'dod pa nyung ba la sogs pas ni sems bsro bar bya'o //
translated: The mind should be warmed by morality, the control of the senses, few desires, etc.

original: lkog dben pa na gnas shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis kyis ni yang dag par bde blag tu bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lkog dben pa na gnas shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis kyis ni yang dag par bde blag tu bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be properly guarded with ease by both serenity and insight, dwelling in a secluded place.

original: de la rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lam de nyid lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus slob pa'i chos de dag gis ma rig pa'i spobs brtol bas mi slob pa'i sar nges par 'byung ba gang yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lam de nyid lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus slob pa'i chos de dag gis ma rig pa'i spobs brtol bas mi slob pa'i sar nges par 'byung ba gang yang yin pa'o //
translated: Purity is the definite emergence in the stage of no learning through the cause of repeatedly cultivating that very pure path, since those phenomena of learning are not obstructed by ignorance.

original: yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su mthur thug pa'i rnam par grol ba de 'thob pa la yang rim pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su mthur thug pa'i rnam par grol ba de 'thob pa la yang rim pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Also, the attainment of that perfected and fully completed liberation has five stages.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:üîΩThe basis of previously accomplishing the collection of merit,üîΩthe basis of that, the cultivation of both serenity and insight,

original: sngon tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rten dang / de la brten nas kyang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gnyis la goms pa dang / de la brten nas kyang bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa dang /
analyzed: sngon tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rten dang / de la brten nas kyang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gnyis la goms pa dang / de la brten nas kyang bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa dang /
translated: the basis of that, the realization of the four truths and the aspiration for nirvana,

original: de la brten nas kyang rtogs pa phal ba tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin cing gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: de la brten nas kyang rtogs pa phal ba tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin cing gnas par mi byed de /
translated: the basis of that, not being satisfied with mere partial realization and not remaining there,üîΩand the basis of that, the attainment of the result of the arya being.

original: skyo bar byed pa'i chos rnams la skyo bar byed pa dang / de la brten nas kyang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i slob pa'i sems tha ma'o //
analyzed: skyo bar byed pa'i chos rnams la skyo bar byed pa dang / de la brten nas kyang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i slob pa'i sems tha ma'o //
translated: And, on the basis of that, he attains the final thought of the trainee endowed with the vajra-like samadhi.

original: lus thams cad la ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus thams cad la ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The impermanence of all conditioned things should be understood in four ways with regard to the whole body.

original: @147a * // las thams cad kyi tshe'i tshad nges pa yod de /
analyzed: @147a * // las thams cad kyi tshe'i tshad nges pa yod de /
translated: The life-span of all actions is fixed.

original: dper na la la zhig gi ched du 'jim pa'i gong bu'am ba lang gi lci ba'i gong bu lag tu blangs pa la ni dus 'di tsam zhig na dor ro snyam du bsams na de ltar ched du blangs pa'i gong bu de la mi de de'i tshe ci
analyzed: dper na la la zhig gi ched du 'jim pa'i gong bu'am ba lang gi lci ba'i gong bu lag tu blangs pa la ni dus 'di tsam zhig na dor ro snyam du bsams na de ltar ched du blangs pa'i gong bu de la mi de de'i tshe ci
translated: For example, when a lump of clay or a lump of cow dung is taken up in the hand, it is thought, ‚ÄúIt will be thrown away at such and such a time.‚Äù In that way, the person has control over the throwing away of that lump that was taken up intentionally.

original: dgar 'dor ba'i dbang byed de /
analyzed: dgar 'dor ba'i dbang byed de /
translated: But the lump does not have control over the time of being thrown away.

original: gang gi tshe dor bar 'dod pa na yang dor du yod la ji srid du 'chang bar 'dod pa de srid du yang bcang du yod kyi 'chi ba'i rgyu'i lus blangs la tshe yang zad pa la ni rang dgar skad cig gnas par bya bar mi 'grub na
analyzed: gang gi tshe dor bar 'dod pa na yang dor du yod la ji srid du 'chang bar 'dod pa de srid du yang bcang du yod kyi 'chi ba'i rgyu'i lus blangs la tshe yang zad pa la ni rang dgar skad cig gnas par bya bar mi 'grub na
translated: But if you have taken up a body that is the cause of death and your life is exhausted, you cannot remain for even a moment by your own wish.

original: de las lhag par lta ga la nus /
analyzed: de las lhag par lta ga la nus /
translated: How much less could you remain for a long time?

original: gzhan yang lus thams cad ni rgyu las byung ba yin la rgyu yang byas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtog go //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus thams cad ni rgyu las byung ba yin la rgyu yang byas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtog go //
translated: Moreover, the entire body is a product of causes, and since the causes are created, the body is not permanent.

original: gzhan yang lus chen po dang phun sum tshogs pa zad pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus chen po dang phun sum tshogs pa zad pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, the body is subject to great and complete destruction.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams dang / lha yul pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / mi rnams te tshangs pa dang / brgya byin dang / 'khor los sgyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams dang / lha yul pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / mi rnams te tshangs pa dang / brgya byin dang / 'khor los sgyur ba rnams so //
translated: the gods in the form realm, the gods in the desire realm, and humans such as Brahma, Indra, and the universal monarch.

original: gzhan yang yid ches pa'i man ngag las mngon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid ches pa'i man ngag las mngon pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is evident from reliable reports.

original: gang las bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du gzigs pa nyid kyis mngon du 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: gang las bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du gzigs pa nyid kyis mngon du 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One has shown that the three perfections of giving, morality, and patience are the cause for obtaining the three perfections of sovereignty, life, and body in the future.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: These three are the perfection of desire for those who have desire.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod pa ste /
translated: They are always and uninterruptedly desired by those who have desire.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: longs spyod kyi gzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems can rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs phal po ches mdun gyis lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi gzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems can rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs phal po ches mdun gyis lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the basis of enjoyment, the perfection of the body, and the perfection of being looked up to by a great variety of many sentient beings.

original: phun sum tshogs pa gsum po 'di dag 'thob pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa gsum po 'di dag 'thob pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The cause for obtaining these three perfections should be known as threefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sbyin pa dang / dbang po dul ba dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'i byams pa'i sngon du 'gro zhing rgyu'i tshul du 'dug pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byams pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / dbang po dul ba dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'i byams pa'i sngon du 'gro zhing rgyu'i tshul du 'dug pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byams pa ste /
translated: Generosity, morality endowed with the control of the senses, and the love of the realm of desire which is the cause and the antecedent of the love which is the result of meditation.

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems yang dag par bsdam pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems yang dag par bsdam pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are applied in the form of a restraint against the malice of beings.

original: bdun po 'di dag ni shes bya'i gzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba'i shes pa'i rnam pa @147b yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bdun po 'di dag ni shes bya'i gzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba'i shes pa'i rnam pa @147b yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These seven are the aspects of the knowledge which penetrates the bases of cognition as they are.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: thob pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: thob pa'i shes pas /
translated: The knowledge of acquisition,

original: thob pa ma yin pa'i shes pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang / gang na med pa gang yin pa de ni de'i sgo nas med do zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang / 'dir lus gang yin pa de ni de'i sgo nas gsog ces bya ba'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: thob pa ma yin pa'i shes pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang / gang na med pa gang yin pa de ni de'i sgo nas med do zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang / 'dir lus gang yin pa de ni de'i sgo nas gsog ces bya ba'i shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of non-acquisition, the knowledge of non-distortion, the knowledge that whatever does not exist in a certain thing does not exist in it by that fact, the knowledge that whatever is a heap in a certain thing is a heap in it by that fact,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang mi sdug pa'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang / 'jigs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang mi sdug pa'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang / 'jigs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge that it is suffering and unpleasant, and the knowledge of fear.

original: rnam pa bco lngas ni 'du byed rtogs pas 'du byed thams cad la rmongs pa spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bco lngas ni 'du byed rtogs pas 'du byed thams cad la rmongs pa spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By means of these fifteen aspects, one penetrates the formations and abandons all ignorance with regard to the formations.

original: bco lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bco lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fifteen?

original: gzugs la ni chu'i khams las byung ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag lta bur snang ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du spyad par mi nus pa'i phyir dbu ba'i gong bu lta bur rtogs pa dang / tshor ba la ni gsum 'dus pa dang 'dra ba'i sgo nas sprin dang sa gzhi dang char pa gsum 'dus pa'i tshul gyis chu bur lta bur rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la ni chu'i khams las byung ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag lta bur snang ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du spyad par mi nus pa'i phyir dbu ba'i gong bu lta bur rtogs pa dang / tshor ba la ni gsum 'dus pa dang 'dra ba'i sgo nas sprin dang sa gzhi dang char pa gsum 'dus pa'i tshul gyis chu bur lta bur rtogs pa dang /
translated: One penetrates form as being like a mass of foam, because it is derived from the water element, because it appears as a self where there is no self, and because it cannot be used as one wishes. One penetrates feeling as being like a water bubble, by way of the analogy of the coming together of three things, like the coming together of a cloud, the earth, and rain.

original: 'du shes rnams la ni shes byar snang ba dang / gdungs pa dang / rmongs par 'dra ba'i sgo nas smig rgyu ba lta bur rtogs pa dang / 'du byed rnams la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang / lus rnam pa du ma'i rgyu'i bye brag yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'du shes rnams la ni shes byar snang ba dang / gdungs pa dang / rmongs par 'dra ba'i sgo nas smig rgyu ba lta bur rtogs pa dang / 'du byed rnams la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang / lus rnam pa du ma'i rgyu'i bye brag yin pa dang /
translated: Regarding the perceptions, they are realized to be like a mirage through the similarity of appearing as objects of knowledge, being tormented and being deluded.üîΩRegarding the compositional factors, they are realized to be like a plantain tree through the similarity of the root of the view of the transitory collection being severed, being the specific causes of many different bodies and not remaining for a long time.

original: skad cig tsam las yun ring du mi gnas par 'dra ba'i sgo nas chu shing gi sdong po lta bur rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa la ni len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang lus sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo nas sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig tsam las yun ring du mi gnas par 'dra ba'i sgo nas chu shing gi sdong po lta bur rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa la ni len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang lus sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo nas sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa dang /
translated: Regarding consciousness, it is realized to be like an illusion through the consciousness that appropriates the body, the four abodes of consciousness and the body following after various bodies.

original: rgyas par rab tu byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par rab tu byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows.

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ngo /
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ngo /
translated: It is found in the Compendium of Enumerations.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gzhi bsdu ba /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gzhi bsdu ba /
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds is a compendium of the levels.

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: PART THREE: THE GREAT VEHICLE PATH

original: 'jig rten gnyis kyis ni 'du byed thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyis kyis ni 'du byed thams cad bsdus te /
translated: The two worlds include all conditioned states.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment.

original: de la sems can gyis 'jig rten ni skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sems can gyis 'jig rten ni skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The world of sentient beings is called the cycle of birth and death.

original: gzhan la mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mi bya'o //
translated: It is not the other.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni mi 'dra ba rnam pa lngas snod kyi 'khor ba dang mi 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni mi 'dra ba rnam pa lngas snod kyi 'khor ba dang mi 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The cycle of birth and death should be understood as different from the cycle of the physical world in five ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: snod kyi 'khor ba ni thun mong ba'i rgyus grub pa yin la /üîΩskye ba'i 'khor ba ni sems can re re nyi tshe'i @148a * //
analyzed: snod kyi 'khor ba ni thun mong ba'i rgyus grub pa yin la / skye ba'i 'khor ba ni sems can re re nyi tshe'i @148a * //
translated: The cycle of the physical world is established by a common cause,

original: rgyus grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyus grub pa yin te /
translated: but the cycle of birth and death is established by the individual causes of each sentient being.

original: 'di ni rgyu mi 'dra ba dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu mi 'dra ba dang po'o //
translated: This is the first difference in their causes.

original: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' chad pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma yod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' chad pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma yod la /
translated: Moreover, the cycle of the physical world has a beginning and an end because it has a prior limit and a subsequent limit.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni rtag tu mi 'chad par rgyun 'jug pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med de /
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni rtag tu mi 'chad par rgyun 'jug pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med de /
translated: But the cycle of birth and death has no beginning and no end because it is a continuous process that never ceases.

original: 'di ni mi 'dra ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'dra ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second way in which they are different.

original: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba ni me 'am chu 'am rlung gis 'jig cing rgyun 'chad par 'gyur la skye ba'i 'khor ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba ni me 'am chu 'am rlung gis 'jig cing rgyun 'chad par 'gyur la skye ba'i 'khor ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cyclic existence of the external environment is destroyed by fire, water, and wind and its continuity is severed. The cyclic existence of birth is not like that.

original: 'di ni mi 'dra ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'dra ba gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third way in which they are different.

original: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba'i rgyu ni gtan du rgyun chad par 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba'i rgyu ni gtan du rgyun chad par 'gyur ba med la /
translated: Moreover, the cause of the cyclic existence of the external environment is not severed forever.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni yod de /
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni yod de /
translated: However, the cause of the cyclic existence of birth is severed.

original: 'di ni mi 'dra ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'dra ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth way in which they are different.

original: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba ni rgyun chad du zin kyang yang nying mtshams sbyor ba yod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang snod kyi 'khor ba ni rgyun chad du zin kyang yang nying mtshams sbyor ba yod la /
translated: Moreover, even though the cyclic existence of the external environment is severed, it can be reestablished.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni nams kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba ni nams kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: However, the cyclic existence of birth can never be reestablished.

original: 'di ni mi 'dra ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'dra ba lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth way in which they are different.

original: byis pa rnams ni rnam pa lngas 'khor ba der 'khor bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni rnam pa lngas 'khor ba der 'khor bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: Fools cycle in that cyclic existence in five ways.üîΩWhat are the five?

original: sred pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa'i 'bras bu dang / sred pa'i rang bzhin dang / rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de nyid kyang sngon gyi mtha'i sgo nas thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa'i 'bras bu dang / sred pa'i rang bzhin dang / rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de nyid kyang sngon gyi mtha'i sgo nas thog ma med pa'o //
translated: the cause of craving, the result of craving, the nature of craving, the succession of causes, and the beginninglessness of the succession of causes from the standpoint of the past.

original: de la ma rig pa ni sred pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni sred pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Therein, ignorance is the cause of craving.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las ni sred pa'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩde la bde 'gror 'gro ba'i las kyis ni sred pas byis pa kun tu sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las ni sred pa'i 'bras bu'o // de la bde 'gror 'gro ba'i las kyis ni sred pas byis pa kun tu sbyong bar byed de /
translated: The action that leads to good or bad destinies is the result of craving.

original: rang nyid 'gro ba der 'gro 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid 'gro ba der 'gro 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the action that leads to good destinies is the cause of craving, because the fool is bound by craving for that destiny, because he desires to go there.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las kyis ni sred pa'i ltung gis btags te /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las kyis ni sred pa'i ltung gis btags te /
translated: The action that leads to bad destinies is the cause of craving, because craving throws him down there.

original: de ni 'gro 'dod pa na ma yin gyi mi 'dod bzhin du khrid do //
analyzed: de ni 'gro 'dod pa na ma yin gyi mi 'dod bzhin du khrid do //
translated: He does not desire to go there, but is led there unwillingly.

original: de la sred pa rang bzhin gyi sgo nas ni de'i rang bzhin mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: de la sred pa rang bzhin gyi sgo nas ni de'i rang bzhin mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Therein, the nature of craving is summarized in three ways:

original: yang srid pa skye bar byed pa dang / dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: yang srid pa skye bar byed pa dang / dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: It is the cause of the arising of existence, it is associated with delight and greed, and it is the delight in this and that.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: srid pa'i sred pa dang / yul gyi sred pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa dang / yul gyi sred pa'o //
translated: it is the craving for existence and the craving for objects.

original: de la yang srid par skye bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang srid par skye bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is the cause of the arising of existence is the craving for existence.

original: dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni yul 'thob tu cha ba rnams dang / thob zin pa rnams @148b dang ; da dung longs ma spyad pa rnams dang / longs spyod cing 'dug pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni yul 'thob tu cha ba rnams dang / thob zin pa rnams @148b dang ; da dung longs ma spyad pa rnams dang / longs spyod cing 'dug pa rnams la'o //
translated: That which is associated with delight and greed is in regard to objects that are sought, those that are obtained, those that are not yet enjoyed, and those that are being enjoyed.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul yongs su btsal ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul yongs su btsal ba rnams la'o //
translated: The delight in this and that is in regard to future objects that are sought.

original: de la dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa'i sgo nas ni sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa'i sgo nas ni sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the fetter of craving is in regard to the craving that is associated with delight and greed.

original: yang srid par skye bar byed pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas ni sred pa'i ltung gis btags par rig par bya ste /üîΩdngos po gang la sred pas kun tu sbyar ba der kun tu rgyug la /
analyzed: yang srid par skye bar byed pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas ni sred pa'i ltung gis btags par rig par bya ste / dngos po gang la sred pas kun tu sbyar ba der kun tu rgyug la /
translated: It should be understood that the descent of craving is due to the production of rebirth and to the delight in this and that.üîΩOne runs to the object to which one is bound by craving.

original: gang du sred pa'i ltung gis btags pa der ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: gang du sred pa'i ltung gis btags pa der ni 'khor ro //
translated: One circles around where one is held down by the descent of craving.

original: de la 'du byed kyi rgyud mtha' med pas na yun ring ngo //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi rgyud mtha' med pas na yun ring ngo //
translated: The continuum of formations is endless, thus it is long.

original: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de byung bas na /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de byung bas na /
translated: It is without a beginning, since it occurs in a succession of causes.

original: sngon gyi mtha' med do //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' med do //
translated: It is without an end, since it occurs in a succession of effects.

original: rnam pa lngas ni byis pa'i 'khor ba'i 'ching ba rnam pa lnga ri rig bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni byis pa'i 'khor ba'i 'ching ba rnam pa lnga ri rig bar bya ste /
translated: The five aspects of the bondage of the childish in cyclic existence should be understood in five aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:
