analyzed: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / bdag la rang dbang yod pa rnams kyang 'tsho ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du mi byed pa dang / chos dang mthun pas bde ba 'dod kyi chos ma yin pas bde ba 'dod pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: They do what is good. They are not controlled by others for the sake of livelihood, even though they are independent. They desire happiness in accordance with the Dharma, not happiness that is contrary to the Dharma.

original: tha mal ba'i tshe'i yo byad rnams legs par srung bar byed de mi rigs par chud gzon par mi byed la /
analyzed: tha mal ba'i tshe'i yo byad rnams legs par srung bar byed de mi rigs par chud gzon par mi byed la /
translated: They properly protect the requisites of ordinary life and do not waste them thoughtlessly.

original: nyes dmigs su lta bzhin du yongs su spyod pa dang / na ba'i yo byad rnams la lta zhing so sor brtags nas sten par byed pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rkyen rnams bsrung ba ste /
analyzed: nyes dmigs su lta bzhin du yongs su spyod pa dang / na ba'i yo byad rnams la lta zhing so sor brtags nas sten par byed pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rkyen rnams bsrung ba ste /
translated: They use them while viewing them as a fault. They attend to the requisites of illness after examining them. They protect against the conditions of untimely death.

original: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni mkhas pa'i rnam pa thams cad du mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni mkhas pa'i rnam pa thams cad du mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These ten aspects should be understood as the expertise of the wise in all respects.

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag med pa'i sgo nas yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa gnyis ni rnam pa gsum gyis khyad zhugs par shes par bya ste /üîΩ'du byed rnams la 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag med pa'i sgo nas yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa gnyis ni rnam pa gsum gyis khyad zhugs par shes par bya ste / 'du byed rnams la 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes la /
translated: The two, thorough understanding and abandonment, with respect to formations as selfless, should be understood as distinguished by three aspects.üîΩWith respect to formations, there is thorough understanding of the afflicted view of the self, but not abandonment.

original: spangs pa ni ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shas cher 'du byed rnams la brjed ngas pa kun tu spyod de /
analyzed: spangs pa ni ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shas cher 'du byed rnams la brjed ngas pa kun tu spyod de /
translated: This is the predominance of the practice of forgetfulness with respect to formations,

original: brjed ngas pa ma yin pa'i shas chung ngo //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa ma yin pa'i shas chung ngo //
translated: and the non-forgetfulness is slight.

original: de las bzlog @150b pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog @150b pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the abandonment of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'di ni de gnyis kyi khyad par dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de gnyis kyi khyad par dang po'o //
translated: This is the first distinction between those two.

original: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa ni bag yod pa yin du zin kyang chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas rgya chen po'am yang na shas cher sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba'i gnas kyi yul mngon du
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa ni bag yod pa yin du zin kyang chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas rgya chen po'am yang na shas cher sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba'i gnas kyi yul mngon du
translated: Moreover, even if one who has not abandoned the afflicted view of the self is heedful, he will still be attached to objects that are the basis of attachment, to objects that are the basis of pleasure and mental pleasure, or else to objects that are the basis of suffering and mental displeasure.

original: byung ba la dran pa nye bar 'jog mi nus na bag med pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: byung ba la dran pa nye bar 'jog mi nus na bag med pa lta ci smos /
translated: If one is not able to establish mindfulness in what has arisen, what need is there to speak of heedlessness?

original: de ni de'i tshe 'jig tshogs la lta bas sems khyab par 'dug ste /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe 'jig tshogs la lta bas sems khyab par 'dug ste /
translated: At that time, the view of the transitory collection pervades the mind.

original: des na sems kyi ngo zin par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na sems kyi ngo zin par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, one is not able to recognize the nature of the mind.

original: de las bzlog pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa yin bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa yin bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the abandonment of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'di ni khyad par gnyis pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par gnyis pa'i //
translated: This is the second distinction.

original: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa ni phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / lo ma dang / yal ga dang / 'dab ma rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du nang gi 'du byed rnams la sems can med pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa ni phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / lo ma dang / yal ga dang / 'dab ma rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du nang gi 'du byed rnams la sems can med pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, for one who has not abandoned the view of the transitory collection, the perception of the absence of a being in internal formations does not remain, just as it does not in external grass, trees, leaves, branches, and petals.

original: de las bzlog pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is the abandonment of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'di ni dus gnyis kyi khyad par gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dus gnyis kyi khyad par gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the third distinction between the two times.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa de la ni khyad par gsum po las ma gtogs par phan yon gsum yang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa de la ni khyad par gsum po las ma gtogs par phan yon gsum yang yod de /
translated: For one who has abandoned the afflicted view of the self, there are three benefits in addition to the three distinctions.

original: de la brten pas phyi ma la yang srid par 'grub par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba ring po mi thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten pas phyi ma la yang srid par 'grub par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba ring po mi thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By relying on that, one quickly abandons the afflictions that create rebirth in future existences.

original: de'i gnyen po'i lam yang dag par 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i lam yang dag par 'grub po //
translated: The path that is the antidote to that is accomplished.

original: rang gi don byas nas kyang lam de la brten pa kho nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i sbyor ba la brtson pas bde bar gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi don byas nas kyang lam de la brten pa kho nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i sbyor ba la brtson pas bde bar gnas so //
translated: Having accomplished one's own purpose, one abides in bliss by striving in the practice of abiding in bliss based solely on that path.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa'i bye brag ni rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa'i bye brag ni rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The meditation on the perception of impermanence in all aspects should be known to have four distinctions.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam pa dang / thabs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam pa dang / thabs so //
translated: They are the result, nature, aspect, and method.

original: de la 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par spong ba dang / gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par spong ba dang / gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
translated: As for the result, it is the complete abandonment of all the attachments of the realm of desire, and the complete abandonment of all the attachments of the realms of form and of the formless, of agitation, conceit and ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba gsum po spong bar bstan to //üîΩnye ba'i nyon mongs @151a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba gsum po spong bar bstan to // nye ba'i nyon mongs @151a * //
translated: It is the abandonment of the three fundamental defilements.

original: pa gsum po las rgod pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi grogs yin no //
analyzed: pa gsum po las rgod pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi grogs yin no //
translated: As for the three secondary defilements, agitation is the companion of attachment to pleasure.

original: nga rgyal ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags kyi grogs yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags kyi grogs yin no //
translated: Conceit is the companion of attachment to form.

original: ma rig pa ni gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi grogs yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi grogs yin no //
translated: Ignorance is the companion of attachment to the formless.

original: yang na tha ma dang gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba mthar thug pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang na tha ma dang gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba mthar thug pa bstan te /
translated: Or else, it is the final limit of the fetters which are favorable to the lower and higher.

original: 'di ni rnam grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam grangs gzhan no //
translated: This is another explanation.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi sgo nas ni thos pa las byung bas ni kun du bstan to //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi sgo nas ni thos pa las byung bas ni kun du bstan to //
translated: As for the nature, it is taught by that which comes from hearing.

original: bsams pa las byung bas bsgom pa las zhugs pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung bas bsgom pa las zhugs pa ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: The one that is entered by way of the meditation that arises from reflection is meditation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni mang du byed do //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni mang du byed do //
translated: The one that is cultivated by way of the meditation that arises from hearing is cultivation.

original: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pas ni kun tu bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pas ni kun tu bstan to //
translated: The one that is demonstrated by way of the mental attention that discerns the characteristics is demonstration.

original: sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni bsgom mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni bsgom mo //
translated: The one that is cultivated by way of the remaining perfections, with the exception of the perfection of application, is cultivation.

original: sbyor ba'i mthar thug pas ni mang du byed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mthar thug pas ni mang du byed de /
translated: The one that is cultivated by way of the perfection of application is cultivation.

original: 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second alternative.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa'i sgo nas ni theg par byas pa dang / gzhir byas pa dang nan tan du bsgrubs te go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa'i sgo nas ni theg par byas pa dang / gzhir byas pa dang nan tan du bsgrubs te go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The one that is undertaken by way of the basis, objective support, and mental attention is undertaken, respectively, by way of the basis, objective support, and mental attention.

original: yun ring por goms par byas pas ni byang bar byas so //
analyzed: yun ring por goms par byas pas ni byang bar byas so //
translated: The one that is perfected by way of long cultivation is perfected.

original: rgyun ma chad pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i tshul gyis ni legs par blangs pa dang / legs par brtsams te 'di ni rang bzhin gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: rgyun ma chad pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i tshul gyis ni legs par blangs pa dang / legs par brtsams te 'di ni rang bzhin gyi bye brag go //
translated: The one that is well taken up and well instigated by way of the uninterrupted and unerring methods is well taken up and well instigated. This is the distinction of nature.

original: de la rnam pa'i bye brag ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de de ltar goms par byed pa ni bag la nyal thams cad yang dag par 'joms so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa'i bye brag ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de de ltar goms par byed pa ni bag la nyal thams cad yang dag par 'joms so //
translated: The specific aspects of this are as follows: by cultivating the perception of impermanence in this way, all latent tendencies are completely destroyed.

original: sa 'og ma'i dge ba thams cad ni 'dor ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i dge ba thams cad ni 'dor ro //
translated: All virtues of the lower stages are relinquished.

original: sa gong ma'i dge ba thams cad ni yang dag par len to //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i dge ba thams cad ni yang dag par len to //
translated: All virtues of the higher stages are taken up.

original: de ma yin pa mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang rgya che ba'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang rgya che ba'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One abides in the supreme and extensive mode among all perceptions, such as the perception of foulness and so on.

original: thams cad du 'gro bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes omnipresent.

original: ji ltar thams cad du 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad du 'gro zhe na /
translated: How does one become omnipresent?

original: ji ltar gzung ba'i dngos po la yongs su rtog pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa la yang de dang 'dra ste ;
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba'i dngos po la yongs su rtog pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa la yang de dang 'dra ste ;
translated: Just as one thoroughly investigates the object that is grasped, so too it is the same for the grasper.

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not separate from its characteristics.

original: zag pa med pa'i mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One also attains the uncontaminated perception of impermanence.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das par gzhol zhing der 'bab la der bab ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das par gzhol zhing der 'bab la der bab ste /
translated: All those discriminations, whether with or without outflows, are directed toward nirvana, flow toward it, and lead to it.

original: ma @151b rig pa'i mun pa chen po gtan du spong ba'i gnyen por yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma @151b rig pa'i mun pa chen po gtan du spong ba'i gnyen por yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They become the antidote for the abandonment of the great darkness of ignorance.

original: de spangs nas kyang mi slob pa yongs su dag cing yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de spangs nas kyang mi slob pa yongs su dag cing yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having abandoned that, he becomes one who is beyond training, completely pure and completely purified.

original: slob pa zag pa med pa thams cad kyi bdag po yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob pa zag pa med pa thams cad kyi bdag po yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He also attains the state of being the lord of all the beyond-training states without outflows.

original: de la thabs kyi sgo nas ni gcig pu lkog dpen pa na 'dug cing 'du byed rnams la phyin ci ma log pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pas mi rtag par nye bar rtog go //
analyzed: de la thabs kyi sgo nas ni gcig pu lkog dpen pa na 'dug cing 'du byed rnams la phyin ci ma log pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pas mi rtag par nye bar rtog go //
translated: In this regard, from the point of view of means, he is alone in a secluded place, and by means of his unmistaken and uninterrupted mental attention to the conditioned forces, he investigates impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa de ni mthong ba'i lam la bdag tu 'du shes pas mi gnas te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa de ni mthong ba'i lam la bdag tu 'du shes pas mi gnas te /
translated: Endowed with the discrimination of impermanence, he does not dwell on the path of insight with the discrimination of self.

original: bdag med pa'i 'du shes la gnas pas gang du bsgom pa'i mi slob pa'i lam la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang dag par bcom nas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i 'du shes la gnas pas gang du bsgom pa'i mi slob pa'i lam la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang dag par bcom nas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by abiding in the perception of selflessness, he conquers the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù on the path of no-more-learning, and attains the two kinds of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la zhugs la /üîΩtshogs ma bsags pa la ni tshogs dang mi mthun pa'i chos lnga yod de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la zhugs la / tshogs ma bsags pa la ni tshogs dang mi mthun pa'i chos lnga yod de /
translated: He has entered the path to nirvana,üîΩbut he has not accumulated the requisites.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He has five qualities that are incompatible with the requisites:

original: sngon bdag pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' mgur spyod pa la brten nas yid smon dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i sgo nas mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa dang de dag la brten nas lung mnos pa dang /
analyzed: sngon bdag pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' mgur spyod pa la brten nas yid smon dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i sgo nas mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa dang de dag la brten nas lung mnos pa dang /
translated: He has regret, lamentation, and so forth, because he is thinking about his former possessions, play, joy, and sexual relations.üîΩHe is forgetful and does not remember the teachings he has received and mastered.

original: kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams la brjed ngas shing chos rnams mi lcigs pa dang / ha cang mang du zos pa dang / ha cang nyung du zos pa'am /
analyzed: kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams la brjed ngas shing chos rnams mi lcigs pa dang / ha cang mang du zos pa dang / ha cang nyung du zos pa'am /
translated: He eats too much or too little.

original: lus lci ba dang / lus nyam chung bas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par mngon par mi dga' ba dang / gnyid che ba'am /
analyzed: lus lci ba dang / lus nyam chung bas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par mngon par mi dga' ba dang / gnyid che ba'am /
translated: having a heavy body,

original: de spong ba la ma goms bas shas cher gnyid kyi kun nas dkris pa la kun tu bsten pa dang / 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas shing yang dag par spyod pa'i sbyor ba btang ba'o //
analyzed: de spong ba la ma goms bas shas cher gnyid kyi kun nas dkris pa la kun tu bsten pa dang / 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas shing yang dag par spyod pa'i sbyor ba btang ba'o //
translated: and having a great deal of sleepiness or torpor due to a weak body, and thus not delighting in the practice of pure conduct.

original: tshogs dang mi mthun pa'i chos lnga po 'di dag dang mthun pa'i chos kyang lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs dang mi mthun pa'i chos lnga po 'di dag dang mthun pa'i chos kyang lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five favorable conditions are the opposites of those five unfavorable conditions.üîΩThe five unfavorable conditions for the accumulation of merit are:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: being a heretic,üîΩnot being free from attachment to any of the two types of objects of desire,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis las gang yang rung bas 'dod chags dang bral bar ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis las gang yang rung bas 'dod chags dang bral bar ma gyur pa ste /
translated: not being free from the fetters of desire,

original: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa na kun nas dkris pa thag bsring ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / gnyen po thob pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas @152a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa na kun nas dkris pa thag bsring ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / gnyen po thob pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas @152a * //
translated: not being free from the fetters of malice,üîΩand not being free from the fetters of violence.üîΩThe five favorable conditions are the opposites of those five unfavorable conditions.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo ma bsdams pa dang / zas kyi tshod ma rig pa dang srod dang tho rangs mi nyal bar brtson pas brtson par mi byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos thos pa dang kun chub par byas pa rnams la lhag mthong med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo ma bsdams pa dang / zas kyi tshod ma rig pa dang srod dang tho rangs mi nyal bar brtson pas brtson par mi byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos thos pa dang kun chub par byas pa rnams la lhag mthong med pa'o //
translated: not being free from passion, not restraining the senses, not knowing the proper amount in eating, not being diligent in being watchful during the first and last parts of the night, and not having insight into the wholesome states that one has heard and understood.

original: de las bzlog pa ni tshogs dang mthun pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni tshogs dang mthun pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these are the favorable conditions for the accumulations.

original: de ltar rgyu dang bcas pa'i tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la gnas shing dge sbyong gi gyen du mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par 'dod pa la ni yang dag pa'i lam gyi gdams ngag ston pas bstan pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang bcas pa'i tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la gnas shing dge sbyong gi gyen du mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par 'dod pa la ni yang dag pa'i lam gyi gdams ngag ston pas bstan pa lnga yod de /
translated: Thus, one who is established in the favorable conditions for the accumulations together with their causes, and who desires to transcend sorrow through the ascetic practices, should be taught the five points of the true path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five points?

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos mthong ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa dang / chos bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa nyi tshes kyang som nyi med cing the tshom mi za ba'o //

analyzed: 'di lta ste ;

original: bslab pa las 'gal bar byas pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / chos 'dul ba khas blangs pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / khyim spangs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa las 'gal bar byas pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / chos 'dul ba khas blangs pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / khyim spangs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'o //
translated: from transgressing the precepts, from accepting the Dharma and Vinaya, and from abandoning the household life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa na rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas mtshan ma ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa na rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas mtshan ma ston par mdzad de /
translated: When the TathƒÅgata wishes to teach the Dharma to the disciples, he displays four kinds of signs:

original: gdan ches dma' ba las bzhengs nas gdan ches mtho ba la bzhugs pa dang / chos ston pa dang 'tsham pa'i spyod lam mdzad pa dang / gsung sel ba dang / su la chos ston par bzhed pa de'i gdong du glang po che'i lta stangs kyis gzigs pa'o ;
analyzed: gdan ches dma' ba las bzhengs nas gdan ches mtho ba la bzhugs pa dang / chos ston pa dang 'tsham pa'i spyod lam mdzad pa dang / gsung sel ba dang / su la chos ston par bzhed pa de'i gdong du glang po che'i lta stangs kyis gzigs pa'o ;
translated: He sits on a very high seat after rising from a very low seat, he acts in a manner suitable for teaching the Dharma, he clears his throat, and he looks at the face of the person from whom he wishes to hear the Dharma with the gaze of an elephant.

original: / nyan thos 'gal ba byed byed pa ni ngo tsha ba'i gnas gsum la gnas nas ston pa'i chad du 'gro ste /
analyzed: / nyan thos 'gal ba byed byed pa ni ngo tsha ba'i gnas gsum la gnas nas ston pa'i chad du 'gro ste /
translated: The disciples who are to be corrected should approach the teacher with three thoughts in mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: bdag gis 'gal bar byas par rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / ston pa ma mnyes par byas pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / spyod lam dul bas ston pa mnyes par ma byas pa na thang du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'gal bar byas par rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / ston pa ma mnyes par byas pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / spyod lam dul bas ston pa mnyes par ma byas pa na thang du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: They are: the thought that they have done wrong, the thought that they have displeased the teacher, and the thought that they should not be so ill-mannered as to displease the teacher again.

original: ston pa ni nyan thos 'gal bar byed byed pa la rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas yang dag par gleng bar mdzad de /
analyzed: ston pa ni nyan thos 'gal bar byed byed pa la rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas yang dag par gleng bar mdzad de /
translated: The teacher should admonish the disciples who are to be corrected in three ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'tsho ba ngan pa khas blangs pa dang / bsam pa thag pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam @154a * //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ngan pa khas blangs pa dang / bsam pa thag pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam @154a * //
translated: It is to have a pure livelihood. It is to have a pure motivation. It is to have a pure livelihood. It is to have a pure attitude. It is to have a pure view.

original: pa 'tsham pa ma yin pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: pa 'tsham pa ma yin pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: He accepts a bad livelihood, he has a bad attitude, and he does not accomplish a suitable livelihood.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la sogs par sgrub pa ni rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la sogs par sgrub pa ni rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The practice of the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya is to be understood as having six aspects in all ways:

original: kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa dang / bsam pa'i nyes pa dang / sbyor ba'i nyes pa dang / shes pa'i nyes pa dang / rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / rten gyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa dang / bsam pa'i nyes pa dang / sbyor ba'i nyes pa dang / shes pa'i nyes pa dang / rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / rten gyi nyes pa'o //
translated: the fault of practice, the fault of attitude, the fault of application, the fault of knowledge, the fault of conception, and the fault of basis.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pas chags pa dang / zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pas sdang ba ni kun tu spyod pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pas chags pa dang / zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pas sdang ba ni kun tu spyod pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: Among them, being attached through the entanglement of desire and being hostile through the entanglement of hatred is the fault of practice.

original: 'dod chags shas che ba dang / zhe sdang shas che ba des ngo tsha med pa dang / ngo tsha ba med pas dang du len par byed pa ni bsam pa'i nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags shas che ba dang / zhe sdang shas che ba des ngo tsha med pa dang / ngo tsha ba med pas dang du len par byed pa ni bsam pa'i nyes pa yin te /
translated: Being very desirous and very hostile, one accepts shamelessness and lack of embarrassment. This is the fault of attitude.

original: chags pa bas ni chags pa'i bsam pa tha chad yin no //
analyzed: chags pa bas ni chags pa'i bsam pa tha chad yin no //
translated: The intention of passion is worse than passion.

original: de bzhin du sdang bas ni zhe sdang gi bsam pa tha chad yin no //üîΩde la sbyor ba'i nyes pa ni brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdang bas ni zhe sdang gi bsam pa tha chad yin no // de la sbyor ba'i nyes pa ni brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa'am /
translated: The intention of aversion is worse than aversion.

original: yang na brtson 'grus lhod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na brtson 'grus lhod pa'o //
translated: The fault of application is either not applying effort or applying it weakly.

original: de la shes pa'i nyes pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brjed bas shing yid mi gzhungs par gnas la /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i nyes pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brjed bas shing yid mi gzhungs par gnas la /
translated: The fault of knowledge is that one is forgetful and lacks mental stability in the knowledge that comes from learning and reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba la ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba la ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: In the knowledge that comes from meditation, one lacks meditative concentration.

original: de la rtog pa'i nyes pa ni khyim pa dang mthun pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i rtog pa chos 'dul ba 'di las sems 'khrul par byed pa la mang du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtog pa'i nyes pa ni khyim pa dang mthun pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i rtog pa chos 'dul ba 'di las sems 'khrul par byed pa la mang du rtog pa'o //
translated: The fault of thought is that one often thinks thoughts that are in accord with householders, that are sinful, unwholesome, and cause the mind to wander from this spiritual way.

original: de la rten gyi nyes pa ni de'i rten sngon gyi rgyus yang dag par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rten gyi nyes pa ni de'i rten sngon gyi rgyus yang dag par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The fault of basis is that the basis of that person is not well established by previous causes.

original: yang dag par grub pa ma yin pa de'i rgyus dad pa phal ba chung ngu dang ldan zhing tshul khrims rnams la gus par 'dong pa chung du dang / dran pa chung ngu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab chung ngu phal pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par grub pa ma yin pa de'i rgyus dad pa phal ba chung ngu dang ldan zhing tshul khrims rnams la gus par 'dong pa chung du dang / dran pa chung ngu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab chung ngu phal pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of that, they have little faith, little respect for the precepts, little mindfulness, and little natural wisdom.

original: bstan pa la 'jug pa ni rnam pa bzhis log par bsgrub par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la 'jug pa ni rnam pa bzhis log par bsgrub par 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four ways of misapprehending the teaching:üîΩbecause of dullness of mind,

original: yid rtul ba dang / bsam pa ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: yid rtul ba dang / bsam pa ma dag pa ste /
translated: because of impurity of intention,üîΩbecause of seeking an opportunity to steal the Dharma,üîΩbecause of desire for food, drink, clothing, and livelihood,

original: chos la rku ba'i phyir glags lta ba dang / zas dang skom dang gos dang 'tsho ba'i phyir dang / rgyal po dang chom rkun gyis nges par byas pa dang / bu lon dang 'jigs pas gzir ba'o //
analyzed: chos la rku ba'i phyir glags lta ba dang / zas dang skom dang gos dang 'tsho ba'i phyir dang / rgyal po dang chom rkun gyis nges par byas pa dang / bu lon dang 'jigs pas gzir ba'o //
translated: because of being forced by kings and robbers,üîΩand because of being oppressed by debts and fear.

original: de ltar log par sgrub pa yang slu ba rnam pa gnyis kyis bslus te khyim gyi @154b rang gi don las nyams pas bsdus pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i rang gi don las nyams pas bslus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar log par sgrub pa yang slu ba rnam pa gnyis kyis bslus te khyim gyi @154b rang gi don las nyams pas bsdus pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i rang gi don las nyams pas bslus pa'o //
translated: This wrong practice is also a deception by two kinds of deception: the deception of the loss of one's own aim in the home life, and the deception of the loss of one's own aim in the life of renunciation.

original: log par bsgrub pa de la yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis yod de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa de la yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: This wrong practice has two causes:

original: dngos po gsum gyi rtog pa ngan pa dang / de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i 'du shes ngan pa'o//
analyzed: dngos po gsum gyi rtog pa ngan pa dang / de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i 'du shes ngan pa'o//
translated: the bad discrimination of the three things, and the bad idea that precedes it.

original: dngos po gsum ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po gsum ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The three things should be understood as above.

original: de dag la 'du shes ngan pas mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'du shes ngan pas mtshan ma dang mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The bad idea is the grasping of signs and the grasping of false ideas about them.

original: de'i 'og tu de dang mthun pa'i chos la mang du rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dang mthun pa'i chos la mang du rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod par byed do //
translated: After that, one thinks about and judges those things in accordance with those ideas.

original: log par sgrub pa'i rgyu de spang ba la yang gnyen po rnam pa gnyis kho na yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i rgyu de spang ba la yang gnyen po rnam pa gnyis kho na yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The two kinds of antidotes should be understood as the abandonment of the causes of wrong practice.

original: rtog pa spang ba'i phyir ni phyin ci ma log pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa gnyis kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sems legs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa spang ba'i phyir ni phyin ci ma log pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa gnyis kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sems legs par gnas pa'o //
translated: The mind is well-established in the applications of mindfulness by the two, non-erroneously and uninterruptedly, in order to abandon discursive thought.

original: 'du shes spangs pa'i phyir ni mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o ;
analyzed: 'du shes spangs pa'i phyir ni mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o ;
translated: The cultivation of concentration by the mind without signs is in order to abandon ideation.

original: / gnyen po sgom pa de yang gnyen po bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag por byed pas 'grub par gyur gyi 'dun pa drag po med pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / gnyen po sgom pa de yang gnyen po bsgom pa la 'dun pa drag por byed pas 'grub par gyur gyi 'dun pa drag po med pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that cultivation of the counteragent is accomplished by the intense will to cultivate the counteragent, not by the absence of the intense will.

original: 'dun pa drag po de yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa drag po de yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis las 'byung ste /
translated: And that intense will arises from two causes:

original: gnyen po de nyid kyi 'bras bu che ba'i phyir dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po de nyid kyi 'bras bu che ba'i phyir dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the greatness of the result of that very counteragent, and because of the non-commonality with outsiders.

original: de la 'bras bu che ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la goms par byed pa na khams gnyis kyi bdud rtsi'i sgo rnyed nas 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu che ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la goms par byed pa na khams gnyis kyi bdud rtsi'i sgo rnyed nas 'dug ste /
translated: Therein, the greatness of the result is that, when one is cultivating the concentration of the signless mind, one finds the door of immortality of the two realms and abides in it.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: spong ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams te /
analyzed: spong ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams te /
translated: the element of abandonment and the element of detachment.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: It is the remainderless realm and the realm without remainder.

original: de la gnas pa'i drung na ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis 'dug la da dung rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i drung na ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis 'dug la da dung rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The two aspects of nirvana are present in the vicinity of the one who is situated in that realm, but he has not yet attained it in every way.

original: de la thun mong ma yin pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la thun mong ma yin pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The following is the uncommon explanation.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin med la chos 'di pa rnams la ni yod de /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin med la chos 'di pa rnams la ni yod de /
translated: The concentration of signlessness does not exist for those outside this teaching, but it does exist for those who are Buddhists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni gang la dmigs pa de la sgro 'dogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni gang la dmigs pa de la sgro 'dogs par byed kyi /
translated: They superimpose on the object of their observation.

original: de nyi tshe tsam du mthong ba ma yin pa dang / gang mi dmigs pa de la ni rnam par rtog par byed de /üîΩbdag tu bltas pa des 'du @155a * //
analyzed: de nyi tshe tsam du mthong ba ma yin pa dang / gang mi dmigs pa de la ni rnam par rtog par byed de / bdag tu bltas pa des 'du @155a * //
translated: They do not see it as it is, and they conceptualize what is not observed.

original: byed rnams la kun tu rmongs te /
analyzed: byed rnams la kun tu rmongs te /
translated: They are confused about the formations due to the view of self.

original: yang na ni lus tsam la bdag tu mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: yang na ni lus tsam la bdag tu mngon par zhen to //
translated: Or else, they cling to the body alone as the self.üîΩOr else, they cling to the formless realm as the self.

original: yang na ni gzugs med pa la yang na ni gnyi ga'i spyi la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na ni gzugs med pa la yang na ni gnyi ga'i spyi la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, they cling to the general characteristics of both form and the formless realm as the self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa de dag ni bdag med par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam nas sems kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi 'jug na dga' ba'i tshul gyis gnas par ltag la byed de /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa de dag ni bdag med par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam nas sems kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi 'jug na dga' ba'i tshul gyis gnas par ltag la byed de /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúIf I were to enter nirvƒÅ·πáa, I would cease to exist.‚Äù

original: yongs su yi chad pa'i phyir sems phyir ldog pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //üîΩde las ldog pa chos 'di pa sdug bsngal tsam zhig 'gog par zad do snyam du khong du chud pa rnams ni sems kyang phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la de la zhi bar yang lta bas na de gal te slob pa zhig yin na ni de rang nyid
analyzed: yongs su yi chad pa'i phyir sems phyir ldog pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro // de las ldog pa chos 'di pa sdug bsngal tsam zhig 'gog par zad do snyam du khong du chud pa rnams ni sems kyang phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la de la zhi bar yang lta bas na de gal te slob pa zhig yin na ni de rang nyid
translated: They turn back from nirvƒÅ·πáa because of their fear of annihilation.üîΩThose who turn away from that view and understand that this Dharma is only the cessation of suffering do not turn back from nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: They see it as peace. If they are learners, they attain nirvƒÅ·πáa for themselves.

original: lam bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni yongs su mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni yongs su mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not seek advice and instruction from others in order to develop the path.

original: gal te mi slob pa zhig yin na ni de yang rang nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa zad pa ni yongs su mi tshol te /
analyzed: gal te mi slob pa zhig yin na ni de yang rang nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa zad pa ni yongs su mi tshol te /
translated: If they are not learners, they do not seek the extinction of the defilements, because they are already in nirvana.

original: sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'du byed rnams rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' kho nar zad do //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'du byed rnams rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' kho nar zad do //
translated: They are in nirvana only because the formations that arose from previous causes cease by themselves.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / rgyu dang phan yon shes pa gnyis //
analyzed: sdom ni / rgyu dang phan yon shes pa gnyis //
translated: The two knowledges of cause and benefit,

original: byis pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: byis pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa lnga //
translated: the five aspects of the stage of the fool,üîΩthe distinction of the two views,

original: lta ba gnyis kyi khyad par dang // de la bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis kyi khyad par dang // de la bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and what is to be taught in that.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'du byed rnams kyi thun mong ba dang / thun mong la yin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'du byed rnams kyi thun mong ba dang / thun mong la yin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: These two are the common and uncommon causes of formations.

original: de la thun mong ba ni dga' ba sngon gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la thun mong ba ni dga' ba sngon gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Among them, the common cause is the previous cause of joy.

original: dga' ba des skye ba'i gnas de dang der skyed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas skye ba'i gnas der skye bar 'gyur bar lus brlan par byed de /
analyzed: dga' ba des skye ba'i gnas de dang der skyed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas skye ba'i gnas der skye bar 'gyur bar lus brlan par byed de /
translated: That joy moistens the body in the place of rebirth, in terms of the cause of rebirth, and in terms of the discordant side of the cause of rebirth.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang skye ba'i gnas de dang der skye ba'i rgyu yin mod kyi skye ba'i gnas der dga' ba skyes na skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang skye ba'i gnas de dang der skye ba'i rgyu yin mod kyi skye ba'i gnas der dga' ba skyes na skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although all the afflictions are causes of rebirth in a certain place of rebirth, when joy arises in that place of rebirth, there is no perception that is discordant with rebirth.

original: de yang gzugs kho na'i yin par bstan te /üîΩsngon gyi rgyu las skyes na rgyu gzhan la mi ltos te /
analyzed: de yang gzugs kho na'i yin par bstan te / sngon gyi rgyu las skyes na rgyu gzhan la mi ltos te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that this joy is only in the form realm.

original: shin tu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it arises from a previous cause, it does not depend on another cause because it is very close.

original: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin @155b bar tshong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa yin te /
analyzed: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin @155b bar tshong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa yin te /
translated: The uncommon cause is contact that is the cause of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: This is the cause of feeling and so on, the mental factors.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid dang bcas pa'i ming dang / gzugs rnam pa bcu yang yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid dang bcas pa'i ming dang / gzugs rnam pa bcu yang yin te /
translated: The ten aspects of name-and-form, along with the mind that has just ceased, are the six consciousnesses.

original: sngon gyi rgyu gzhan gyis skyed pa rnams ni skad cig re re la rgyu yang gzhan la ltos te skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu gzhan gyis skyed pa rnams ni skad cig re re la rgyu yang gzhan la ltos te skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those that are generated by other previous causes are produced in dependence on other causes in each moment.

analyzed: de rgyu zhing 'gro ba dang gnas pa de gnyis kyis mi slob par 'gyur te /

original: par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'jig chogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa thams cad ni cha gsum du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams dang ; sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams so //

analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams ni bdag ci zhig tu gyur ji zhig tu ni 'gyur /

analyzed: lta bar gyur pa bco brgyad po 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa'i bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi'o //

translated: Those who propound the view of eternalism have sixteen, those who propound the view of nihilism have seven, those who propound the view of nirvana in this life have five and those who propound the fourty four views have fourty four.

analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa rnams kyi lta ba 'di dag @156b bsdus na lngar 'gyur te /

translated: those who profess the existence of perception, those who profess the non-existence of perception, those who profess neither the existence nor the non-existence of perception, those who profess annihilation, and those who profess the attainment of final nirvƒÅ·πáa in this very life.

analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' bar smra ba rnams so //
translated: those who profess eternalism, those who profess annihilation, and those who profess the attainment of final nirvƒÅ·πáa in this very life.

analyzed: de la lta bar gyur pa 'di dag thams cad ni rgyu rnam pa drug gis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: All these views are established by six causes:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

analyzed: rgyu dang / bstan pa dang / bsam gtan la brten pa dang ; dus dang lta ba la brten pa dang / skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: cause, teaching, reliance on concentration, reliance on time and views, and place of birth.

analyzed: de la thams cad kyi rgyu ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The cause of all of them is the view of the transitory collection.

original: bstan pa ni lta bar gyur pa ston pa dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa snod kyi lung 'dogs pa bzhin du nyin thor thos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni lta bar gyur pa ston pa dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa snod kyi lung 'dogs pa bzhin du nyin thor thos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Teaching is the teaching of views, which is not the true Dharma. It is the hearing of what is not the true Dharma, like the transmission of a vessel.

original: de la bsam gtan la brten pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sngar thos pa la mos pas nges pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la brten pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sngar thos pa la mos pas nges pa thob pa'o //
translated: Among those, that based on meditative absorption is the attainment of certainty through conviction in what was previously heard, based on meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan de yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa dang / lha'i mig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan de yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa dang / lha'i mig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That meditative absorption is endowed with recollection of past lives and endowed with the divine eye.

original: de la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa'i rtag par smra ba rnams las chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por yongs su dag pa dang / mtha' dang mtha' med pa rnam pa bzhi las gang gis snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal ba tshar phyin pa'i yul gyi dran pa ste /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa'i rtag par smra ba rnams las chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por yongs su dag pa dang / mtha' dang mtha' med pa rnam pa bzhi las gang gis snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal ba tshar phyin pa'i yul gyi dran pa ste /
translated: Among those, recollection of past lives is the recollection of objects that has reached the end of the eon of destruction and formation of the world system, from the four aspects of the view of permanence that is the investigation of the past limit, which is purified as small, medium, and great, and as having an end and no end.

original: gang gi tshe chags pa'i gnas skabs yang dag par rjes su dran pa de'i tshe ni 'du shes rnam pa gsum gyis gcig tu nges par steng dang 'og dran te thur du mnar med pa la thug pa dang / gyen du bsam gtan bzhi pa la thug pa'i 'jig rten gyi tshad nges shing mu thug nges par dran te de'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang thang kar ni gcig tu nges par tshad med pa'i rnam par yang dag par rjes su dran te mtha' yas pa'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chags pa'i gnas skabs yang dag par rjes su dran pa de'i tshe ni 'du shes rnam pa gsum gyis gcig tu nges par steng dang 'og dran te thur du mnar med pa la thug pa dang / gyen du bsam gtan bzhi pa la thug pa'i 'jig rten gyi tshad nges shing mu thug nges par dran te de'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ro // gzhan yang thang kar ni gcig tu nges par tshad med pa'i rnam par yang dag par rjes su dran te mtha' yas pa'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ro //
translated: When he recollects the state of passion as neither having a limit nor having no limit, then he recollects the world as neither having a limit nor having no limit, and he becomes one who has the perception of a world that neither has a limit nor has no limit.üîΩWhen he recollects the state of passion as one, then he recollects the world as one, and he becomes one who has the perception of the world as one.üîΩWhen he recollects the state of passion as manifold, then he recollects the world as manifold, and he becomes one who has the perception of the world as manifold.

original: de gnyis ka dang ldan pa'i dran pas ni 'jig rten gnyi ga'i 'du shes dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka dang ldan pa'i dran pas ni 'jig rten gnyi ga'i 'du shes dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he recollects the state of passion as both one and manifold, then he recollects the world as both one and manifold, and he becomes one who has the perception of the world as both one and manifold.üîΩWhen he recollects the state of passion as neither one nor manifold, then he recollects the world as neither one nor manifold, and he becomes one who has the perception of the world as neither one nor manifold.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs rjes su dran pa ni mtha'i 'du shes can yang ma @157a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs rjes su dran pa ni mtha'i 'du shes can yang ma @157a * //
translated: When he recollects the state of passion as fine, then he recollects the world as fine, and he becomes one who has the perception of the world as fine.

original: yin mtha' med pa'i 'du shes can yang ma yin par gnas te snod rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin mtha' med pa'i 'du shes can yang ma yin par gnas te snod rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not have the idea of infinity, because they do not perceive any receptacle whatsoever.

original: kha cig ni bsam gtan la brten pa nyi tshe'i sgo nas kha cig rtag pa rnams dang / rgyu med par smra ba rnams dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni bsam gtan la brten pa nyi tshe'i sgo nas kha cig rtag pa rnams dang / rgyu med par smra ba rnams dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Some gods are eternalists, some are nihilists, some are the gods of no-thought, and some are the gods of non-percipient beings.

original: 'di gnyis ni rnam par dag pa'i lha yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rnam par dag pa'i lha yin te /

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: They are not very pure, and they are very pure.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lha yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lha yin te /
translated: Among them, those who are in the worldly meditative absorptions are the gods who are not very pure.

original: bden pa rnams mngon par mi shes pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mngon par mi shes pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not fully understand the truths, and their minds are not completely liberated.

original: chos 'di pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lha yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lha yin te /
translated: The meditative attainments of those who are Dharma practitioners are very pure gods.

original: bden pa rnams mngon par shes pa dang sems shin tu rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mngon par shes pa dang sems shin tu rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have direct knowledge of the truths and their minds are completely liberated.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba ni gnyis te /
translated: Nondistraction is twofold:

original: rtog pa dang bcas mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: with concepts and without concepts.

original: de la gcig ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la gcig ni shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams kyi'o //
