original: cig shos ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: The second is that of the gods who are very pure.

original: de la snga ma shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams ni bdag nyid lha nyid yin pa dang / rnam par mi g-yeng bar gnas pa'i phyir rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la snga ma shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams ni bdag nyid lha nyid yin pa dang / rnam par mi g-yeng bar gnas pa'i phyir rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, the gods who are not very pure are called gods of nondistraction because they are gods by nature and because they abide in nondistraction.

original: de dag ni phyi ma shos dag gis rnam par mi g-yeng ba las dri ba dris na bden pa rnams dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la mi mkhas pa'i phyir gzhan nas gzhan du gtam rlung skur bar byed de /
analyzed: de dag ni phyi ma shos dag gis rnam par mi g-yeng ba las dri ba dris na bden pa rnams dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la mi mkhas pa'i phyir gzhan nas gzhan du gtam rlung skur bar byed de /
translated: Because they are unskilled in the meditative stabilization of mind that is truth and signless, when questioned by others, they will speak in a way that is inconsistent with what they have heard.

original: de dag ni snga nas sems kyis sems la mngon par 'du byed cing bdag kyang rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha yin mod kyi bdag cag ma yin pa gang gzhan rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha bden pa rnams dang / mtshan ma med pa la lhag par ches mkhas par gyur pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: de dag ni snga nas sems kyis sems la mngon par 'du byed cing bdag kyang rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha yin mod kyi bdag cag ma yin pa gang gzhan rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha bden pa rnams dang / mtshan ma med pa la lhag par ches mkhas par gyur pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúThere are other gods who are not distracted, who are even more skilled in the truths and in the signless than we are.

original: de dag gis bdag cag la de'i skabs nas dri ba dris na ni de la bdag cag gis lan gdab pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bdag cag la de'i skabs nas dri ba dris na ni de la bdag cag gis lan gdab pa /
translated: If they question us about this, we will not be able to answer them.

original: lan log par 'debs par 'ong ste /üîΩyang na ni yod pa la skur ba 'debs @157b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan log par 'debs par 'ong ste / yang na ni yod pa la skur ba 'debs @157b par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will give the wrong answer.üîΩWe will either deny what exists

original: yang na ni med bzhin du khas len par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: yang na ni med bzhin du khas len par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: or assert what does not exist.‚Äù

original: de dag lan gdab pa la nyes pa de lta bu dag mthong nas thams cad kyi thams cad du lan mi gdab po snyam du rtog na de la yang nyes pa yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag lan gdab pa la nyes pa de lta bu dag mthong nas thams cad kyi thams cad du lan mi gdab po snyam du rtog na de la yang nyes pa yod par mthong ste /
translated: If they think, ‚ÄúWe will not answer at all because we see such faults in answering,‚Äù then they see faults in that too.

original: gzhan dag gis mi shes pa tsam du 'dzin cing des rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha las dams  par 'gyur la de dag g-yo spyod cing 'di snyam du rtog ste /üîΩbdag cag gi lan ni 'di skad du kho bo cag rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi gsang chen ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩrang gis rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mi shes pa tsam du 'dzin cing des rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i lha las dams  par 'gyur la de dag g-yo spyod cing 'di snyam du rtog ste / bdag cag gi lan ni 'di skad du kho bo cag rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi gsang chen ni / 'di lta ste / rang gis rtogs pa'am /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúWe will be despised by others as if we were ignorant and we will be despised by the gods who are not distracted.üîΩThey will think, ‚ÄòWe will answer, ‚ÄúThe great secret of the pure gods is not to be revealed by stirring the wind with the path of purification or by understanding it ourselves.‚Äù

original: rnam par dag pa'i lam gyi sgo nas rlung sprugs te bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes lan btab na legs so snyam ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lam gyi sgo nas rlung sprugs te bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes lan btab na legs so snyam ste /
translated: That is the best answer.‚Äù

original: de dag gis de ltar brtags nas so sor brtags shing tshig gis gtam rlung skur bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis de ltar brtags nas so sor brtags shing tshig gis gtam rlung skur bar byed do //
translated: Having investigated in this way, they will investigate and stir up the wind of speech with words.

original: de ltar log par kun du rtog pa la gnas pa de dag gi sems rnam par dag pa'i lha mchog tu gyur pa rnams kyi sems kyis khyab par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar log par kun du rtog pa la gnas pa de dag gi sems rnam par dag pa'i lha mchog tu gyur pa rnams kyi sems kyis khyab par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the minds of those who are attached to such false imagination are pervaded by the minds of the highest gods, who have pure minds.

original: rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab tu shes so //
translated: They know it.

original: de dag ni bdag cag dma' bar 'dzin par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas phal cher lan glon par mi byed de de kho nas yongs su grol ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag cag dma' bar 'dzin par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas phal cher lan glon par mi byed de de kho nas yongs su grol ba ma yin la /
translated: They do not usually respond, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is not right for us to belittle them.‚Äù They are not completely liberated by that alone.

original: gnas de la yang gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas de la yang gnas pa yin no //
translated: They also abide in that state.

original: kha cig ni blun te ;
analyzed: kha cig ni blun te ;
translated: Some are foolish.

original: zhi gnas nyi tshe la spyod pas g-yo thabs kyis gtam rlung skur ba sbyor mi nus te /
analyzed: zhi gnas nyi tshe la spyod pas g-yo thabs kyis gtam rlung skur ba sbyor mi nus te /
translated: They engage in mere tranquility, so they are unable to engage in deceptive speech.

original: de ji skad ston pa de bzhin du tshang par khas blangs la de nyid brjod par bya'o snyam du rtog ste /
analyzed: de ji skad ston pa de bzhin du tshang par khas blangs la de nyid brjod par bya'o snyam du rtog ste /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúJust as it is taught, I will completely accept it and express just that.‚Äù

original: de dag ni rtog pa'i khyad par las rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rtog pa'i khyad par las rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: They are established as four types from the perspective of their distinctions.

original: de la dus kyi sgo nas ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la brten te rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dus kyi sgo nas ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la brten te rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa yin no //
translated: As for the time period, any speculation based on the past and present is speculation about the prior limit.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa yin no //
translated: Any speculation based on the future is speculation about the later limit.

original: de la lta ba la brten pa'i sgo nas ni lta ba gsum la brten te snga ma bzhin no //üîΩde la lta ba la brten pa dang pos ni tshe 'di la bdag gzugs can yin par rtog la de phyin chad kyang gzugs can nyid dam 'du shes can nam /üîΩ'du shes can ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de la lta ba la brten pa'i sgo nas ni lta ba gsum la brten te snga ma bzhin no // de la lta ba la brten pa dang pos ni tshe 'di la bdag gzugs can yin par rtog la de phyin chad kyang gzugs can nyid dam 'du shes can nam / 'du shes can ma yin pa'am /
translated: As for the view, any speculation based on the three views is as above.

original: 'du shes can yang ma yin 'du shes can ma yin pa yang ma yin @158a * //üîΩpar rtog go //
analyzed: 'du shes can yang ma yin 'du shes can ma yin pa yang ma yin @158a * // par rtog go //
translated: By the first view, one speculates that in this life one has a body, and that in the future one will have a body, or that one will have perception, or that one will not have perception, or that one will neither have perception nor not have perception.

original: gnyis pas ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma la gzugs can ma yin par snga ma bzhin du rtog go //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma la gzugs can ma yin par snga ma bzhin du rtog go //
translated: By the second, one speculates that in this life and the next one will not have a body, as above.

original: lta ba la brten pa gsum pas ni bdag tu smra ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te kha cig ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin par smra'o //
analyzed: lta ba la brten pa gsum pas ni bdag tu smra ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te kha cig ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin par smra'o //
translated: The third, based on the view, is twofold: some say that the self is material, others that it is not material.

original: kha cig ni gzugs can yang ma yin gzugs can ma yin pa yang ma yin par smra'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs can yang ma yin gzugs can ma yin pa yang ma yin par smra'o //
translated: Some say that the self is neither material nor not material.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: gzugs can de nyid kyang chung ngu 'am tshad med par rtog go //üîΩgzugs can ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs can de nyid kyang chung ngu 'am tshad med par rtog go // gzugs can ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those who say that the self is material imagine it to be either small or infinite.üîΩThose who say that the self is not material imagine it to be either small or infinite.

original: lta ba gsum la brten pas bdag tu smra ba gnyis su gyur pa gang yin pa'i smra ba de gnyis las kyang kha cig ni chung ngur rtog go //üîΩkha cig ni tshad med par rtog go //
analyzed: lta ba gsum la brten pas bdag tu smra ba gnyis su gyur pa gang yin pa'i smra ba de gnyis las kyang kha cig ni chung ngur rtog go //üîΩkha cig ni tshad med par rtog go //
translated: The two theories of the self, based on the three views, are also twofold: some imagine the self to be small, others to be infinite.

original: de ltar na bdag tu smra ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag las bdag mtha' dang ldan pa dang / mtha' dang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin la mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba dang /üîΩgo rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu smra ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag las bdag mtha' dang ldan pa dang / mtha' dang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin la mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: 1. finite, 2. infinite, 3. both finite and infinite, and 4. neither finite nor infinite.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.üîΩThe self is pure and liberated by relying on the theory of self and by relying on that view.

original: lta ba la brten pa de nyid kyis bdag tu smra ba la brten nas bdag dag cing 'grol bar gyur la 'dod pa dang bsam gtan la dbang thob ste /
analyzed: lta ba la brten pa de nyid kyis bdag tu smra ba la brten nas bdag dag cing 'grol bar gyur la 'dod pa dang bsam gtan la dbang thob ste /
translated: One obtains mastery over the desire realm and the meditative concentrations.üîΩOne is purified by the method of play in this life, as one emanates whatever one wishes and abides in that.üîΩOne abides in the meditative concentrations as one wishes.

original: rnam par dag pa ni tshe 'di la rnam par rtse ba'i tshul gyis ci 'dod par sprul nas de la shas cher gnas pa dang / ci 'dod par bsam gtan la gnas te de ltar na lta ba la brten pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni tshe 'di la rnam par rtse ba'i tshul gyis ci 'dod par sprul nas de la shas cher gnas pa dang / ci 'dod par bsam gtan la gnas te de ltar na lta ba la brten pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the self is established by means of the view.

original: de la skye ba'i gnas kyi sgo nas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i gnas kyi sgo nas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for the mode of birth, it is as follows:

original: bdag ni 'du shes gcig dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag ni 'du shes gcig dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: I am one who has a single perception, and so on.

original: de la 'du shes gcig dang ldan pa ni gzugs med pa dag gi nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched gnyis so //
analyzed: de la 'du shes gcig dang ldan pa ni gzugs med pa dag gi nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched gnyis so //
translated: One who has a single perception is one who is born in the two formless realms of infinite space and infinite consciousness.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs dang ldan pa ni de man chad de /
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs dang ldan pa ni de man chad de /
translated: One who has various perceptions is one who is born in the realms below that.

original: ji skad bstan pa de dag las go rims bzhin du chung ngu'i 'du shes can dang ; tshad med pa'i 'du shes can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa de dag las go rims bzhin du chung ngu'i 'du shes can dang ; tshad med pa'i 'du shes can du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they have the perception of what is small and the perception of what is immeasurable, respectively, as was taught.

original: bsam gtan gsum po rnams na ni gcig tu nges par bde ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum po rnams na ni gcig tu nges par bde ba dang ldan no //
translated: In the three meditative concentrations, they definitely have pleasure.

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams na ni gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams na ni gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal ba dang ldan no //
translated: In the hells, they definitely have suffering.

original: dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / mi rnams dang / @158b 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams na ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / mi rnams dang / @158b 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams na ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang ldan no //
translated: Animals, hungry ghosts, humans, and the gods of the desire realm possess pleasure and pain.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched man chad na ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan no /üîΩ// / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba ;
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched man chad na ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan no / // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba ;
translated: Those from the fourth concentration to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception possess neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bam po bzhi pa /üîΩgsum po 'di dag ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can gyi gnas rnams kyi thams cad du rgud pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa / gsum po 'di dag ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can gyi gnas rnams kyi thams cad du rgud pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The third chapter on the summary of the basis from the Levels of Yogic Deeds

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The three of these are to be known as the complete degeneration of the abodes of the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas:

original: lta ba dang 'dod pa tha dad pa dang mi mthun par smra ba'i rgud pa dang / bdag shes par brjod pa'i sgo nas 'dri ba la lan 'debs pa'i rgud pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i rgud pa'o //üîΩde la 'du shes can dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can yang ma yin 'du shes can ma yin pa yang ma yin par smra ba gsum dang / chad par smra ba rnams kyis glag btsal ba dang / phan yon brjod pa dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang 'dod pa tha dad pa dang mi mthun par smra ba'i rgud pa dang / bdag shes par brjod pa'i sgo nas 'dri ba la lan 'debs pa'i rgud pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i rgud pa'o // de la 'du shes can dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can yang ma yin 'du shes can ma yin pa yang ma yin par smra ba gsum dang / chad par smra ba rnams kyis glag btsal ba dang / phan yon brjod pa dang /
translated: the degeneration of the view and the desire to speak in a way that is different and not in accord with the scriptures; the degeneration of the reply to the questioner who asks about the self that is expressed in terms of knowledge; and the degeneration of the realization that is attained through the practice of the Dharma that accords with the Dharma.üîΩThe first degeneration should be understood through the three who speak of the existence of the self, the nonexistence of the self, and the self that is neither existent nor nonexistent, and through the annihilationists who seek an opportunity, who speak of benefits,

original: gal 'dzin pa las rgyal ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i sgo nas ni rgud pa dang por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gal 'dzin pa las rgyal ba'i phan yon brjod pa'i sgo nas ni rgud pa dang por rig par bya ste /
translated: and who speak of the benefits of conquering the self.

original: 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa yin te /
translated: These are speculations about the future limit.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten nas bdag nyid yod pa dang med par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten nas bdag nyid yod pa dang med par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they speculate about the self as existent or nonexistent in the future.

original: de la gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gang du kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa rnams ni dang por mi shes pa khas len pa'i
analyzed: de la gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gang du kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa rnams ni dang por mi shes pa khas len pa'i
translated: That which is defiled, that in which it is defiled, and that by which it is defiled, all of these are not known as they are in reality by means of the two truths, the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: phyir de las gzhan pa'i mi shes pa las mi shes pa'i lhag ma lus pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir de las gzhan pa'i mi shes pa las mi shes pa'i lhag ma lus pa yin no //
translated: The remainder of ignorance is the other ignorance that remains, because it is accepted as the first ignorance.

original: gang khas len zhe na /
analyzed: gang khas len zhe na /
translated: What is accepted?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rnam pa gsum lan bzhir bsgyur ba rnams te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum lan bzhir bsgyur ba rnams te /
translated: The four permutations of the three aspects

original: rtag pa dang rtag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams dang / mtha' dang ldan pa dang mtha' dang ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa dang / rang gis byes pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang rtag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams dang / mtha' dang ldan pa dang mtha' dang ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa dang / rang gis byes pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: are permanence and impermanence, etc., finitude and infinitude, etc., and self-creation and other-creation, etc.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni mi shes pa'i phyir thog mar 'di dag de ltar khas blangs nas de'i 'og tu 'dri ba'i lan 'debs par byed de 'di dag @159a * //üîΩni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni mi shes pa'i phyir thog mar 'di dag de ltar khas blangs nas de'i 'og tu 'dri ba'i lan 'debs par byed de 'di dag @159a * // ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'di lta ste /
translated: Since they do not know this, they first accept the four alternatives and then respond to the question.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul lam don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul gnyi ga ltar yang lan gdab tu mid pa'i phyir shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi lan mi gdab pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul lam don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul gnyi ga ltar yang lan gdab tu mid pa'i phyir shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi lan mi gdab pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: These are the bases for the wise not to respond, because they cannot respond in either way, that is, either by the method of conventional truth or by the method of ultimate truth, in the noble Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de la gcig tu nges par rtag par smra ba bzhi ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa yin no //üîΩsngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa gang yin pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: de la gcig tu nges par rtag par smra ba bzhi ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa yin no // sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa gang yin pa de nyid ni /
translated: Among these, the four who definitely assert permanence are speculators about the past.üîΩThose who speculate about the past are also speculators about the future, because they speculate about the future in two ways.

original: rgyu med par smra ba rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas rgyu med par smra ba yin te sngar ni bdag med par rtog la phyis ni yod par rtog ste /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas rgyu med par smra ba yin te sngar ni bdag med par rtog la phyis ni yod par rtog ste /
translated: Those who speculate about the future in two ways are also speculators about causelessness, because they speculate about causelessness in two ways.üîΩThose who speculate about causelessness in two ways are also speculators about non-existence, because they speculate about non-existence in two ways.üîΩThose who speculate about non-existence in two ways are also speculators about annihilation, because they speculate about annihilation in two ways.

original: gcig tu nges par mi rtag par smra ba la dmigs so //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par mi rtag par smra ba la dmigs so //
translated: Those who speculate about annihilation in two ways are also speculators about the one-sided assertion of impermanence.

original: de la bzhi po 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa nyid las kha cig ni rtag par lta ste /üîΩde dag gi bye brag las kha cig ni rtag pa dang rtag pa ma yin par smra ba la dmigs so //
analyzed: de la bzhi po 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa nyid las kha cig ni rtag par lta ste / de dag gi bye brag las kha cig ni rtag pa dang rtag pa ma yin par smra ba la dmigs so //
translated: Some maintain that the world is eternal,üîΩand some maintain that the world is not eternal.

original: kha cig ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin par smra ba la dmigs so //üîΩmtha' dang ldan pa dang mtha' dang mi ldan pa bsgyur ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin par smra ba la dmigs so // mtha' dang ldan pa dang mtha' dang mi ldan pa bsgyur ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some maintain that the world is both eternal and not eternal, and some maintain that the world is neither eternal nor not eternal.

original: mtha' dang ldan pa dang mtha' dang mi ldan pa'i skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩthams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang gis byas par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dang ldan pa dang mtha' dang mi ldan pa'i skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin no // thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang gis byas par smra ba yin no //
translated: The theories of the world having an end and not having an end are to be understood as explained above in the context of the world being finite and infinite.üîΩThose who maintain that everything arises from a previous cause are proponents of self-causation.

original: thams cad dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gzhan gyis byas par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gzhan gyis byas par smra ba yin no //
translated: Those who maintain that everything arises from a cause that is a creator God are proponents of other-causation.

original: shas kyis ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa yin par 'dod la shas kyis ni mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gnyi gar smra ba yin no //
analyzed: shas kyis ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa yin par 'dod la shas kyis ni mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gnyi gar smra ba yin no //
translated: Those who assert that the world is created by ƒ™≈õvara are called ‚Äútheists.‚Äù

original: rgyu med par smra ba gang yin pa de dag ni gnyi gar smra ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba gang yin pa de dag ni gnyi gar smra ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Those who assert that the world is created without a cause are called ‚Äúnihilists.‚Äù

original: de ni de dag gi bdag shes par smra ba'i sgo nas rgud pa gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi bdag shes par smra ba'i sgo nas rgud pa gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the second misfortune of those who propound the self, in terms of their assertions about knowledge.

original: 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa yin te 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi sgo nas rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa yin te 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi sgo nas rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are speculations about the prior limit, because they speculate in terms of the past and present.

original: de la dge sbyong dang bram ze gang glags tshol ba dang / phan yon la lta ba dang / gal 'dzin pa las rgyal ba'i phan yon la lta ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir bdag shes par brjod pa bsgrags par 'dod pa kho na yin pas nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba de dag ni nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de la dge sbyong dang bram ze gang glags tshol ba dang / phan yon la lta ba dang / gal 'dzin pa las rgyal ba'i phan yon la lta ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir bdag shes par brjod pa bsgrags par 'dod pa kho na yin pas nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba de dag ni nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: Those who are called ‚Äúvirtuous ascetics and brahmins‚Äù are those who are not motivated by the desire for gain and honor, but who are motivated by the desire for liberation and the desire for the benefit of others.

original: thar pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: thar pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pa yin te /
translated: They are not motivated by the desire for their own liberation alone.

original: @159b de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba'i rang bzhin can blun zhing zhi bar spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: @159b de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba'i rang bzhin can blun zhing zhi bar spyod pa yin no //
translated: They are by nature of little defilement, and they are foolish and peaceful in their conduct.

original: de dag ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i man ngag ston pa dang / rjes su ston pa la brten nas phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i lta bar gyur pa de dag khas mi len zhing yang dag par 'das nas tshe 'di la yang 'dod pa'i kun tu sbyor ba las yang dag par 'das te rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba la reg par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i man ngag ston pa dang / rjes su ston pa la brten nas phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i lta bar gyur pa de dag khas mi len zhing yang dag par 'das nas tshe 'di la yang 'dod pa'i kun tu sbyor ba las yang dag par 'das te rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba la reg par 'gyur la /
translated: They do not accept the views of those who possess the future and those who possess the past, which are based on the instructions and teachings of those who enter meditative attainment in the first absorption. Having completely transcended, they also completely transcend the fetters of the desire realm in this very life and reach the joy of seclusion.

original: de'i gang ma'i ni ma thos shing mi shes te /
analyzed: de'i gang ma'i ni ma thos shing mi shes te /
translated: They do not hear or know about the higher realms.

original: de ni de nyid la mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni de nyid la mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin to //
translated: They take that very state to be nirvana.

original: rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba la ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i zang zing med pa'i dga' ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / de yan chad ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la thug pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba la ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i zang zing med pa'i dga' ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / de yan chad ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la thug pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as there is joy in perfect seclusion, so too there is joy free of materiality in the second and third absorptions, there is the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain in the fourth absorption, and so on up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they transcend the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, which is associated with the various types of perception.

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam las ma log pa phyir ldog pa'i chos can yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa mya ngan las 'das so snyam pa'i nga rgyal can de dag gi rgud pa gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam las ma log pa phyir ldog pa'i chos can yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa mya ngan las 'das so snyam pa'i nga rgyal can de dag gi rgud pa gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o
translated: This should be understood as the third misfortune of those who have not transcended sorrow, who have not attained nirvana, who are subject to regression, and who have not turned away from the path that leads to all the appropriated aggregates.

original: // de la de bzhin gshegs pas ni zhi ba'i go 'phang mchog nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rnam pa thams cad rgud pa gsum po de dag rnam pa lngas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to
analyzed: // de la de bzhin gshegs pas ni zhi ba'i go 'phang mchog nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rnam pa thams cad rgud pa gsum po de dag rnam pa lngas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to
translated: The TathƒÅgata, having fully awakened to the supreme state of peace, knows perfectly and completely, through five aspects, those three kinds of degeneration in all their modes.

original: // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: // 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / lta ba gang yin pa dang / mi shes pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gang la dmigs te 'jug pa dang / dmigs pa de'i nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas rags pa dang gang du nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / lta ba gang yin pa dang / mi shes pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gang la dmigs te 'jug pa dang / dmigs pa de'i nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas rags pa dang gang du nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: the nature of degeneration, the view of degeneration, the ignorance through which degeneration occurs, the object of reference in which one engages, and the coarseness of that object of reference in terms of its disadvantages, and the definite emergence from that degeneration.

original: de de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang rab tu mkhyen la nges par 'byung ba der yang bdag nyid gtan du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang rab tu mkhyen la nges par 'byung ba der yang bdag nyid gtan du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He knows them perfectly and completely in that way, and he himself definitely emerges from them forever.

original: shes pa gnyis ni mthong ba dag pa dang / mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis ni mthong ba dag pa dang / mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Two kinds of knowledge are the pure vision and the completely pure vision.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: chos kyi lugs shes pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i mya ngan las 'das @160a * //
analyzed: chos kyi lugs shes pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i mya ngan las 'das @160a * //
translated: Knowing the Dharma system and being preceded by that, one should be skilled in the means of attaining nirvana.üîΩ

original: pa'i shes pa'o //üîΩde la chos kyi lugs shes pa ni gang gis 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas shes la /
analyzed: pa'i shes pa'o // de la chos kyi lugs shes pa ni gang gis 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas shes la /
translated: The knowledge of the system of the Dharma and the knowledge of nirvana that precedes it.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas shes pa ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas shes pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge of the system of the Dharma is the knowledge of the specific characteristics of the formations by way of their differentiation and the knowledge of their general characteristic by way of their fault.

original: gnas skabs gsum du gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang mthun pa rnams kyis yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum du gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang mthun pa rnams kyis yin te /
translated: Thus, it is the knowledge of the pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant formations that are included in the three times,

original: sdug bsngal gsum po'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum po'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because of the three kinds of suffering.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa'i shes pa ni de de ltar 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa'i shes pa ni de de ltar 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal bar 'du shes pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The knowledge of nirvana is the knowledge that is preceded by the knowledge of the system of the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba'i 'du byed 'di dag ma lus par spong ba ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba'i 'du byed 'di dag ma lus par spong ba ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: Thus, the complete abandonment of all these compounded things which are suffering, etc.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of nirvana.

original: mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa de gnyis kyang sgo gnyis nas sbyor bas rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa de gnyis kyang sgo gnyis nas sbyor bas rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: These two kinds of pure vision, the pure and the very pure, are purified by the application of two doors.

original: gang zag bdag nyid la mthu med de gzhan gyi tshig la brten pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag bdag nyid la mthu med de gzhan gyi tshig la brten pa'am /
translated: The person who is powerless, who relies on the words of another,

original: mthu yod pa bdag nyid kyis mang du thos pa yongs su btsal nas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthu yod pa bdag nyid kyis mang du thos pa yongs su btsal nas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the person who is powerful, who seeks much learning for himself, are purified.

original: de la gang zag snga ma ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mi gsal ba dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ro gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir tshad nges pa'i chos la spyod pa'i bzod pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang zag snga ma ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mi gsal ba dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ro gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir tshad nges pa'i chos la spyod pa'i bzod pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The former person, whose faculties of faith, etc. are not clear, and who has not yet attained the one-flavored meditative object of serenity and transcendent insight, enters the acceptance of the doctrine of the definite emergence from the cycle of existence.

original: de las bzlog pa ni cig shos kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni cig shos kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the other.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa yin te /
translated: These three are the knowledge that arises from the end of clear realization.

original: 'di dag gis mthong ba rnam par dag pa rab tu phye ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis mthong ba rnam par dag pa rab tu phye ste /
translated: By these, the purity of seeing is distinguished.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rgyun las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rgyun las byung ba'o //
translated: the knowledge that is in accord with the arising of the uncontaminated, the uncontaminated itself, and that which arises from the continuum of the uncontaminated.

original: de la dang po ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'o //
translated: Among these, the first is included in the supreme worldly dharmas.

original: gnyis pa ni gang la gnas pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang la gnas pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'o //
translated: The second is that which, abiding in it, one abandons the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing.

original: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i steng du rnam par grol ba'i rgyun las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i steng du rnam par grol ba'i rgyun las byung ba'o //
translated: The third is that which, in addition to abandoning the afflictions, arises from the continuum of liberation.

original: de la shes pa bar ma la gnas pa'i tshe ni yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa @160b yin te /
analyzed: de la shes pa bar ma la gnas pa'i tshe ni yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa @160b yin te /
translated: At the time of abiding in the middle knowledge, one enters the faultless correct path.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa las ni 'das /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa las ni 'das /
translated: One has passed beyond the stage of ordinary beings.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni ma thob pa'o //
translated: The result of stream-entry is not attained.

original: gsum pa ste rnam par grol ba'i rgyun la gnas pa'i shes pa ma thob pa'i bar du ni des de ma thob kyi bar du de'i skad cig la gnas pa ni 'chi bar gyur pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ste rnam par grol ba'i rgyun la gnas pa'i shes pa ma thob pa'i bar du ni des de ma thob kyi bar du de'i skad cig la gnas pa ni 'chi bar gyur pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Until the third, the knowledge of the stream of liberation is attained, he does not attain it. Abiding in that moment, he does not die,

original: yun thung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun thung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is short.

original: de'i rjes la ni gdon mi za bar gsum pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni gdon mi za bar gsum pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, he certainly attains the third.

original: de la gnas pa'i mthong ba ni rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i mthong ba ni rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The seeing of one abiding in that is pure,

original: shes bya mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes the knowable directly apparent.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not extremely pure,

original: nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the remainder of the afflictions exists.

original: de nyid lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dgra bcom pa shin tu rnam par dag pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dgra bcom pa shin tu rnam par dag pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the cause of repeatedly doing that, he becomes an arhat, extremely pure, free from all afflictions.

original: de la ma lus par spong ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ma lus par spong ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: In that, complete abandonment should be known as threefold:

original: kun du mi spyod pa dang / khams dang / dngos po'o //
analyzed: kun du mi spyod pa dang / khams dang / dngos po'o //
translated: Non-performance, realm, and object.

original: de la byung ngo cog dang du mi len zhing shin tu spangs nas kyang dge ba la goms pas thag ring bar byed do //
analyzed: de la byung ngo cog dang du mi len zhing shin tu spangs nas kyang dge ba la goms pas thag ring bar byed do //
translated: Therein, one makes it distant by not tolerating the occurrence of any of the defilements, by thoroughly abandoning them, and by cultivating the wholesome.

original: kun nas dkris pa kun du mi spyod pa'i phyir dang // mas ni snga ma bzhin du gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa kun du mi spyod pa'i phyir dang // mas ni snga ma bzhin du gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: The realm should be understood as threefold, as above, because of the non-performance of the envelopers.

original: dngos po ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po ni gnyis te /
translated: The object is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dngos po'o //
translated: the object of the defilements and the object of suffering.

original: bde ba dang / phan pa dang 'brel pa'i bral ba'i phyogs kyi khams lnga'i ni zhi ba dang / gya nom pa la sogs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / phan pa dang 'brel pa'i bral ba'i phyogs kyi khams lnga'i ni zhi ba dang / gya nom pa la sogs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five realms of the aspect of separation that are related to happiness and benefit should be understood as beginning with peace, culminating in nirvana.

original: phung po thams cad spangs pa ni 'dir pha ma la sogs pa las byung ba'i phung po 'dor ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: phung po thams cad spangs pa ni 'dir pha ma la sogs pa las byung ba'i phung po 'dor ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o ;
translated: The abandonment of all the aggregates here should be understood as the relinquishing of the aggregates that arise from the mother, father, etc.

original: / bar mdo'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa dang / de phyin chad kyi srid pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir gzhan dag gi go rims bzhin du nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa dang / nye bar len pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / bar mdo'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa dang / de phyin chad kyi srid pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir gzhan dag gi go rims bzhin du nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa dang / nye bar len pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: because the intermediate state, birth, and subsequent states of existence are not actualized.üîΩThe three fetters should be understood as being established in three ways:

original: de la phyogs gsum du sgo gsum gyis bgegs byed pa'i phyir ni kun du sbyor ba gsum du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la phyogs gsum du sgo gsum gyis bgegs byed pa'i phyir ni kun du sbyor ba gsum du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: because they obstruct the three directions,üîΩbecause they obstruct the three doors,

original: mi g-yo ba dang / g-yos su zin kyang log par 'dzin pa dang / chos rnams ni rtogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / g-yos su zin kyang log par 'dzin pa dang / chos rnams ni rtogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: and because they obstruct the three realizations.üîΩThe three directions are:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / nyes @161a * //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / nyes @161a * //
translated: the direction of the householders,

original: pa bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'i phyogs rnams dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: pa bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'i phyogs rnams dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: the direction of those who have gone forth in the discipline of the well-taught Dharma-Vinaya,üîΩand the direction of those who have gone forth in the discipline of the poorly-taught Dharma-Vinaya.

original: rgyun las bzlog pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba'i lam la ni zhugs so //
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba'i lam la ni zhugs so //
translated: He has entered the path that goes in the opposite direction to the stream.

original: ngan song las rnam par thar pa gcig dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: ngan song las rnam par thar pa gcig dang yang ldan no //
translated: He is also endowed with one liberation from the unfortunate realms.

original: rnam par thar pa'i nges pa gnyis dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i nges pa gnyis dang yang ldan te /
translated: He is also endowed with two certainties of liberation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam par thar pa'i nges pa dang / yang srid par skye ba las rnam par thar pa'i nges pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam par thar pa'i nges pa dang / yang srid par skye ba las rnam par thar pa'i nges pa ste /
translated: the certainty of liberation from the afflictions and the certainty of liberation from rebirth.

original: de bas na rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, he is called a stream-enterer.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob pa'i snga rol slob pa'i sa la ni 'du byed thams cad la bdag gam bdag gir nye bar len pa med de de'i 'og tu zag pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob pa'i snga rol slob pa'i sa la ni 'du byed thams cad la bdag gam bdag gir nye bar len pa med de de'i 'og tu zag pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Prior to attaining the state of an arhat, on the stage of training, he does not grasp any conditioned thing as ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and subsequently he becomes liberated from the contaminants.

original: de la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni don dang 'bral ba rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni don dang 'bral ba rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the state of an arhat should be understood as having four aspects that are free of error.

original: rang gi don mthar phyin pas gzhan gyi don bya bar 'os pa'i don dang / bdag nyid rdzogs pa dang / rigs pa'i don thob par bya ba'i don dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu yang dag par bcom ste tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i don dang /
analyzed: rang gi don mthar phyin pas gzhan gyi don bya bar 'os pa'i don dang / bdag nyid rdzogs pa dang / rigs pa'i don thob par bya ba'i don dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu yang dag par bcom ste tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i don dang /
translated: The meaning of the five is the meaning of what is suitable to be done for the benefit of others once one's own purpose is complete, the meaning of attaining the state of perfection, the meaning of attaining the state of reasoning, the meaning of abiding in happiness in this life by thoroughly destroying the causes of future compositional activity,

original: slob pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das nas mi slob pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i don to //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das nas mi slob pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i don to //
translated: and the meaning of passing beyond the level of training and entering the level of no more learning.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byis pa rnams kyi byis pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byis pa rnams kyi byis pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: These five are the childish states of the childish.

original: de dag la byis pa gnas na byis pa'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la byis pa gnas na byis pa'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the childish abide in those, they will be counted as childish.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:üîΩnot attaining the connate wisdom from the beginning, not attaining the wisdom that arises from the cause of the words of another, not attaining the wisdom of the ƒÅryas, abiding in being bound by the fetters of delusion,

original: dang po nas lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ma thob pa dang / gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba'i shes rab ma thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab ma thob pa dang / rmongs pa'i kun nas dkris nas kun nas dkris shing 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: dang po nas lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ma thob pa dang / gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba'i shes rab ma thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab ma thob pa dang / rmongs pa'i kun nas dkris nas kun nas dkris shing 'dug pa dang /
translated: and

original: de'i bag la nyal dang yang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bag la nyal dang yang 'brel pa'o //
translated: and also in relation to the latent impressions of that view.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni bdag tu smra ba yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni bdag tu smra ba yin te /
translated: These four are the proponents of a self.

original: 'du byed rnams ni bdag yin no //üîΩbdag ni 'du byed rnams dang ldan no //üîΩ'du byed rnams ni bdag gi'o ;
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni bdag yin no // bdag ni 'du byed rnams dang ldan no // 'du byed rnams ni bdag gi'o ;
translated: They say: ‚ÄúThe aggregates are the self.üîΩThe self possesses the aggregates.üîΩThe aggregates are mine.

original: / bdag ni 'du byed rnams la yod do zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: / bdag ni 'du byed rnams la yod do zhes smra ba'o //
translated: The self exists in the aggregates.

original: bdag tu smra ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The proponents of a self are defiled by two kinds of causes:

original: mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal gyi sgo nas so //
translated: by the cause of adherence and by the cause of latent impressions.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, by the cause of adherence is meant, for example,

original: 'di las phyi rol pa thar pa 'dod @161b pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa thar pa 'dod @161b pa rnams te /
translated: those who are outside this doctrine and who desire liberation,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi thob pa dang 'brel pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi thob pa dang 'brel pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because they are connected with the possession of all the defilements.

original: de la bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: By the cause of latent impressions is meant, for example,

original: chos 'di pa rnams te yul la yongs su zhen pas thang cig tsam du bar chad byed la gtan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams te yul la yongs su zhen pas thang cig tsam du bar chad byed la gtan du ni ma yin no //
translated: those who are within this doctrine, because they are temporarily obstructed from the object by their adherence to the object, but not permanently.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang bdag med par lta ba gnyis ni 'dra bar 'du byed kyi gzhi la dmigs pas na mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang bdag med par lta ba gnyis ni 'dra bar 'du byed kyi gzhi la dmigs pas na mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The view of self and the view of selflessness should be understood as similar, because they are both focused on the same basis, i.e., the aggregates.

original: gzhi de nyid la log pa dang yang dag par 'dzin pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar gyur pas na ni mi mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi de nyid la log pa dang yang dag par 'dzin pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar gyur pas na ni mi mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: But they are not similar, because the former is a cause of affliction and the latter is a cause of purification, due to their respective graspings of the self as existent and nonexistent.

original: de la rnam pa bzhis dngos po la log pa zhen pa'i phyir ni bdag tu lta ba kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhis dngos po la log pa zhen pa'i phyir ni bdag tu lta ba kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: The view of self is a cause of affliction because it is a mistaken adherence to the reality of things in four ways:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.üîΩüîΩ

original: rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: as cause, 2. as intrinsic nature, 3. as effect, and 4. as natural outcome.

original: de la rgyu ni rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis las 'gyur te /
translated: The cause of the view of self is twofold ignorance:

original: dngos po la rmongs pa dang / lta ba la rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la rmongs pa dang / lta ba la rmongs pa'o //
translated: ignorance of things and ignorance of views.

original: de la dam pa'i chos ma yin pa'i thos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dngos po la rmongs pas na bdag tu lta ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dam pa'i chos ma yin pa'i thos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dngos po la rmongs pas na bdag tu lta ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of self arises from the ignorance of things that is preceded by the hearing of non-Dharma.

original: lta ba de la rmongs pas lta ba de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba byung ngo cog la bdag go snyam du 'dzin to //
analyzed: lta ba de la rmongs pas lta ba de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba byung ngo cog la bdag go snyam du 'dzin to //
translated: Because of delusion about that view, he grasps as self whatever feeling arises from the contact of that ignorance which is associated with the view.

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang de'i lus sred pa dang 'brel par 'gyur te des na bdag tu lta ba spong mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang de'i lus sred pa dang 'brel par 'gyur te des na bdag tu lta ba spong mi nus so //
translated: And because of that condition, his craving for the body is connected with that view, and so he is unable to abandon the view of self.

original: de la rang bzhin ni de gzhi gnyis yongs su bzung ba'i lta ba de bag la nyal gyi sgo nas 'bral par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni de gzhi gnyis yongs su bzung ba'i lta ba de bag la nyal gyi sgo nas 'bral par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The nature of that view is that it is not separated from the two bases which are its objects, and it is not separated from its latent impressions.

original: de la 'bras bu ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid la brten nas de bag la nyal gyi sgo nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba yin te /

original: de yang bag la nyal rnam pa gnyi ga'i sgo nas phyi ma la dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bag la nyal rnam pa gnyi ga'i sgo nas phyi ma la dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is the cause of the future manifestation of the faculties, because of the latent impressions of both.

original: de rnams kyis kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of that, he experiences pleasure and pain.

original: de dag nyid la bdag dang bdag gir bzung ba la brten nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par rtog pas bdag dang bdag gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sa bon rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i yid kyi dmigs pa ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The mind that is the cause of rebirth in existence is the mind element, even though it possesses the seed of view through the power of previous causes.üîΩThe mind that is the cause

original: de sngon nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la brten pas rnam par btags pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pas da ltar khams yang dag par grub ste /
analyzed: de sngon nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la brten pas rnam par btags pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pas da ltar khams yang dag par grub ste /
translated: The view of the transitory collection that is imputed in the present is established in the elements because it is based on the view of the transitory collection that was wrongly explained in the past.

analyzed: des na de'i da ltar khams de'i dbang gis byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig chogs la lta ba ste /

analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang kun tu spyod pa'i sgo nas bgegs byed par 'gyur /

analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis rnam pa drug tu bskor ba dang bcas pas kun tu spyod de dus dang nga rgyal lo //

analyzed: de la dus ni ci bdag sngon gyi dus na byung ngam / 'on te ma byung zhig gu zhes bya ba nas rgyas par ci rigs par rig par bya'o ;

original: / de la nga rgyal ni bdag che'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: / de la nga rgyal ni bdag che'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: Pride is the thought, ‚ÄúI am great‚Äù and so on.

original: des de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes shing mi mthong ste /
analyzed: des de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes shing mi mthong ste /

original: de nyid kyis na tshul bzhin ma yin pa log par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na tshul bzhin ma yin pa log par mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, he sees incorrectly, not in accordance with fact.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni rig pa'i gnas skabs kyin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni rig pa'i gnas skabs kyin te /
translated: There are three states of knowledge:

original: gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i ni rig pa'i gnas skabs dang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i ni rig pa'i gnas skabs dang po'o //
translated: The first state of knowledge is that of one who attends properly to the teachings of others.

original: yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa'i ni rig pa'i gnas skabs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa'i ni rig pa'i gnas skabs gnyis pa'o //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol ba'i ni rig pa'i gnas skabs gsum pa'o //

original: ma rig pa'i gnas skabs ni gnyis te snga ma dang phyi ma'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnas skabs ni gnyis te snga ma dang phyi ma'o //
translated: There are two states of nescience: prior and subsequent.

original: de la snga ma ni bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: The prior state is the state of latent impressions.

original: kun nas dkris pa'i gnas skabs ni phyi ma'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i gnas skabs ni phyi ma'o //
translated: The subsequent state is the state of the entanglements.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bye brag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bye brag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: Another classification is in terms of the distinction between the objects to be eliminated by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis nyid kyi bstan pa legs par gsungs pa'i sgo nas ni 'byor bar 'gyur bar bzhed la /
analyzed: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis nyid kyi bstan pa legs par gsungs pa'i sgo nas ni 'byor bar 'gyur bar bzhed la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is pleased with the correct collection of the Dharma that is well-spoken by himself.üîΩHe is pleased with the correct collection of the Dharma that is badly spoken by others.

original: pha rol gyi bstan pa nyes par bshad pa'i sgo nas ni mi rigs pas ma rung bar 'gyur bar brda sprad par bzhed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de la yang dag par sdud pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis ched du brjod pa @162b ched du brjod do zhes
analyzed: pha rol gyi bstan pa nyes par bshad pa'i sgo nas ni mi rigs pas ma rung bar 'gyur bar brda sprad par bzhed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de la yang dag par sdud pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis ched du brjod pa @162b ched du brjod do zhes
translated: The BhagavƒÅn spoke this Dharma discourse for the sake of the correct collection of the Dharma.

original: brjod do // legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'bras bu che zhing phan yon che ba yin no //
analyzed: brjod do // legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'bras bu che zhing phan yon che ba yin no //
translated: The well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya has two causes and has great results and great benefits.

original: nyes par bshad pa ni gti mug pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa ni gti mug pa yin te /
translated: The badly spoken Dharma and Vinaya is foolish.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung ba yang yod de /
translated: In the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, there is the escape from all suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sdug bsngal gsum po rnams las so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum po rnams las so //
translated: From the three kinds of suffering.

original: kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spong ba yang yod do //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spong ba yang yod do //
translated: There is also the complete abandonment of all fetters.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is:

original: tha ma dang gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams las so //
analyzed: tha ma dang gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams las so //
translated: from the factors that are conducive to the lower and higher realms.üîΩIn the case of the bad explanations, neither of these two is present.

original: nyes par bshad pa la ni gnyi ga yang med de de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas spong ba'i 'dun pa la gnas pas 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal las sems skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa la ni gnyi ga yang med de de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas spong ba'i 'dun pa la gnas pas 'du byed rnams la sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal las sems skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are established in the aspiration for abandonment on the basis of the view of the transitory collection become disenchanted with the suffering of conditioned states and with suffering itself.

original: de ltar mos par byed pa na bdag sdug bsngal dang ldan par ma gyur cig bdag la sdug bsngal 'ong bar ma gyur cig snyam mo //
analyzed: de ltar mos par byed pa na bdag sdug bsngal dang ldan par ma gyur cig bdag la sdug bsngal 'ong bar ma gyur cig snyam mo //
translated: When they are convinced of this, they think, ‚ÄúMay I not come to possess suffering! May suffering not come to me!‚Äù

original: yang na sdug bsngal de rgyu'i sgo nas spangs pas phyi ma la 'bras bu 'ong bar 'gyur ba la rnam pa gnyis kyis mos par byed de /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal de rgyu'i sgo nas spangs pas phyi ma la 'bras bu 'ong bar 'gyur ba la rnam pa gnyis kyis mos par byed de /
translated: Or else, they are convinced of this in two ways, by abandoning suffering through its cause, so that its result will not come in the future.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩbdag sdug bsngal dang ldan par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag sdug bsngal dang ldan par mi 'gyur /
translated: This is how it is:üîΩ‚ÄúMay I not come to possess suffering!

original: bdag la sdug bsngal 'ong bar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sdug bsngal 'ong bar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: May suffering not come to me!‚Äù

original: de dag de ltar spong ba'i 'dun pa la brten pa rnam pa bzhis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa nas rim gyis 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du skyes pas sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba las yang dag par 'das su zin kyang tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor
analyzed: de dag de ltar spong ba'i 'dun pa la brten pa rnam pa bzhis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa nas rim gyis 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du skyes pas sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba las yang dag par 'das su zin kyang tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor
translated: They are free from attachment to the desire realm through the four aspects of the intention to abandon those afflictions. They are born in the first absorption and so on up to the absorption of neither discernment nor nondiscernment. Thus they completely transcend the suffering of the suffering of the lower realms.

original: ba rnams ni spong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba rnams ni spong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: However, they do not abandon the fetters that are compatible with the summit of existence.

original: de dag ma spangs pas na de dag sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal las yang dag par ma 'das pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ma spangs pas na de dag sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal las yang dag par ma 'das pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since they do not abandon those, they should be understood as not completely transcending the suffering of the suffering of the lower realms.

original: 'gyur ba dang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal spang ba'i phyir ni de dang 'dun pa yang skyed par mi byed na spang bar ltag la byed de /
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal spang ba'i phyir ni de dang 'dun pa yang skyed par mi byed na spang bar ltag la byed de /
translated: They do not generate the intention to abandon the suffering of change and the suffering of contaminated formations, so how could they abandon them?

original: de ma spangs pa'i rim gyis ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyang ma spangs pa kho nar rig par bya'o //üîΩchos 'di pa rnams ni thog ma nyid du 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral bar yang 'du byed rnams la bdag med par lta @163a * //
analyzed: de ma spangs pa'i rim gyis ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyang ma spangs pa kho nar rig par bya'o // chos 'di pa rnams ni thog ma nyid du 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral bar yang 'du byed rnams la bdag med par lta @163a * //
translated: One should understand that the fetters that are compatible with the higher realms are not abandoned without abandoning the fetters that are not abandoned.

original: ba la brten nas spong ba'i 'dun pa la gnas pas spyir sdug bsngal gsum po rnams las skyo bar byed de /
analyzed: ba la brten nas spong ba'i 'dun pa la gnas pas spyir sdug bsngal gsum po rnams las skyo bar byed de /
translated: Those who are Dharma practitioners, even though they are not free from attachment to the desire realm from the very beginning, are disgusted with the three types of suffering in general by relying on the view that compounded phenomena are selfless and by abiding in the aspiration to abandon them.

original: de ltar mos par byed pa na bdag sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig / bdag la sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum 'ong bar ma gyur cig snyam ste /
analyzed: de ltar mos par byed pa na bdag sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig / bdag la sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum 'ong bar ma gyur cig snyam ste /
translated: When they aspire in this way, they think, ‚ÄúMay I not suffer the three types of suffering! May the three types of suffering not come to me!‚Äù

original: de ltar zhugs pa de thog ma kho nar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa de thog ma kho nar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob nas /
translated: When they engage in this way, they first attain freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba spangs pa na snga ma bzhin du bdag de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba spangs pa na snga ma bzhin du bdag de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When they abandon the suffering of suffering, they think, ‚ÄúMay I not become like that!‚Äù

original: bdag la 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bdag la 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems te /
translated: I will not come to have that suffering.

original: de ni sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba de las gtan du rnam par grol bar 'gyur la tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba las kyang yang dag par 'das so //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba de las gtan du rnam par grol bar 'gyur la tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba las kyang yang dag par 'das so //
translated: He is completely liberated from that suffering of suffering and has transcended the fetters associated with the lower realms.

original: lam de nyid kyang sgom par byed pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam de nyid kyang sgom par byed pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He cultivates that very path and attains the state of an arhat.

original: byis pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pas 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / gong ma'i kun du sbyor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba la bdag med par 'ong ngo snyam du skrag par bya ba ma yin pa la skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pas 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / gong ma'i kun du sbyor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba la bdag med par 'ong ngo snyam du skrag par bya ba ma yin pa la skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: The foolish, on the other hand, are terrified of the selflessness that transcends the suffering of conditioned existence and the suffering of change and that transcends the fetters associated with the higher realms because they rely on the perishable collection view.

original: 'dun pa tsam yang skyed par mi byed na spong bar lta ga la byed /
analyzed: 'dun pa tsam yang skyed par mi byed na spong bar lta ga la byed /
translated: They do not even generate the desire to transcend those sufferings, much less the desire to abandon them.

original: de yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis skrag par mi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis skrag par mi bya ba yin te /
translated: There are two reasons why one should not be terrified of selflessness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the two?

original: sems tsam zhig rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi po rnams la 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar zad pa dang / sems tsam zhig rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi po rnams spong ba'i phyir 'jug pa med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur bar zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tsam zhig rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi po rnams la 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar zad pa dang / sems tsam zhig rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi po rnams spong ba'i phyir 'jug pa med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur bar zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind alone is defiled by the four abodes of consciousness, and the mind alone is undefiled by the four abodes of consciousness.

original: gzhi ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhi ni bzhi ste /
translated: The bases are four:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang // 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang // 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams so //
translated: form, feeling, perception, and volitional formations.

original: nye bar len pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The appropriators are four:

original: 'dod pa blta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa blta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: craving for sense-pleasures, craving for views, craving for morality and vows, and craving for doctrines about the self.

original: dmigs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The objects are two:

original: gang la dmigs pa dang / gang gis dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa dang / gang gis dmigs pa'o //
translated: that which is the object and that which objectifies.

original: rnam par shes pa ni drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni drug ste /
translated: Consciousness is sixfold:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: visual consciousness, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa la gnas pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la gnas pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The abodes of consciousness are two:

original: nyon @163b mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i gnas pa dang / de'i bag la nyal gyi gnas pa'o //üîΩde la nye bar len pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rtog pa sngon du btang bas bdag dang bdag gir dmigs pa la log par 'dzin pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa 'dzin pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rten dang /
analyzed: nyon @163b mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i gnas pa dang / de'i bag la nyal gyi gnas pa'o // de la nye bar len pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rtog pa sngon du btang bas bdag dang bdag gir dmigs pa la log par 'dzin pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa 'dzin pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rten dang /
translated: The first is the state of being entangled in the afflictions, and the second is the state of being entangled in their latent tendencies.

original: rgyu 'di gsum gyis rnam par shes pa de 'jug cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang gsum ste /üîΩtshe 'di la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'dzin pa dang / phyi ma'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu 'di gsum gyis rnam par shes pa de 'jug cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang gsum ste / tshe 'di la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'dzin pa dang / phyi ma'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa ste /
translated: In this regard, consciousness is engaged and defiled by three causes, in terms of the appropriating of the body: (1) the prior condition of incorrect mental activity, (2) the apprehension of the self and that which belongs to the self, and (3) the apprehension of their own characteristics.

original: shi nas bdag 'di dang 'di lta bur mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: shi nas bdag 'di dang 'di lta bur mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Moreover, there are three other causes: (1) the apprehension of the truth of the origination of suffering in this life, (2) the apprehension of the suffering of future lives, thinking, ‚ÄúAfter death, I will not be like this or that,‚Äù and (3) the present suffering that arises from past causes.

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three other causes:

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs 'dzin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la dmigs pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs 'dzin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la dmigs pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: by taking up the state of pleasure, by taking as object the state of suffering, and by taking as object the state of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three more:

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'dzin pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'dzin pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: by taking up the future, by taking as object the past, and by taking as object the present.

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three more:

original: yang srid par skye bar byed pa'i srid pa'i sgo nas yang srid par skye ba 'dzin pa dang / de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas ma 'ongs pa'i yul la dmigs pa dang / dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pas da ltar byung ba'i yul thob pa la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yang srid par skye bar byed pa'i srid pa'i sgo nas yang srid par skye ba 'dzin pa dang / de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas ma 'ongs pa'i yul la dmigs pa dang / dga' ba dang 'dod chags dang ldan pas da ltar byung ba'i yul thob pa la gnas pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: by taking up the future existence through the existence that produces the future existence, by taking as object the future object through the delight in this and that, and by taking as object the present object through the delight in the present object obtained through the possession of delight and passion.

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three more:
