original: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa'i sgo nas brnab sems dang mthun pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa dang / gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa'i sgo nas de'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / 'di ni bden no snyam du mchog tu 'dzin pa dang lus kyi mdud pa gnyis kyi sgo nas de'i dngos po la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa'i sgo nas brnab sems dang mthun pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa dang / gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa'i sgo nas de'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / 'di ni bden no snyam du mchog tu 'dzin pa dang lus kyi mdud pa gnyis kyi sgo nas de'i dngos po la gnas pa'o //
translated: The two fetters of the body are the overesteeming of morality and ascetic practices and the perplexity, because they abide in the object of covetousness.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary is:

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang tshor ba dang // dus dang sred dang mdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang tshor ba dang // dus dang sred dang mdud pa'o //
translated: Result, cause, feeling, time, craving, and fetter.

original: dga' bas nye bar brlan pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu bstan pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //üîΩde ltar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni skye ba'i gnas @164a * //
analyzed: dga' bas nye bar brlan pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu bstan pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // de ltar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni skye ba'i gnas @164a * //
translated: The moisture of joy should be understood as the cause of the formative forces, as explained above.

original: gnyis su nying mtshams sbyor ba dang 'brel par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su nying mtshams sbyor ba dang 'brel par rig par bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that has entered in this way should be understood as the link of consciousness in the two types of rebirth.

original: gzugs can dang // gzugs can ma yin pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzugs can dang // gzugs can ma yin pa'i bar ro //
translated: It is the link of consciousness in the two types of rebirth, that is, in the rebirth that possesses form and in the rebirth that is formless.

original: de la gzugs can ni bar ma do'i srid pa la brten pa'i sgo nas 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs can ni bar ma do'i srid pa la brten pa'i sgo nas 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'o //
translated: The form realm is coming and going by way of the intermediate existence.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba nyi tshe'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba nyi tshe'o //
translated: The formless realm is limited death and rebirth.

original: gnas pa ni gnyi ga'i tshe'i tshad ji srid du gnas pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni gnyi ga'i tshe'i tshad ji srid du gnas pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Abiding is the state of remaining for as long as one‚Äôs life span lasts.

original: gnas pa de yang 'dod pa'i khams na mi rnams kyi ni gnas skabs gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa de yang 'dod pa'i khams na mi rnams kyi ni gnas skabs gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Abiding in the desire realm should be understood as three states:

original: thog mar mngal du rnam par shes pa brlan pa dang mngal na gnas pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang mngal nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: thog mar mngal du rnam par shes pa brlan pa dang mngal na gnas pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang mngal nas byung ba'o //
translated: at the beginning, the consciousness enters the womb and the embryo develops; in the middle, the embryo emerges from the womb; and in the end, the embryo is born.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Another enumeration is the desire, form, and formless realms, respectively.

original: de la gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jig pa'i lam bor nas 'di skad du bdag gis tha dad par gdags par bya'o zhes zer ba ni des btags pa de yang tshig tha dad par zad pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de la gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jig pa'i lam bor nas 'di skad du bdag gis tha dad par gdags par bya'o zhes zer ba ni des btags pa de yang tshig tha dad par zad pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Those who, having abandoned the path taught by the TathƒÅgata for the destruction of consciousness, say, I will designate a separate self, are designating a self that is merely a different term.

original: tshig gi gzhi tsam du zad do //
analyzed: tshig gi gzhi tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just the basis of a different term.üîΩ Or, if later you are asked, by other wise people, ‚ÄúWhat is the separate self that you designate?‚Äù you will not know.

original: yang na shes pa gzhan dag gis rigs pas bstan pa'i tshig tha dad pa de la khyod kyis tha dad par btags pa de gang yin zhes phyis dris na yang mi shes pa'am yang na rang nyid kyis phyis shes par gyur te /
analyzed: yang na shes pa gzhan dag gis rigs pas bstan pa'i tshig tha dad pa de la khyod kyis tha dad par btags pa de gang yin zhes phyis dris na yang mi shes pa'am yang na rang nyid kyis phyis shes par gyur te /
translated: Or, later, you will understand.

original: tshul bzhin du brtags pa na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du brtags pa na /
translated: Having examined it properly,

original: sngar rmongs pa de la rmongs pa yin par shes pas khong du chud nas bdag gis ni sngar log par zin par 'gyur gyi legs par zin pa ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: sngar rmongs pa de la rmongs pa yin par shes pas khong du chud nas bdag gis ni sngar log par zin par 'gyur gyi legs par zin pa ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: you will understand that you were confused before. Having understood, you will think, ‚ÄúI previously grasped wrongly, not correctly.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu'o //
translated: The form realm is the ten form elements.

original: tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams rnams ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams rnams ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The elements of sensation, ideation, and co-efficient are to be known as sixfold.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni gnas skabs gsum du nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni gnas skabs gsum du nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Consciousness is to be known as liberated from the defilements in three states:üîΩin the state of seeing, because it is far removed from and separated from the envelopments by the vision of the truths;üîΩin the state of meditative development, because it is far removed from and separated from the latent tendencies of the envelopments;

original: 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su lta bas kun nas dkris pa dang thag ring zhing 'bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i sa la 'di las phyi rol pa'i mdud pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spang ba'i phyir dang / bsgom pa'i lam la brten pas mthar thug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su lta bas kun nas dkris pa dang thag ring zhing 'bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i sa la 'di las phyi rol pa'i mdud pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spang ba'i phyir dang / bsgom pa'i lam la brten pas mthar thug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and in the state of the culmination of the practice, because it is far removed from and separated from the envelopments and latent tendencies.

original: de la @164b 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyis skye ba'i gnas rnam par brtags pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la @164b 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyis skye ba'i gnas rnam par brtags pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The non-Buddhists imagine the bases of rebirth to be:

original: dbang phyug chen por 'gyur ba dang / sred med kyi bur 'gyur ba dang / tshogs kyi bdag por 'gyur ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma dag tu skye bar 'dod pas na brnab sems kyi lus kyi mdud pa dang / gzhan lta ba mi mthun pa'i chos can la sdang bas gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen por 'gyur ba dang / sred med kyi bur 'gyur ba dang / tshogs kyi bdag por 'gyur ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma dag tu skye bar 'dod pas na brnab sems kyi lus kyi mdud pa dang / gzhan lta ba mi mthun pa'i chos can la sdang bas gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa ste /
translated: The fetter of malice is the hatred of others who have different views.

original: log par smon lam btab ste tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi dga' bar bya ba'i chos la mi phyogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: log par smon lam btab ste tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi dga' bar bya ba'i chos la mi phyogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The fetter of wrong view is the wrong aspiration that one will abide in pure conduct and the Dharma that delights fellow practitioners of pure conduct.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyis ni de dag gi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyis ni de dag gi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these causes are the defilements of the training in superior morality.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus kyi mdud pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus kyi mdud pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fetter of holding a discipline and ritual as paramount is the defilement of the training in superior mind.

original: 'di ni bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus kyi mdud pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus kyi mdud pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: The fetter of the body consisting of the extreme view of holding on to the belief that this is the truth is the defilement of the training in higher wisdom.

original: chos bzhi po 'di rnams kyis ni gzugs kyi lus dang ming gi lus su gtogs pa rnams la 'dzin pa dang / dmigs pa dang / gnas pa'i dngos po rnams la de'i sems mdud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di rnams kyis ni gzugs kyi lus dang ming gi lus su gtogs pa rnams la 'dzin pa dang / dmigs pa dang / gnas pa'i dngos po rnams la de'i sems mdud par 'gyur te /
translated: These four fetters bind the mind to the things that are grasped, objectified, and clung to in the bodies of form and the body of mind.

original: de bas na lus kyi mdud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lus kyi mdud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called fetters of the body.

original: de dag kyang yid kyi sa pa yin pa dang / yid kyis rnam par brtags pa dang / yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / yid la bag la nyal bar 'gyur ba dang / yid kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir na yid dang 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang yid kyi sa pa yin pa dang / yid kyis rnam par brtags pa dang / yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / yid la bag la nyal bar 'gyur ba dang / yid kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir na yid dang 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are also called fetters of the mind because they exist in the mental realm, are discriminated by the mind, are associated with the mind, lie dormant in the mind, and defile the mind.

original: de rnams spangs pas ni nyon mongs pa gang gis dmigs pa'i dmigs par byed pa de chad par 'gyur gyi gang la dmigs pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams spangs pas ni nyon mongs pa gang gis dmigs pa'i dmigs par byed pa de chad par 'gyur gyi gang la dmigs pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: By abandoning those, the object of observation of whatever affliction is cut off, but not the object of observation itself.

original: de phyin ci ma log par yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyin ci ma log par yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is understood correctly without error.

original: yang srid pa skye bar byed pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas yongs su zin pa'i yang srid par skye ba'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ni gnas der mi gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa skye bar byed pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas yongs su zin pa'i yang srid par skye ba'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ni gnas der mi gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousness that is the seed of rebirth in existence, which is grasped by karma and affliction that produces rebirth in existence, should be known as not abiding in that place.

original: de med pas phyi ma la tshul rnam pa gsum gyis snga ma bzhin du skye ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas pa 'gag par rig par bya'o //üîΩmi gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang rgyu'i rang bzhin dang @165a * //
analyzed: de med pas phyi ma la tshul rnam pa gsum gyis snga ma bzhin du skye ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas pa 'gag par rig par bya'o // mi gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang rgyu'i rang bzhin dang @165a * //
translated: Because of that, the future arising, increase, and expansion of the three types of existence should be known as ceased.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gnyis kyi sgo nas mngon par skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gnyis kyi sgo nas mngon par skye ba med do //
translated: That non-abiding consciousness also does not arise by way of cause and by way of effect.

original: lam gyis yongs su zin pas mngon par skye ba gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo la brten pas ni mngon par 'du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyis yongs su zin pas mngon par skye ba gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo la brten pas ni mngon par 'du ma byas pa'o //
translated: That which is born by being fully taken hold of by the path is unconditioned, based on the door of liberation of emptiness.

original: smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la brten pas ni chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la brten pas ni chog shes pa'o //
translated: It is satisfied, based on the door of liberation of wishlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la brten pas ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la brten pas ni gnas pa'o //
translated: It is abiding, based on the door of liberation of signlessness.

original: de la mngon par dga' ba la goms pas ni shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' ba la goms pas ni shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is completely liberated, by the practice of delighting in that.

original: bag la nyal thams cad gtugs pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'i 'og tu rtag par gnas par gyur na 'du byed 'gyur pa la yongs su yi chad pa med de phung po thob par gyur pa rnams rang gi ngang gis 'gag la gzhan dag gi yang
analyzed: bag la nyal thams cad gtugs pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'i 'og tu rtag par gnas par gyur na 'du byed 'gyur pa la yongs su yi chad pa med de phung po thob par gyur pa rnams rang gi ngang gis 'gag la gzhan dag gi yang
translated: After the mind is completely liberated by the exhaustion of all latent tendencies, if it always abides, it is not discouraged by the change of formations. The aggregates that have been obtained cease by themselves, and others

original: rgyu yang dag par chad pas skye ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu yang dag par chad pas skye ba med do //
translated: do not arise, because the cause is completely cut off.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa de ni phyogs bcu dag tu 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa de ni phyogs bcu dag tu 'gro ba med de /
translated: The cessation of the consciousness that is subject to the outflows does not go anywhere in the ten directions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par shes pa'i shing de grib ma dang 'dra ba'i tshor ba thams cad dang // mgo mnyam du mar me ltar mya ngan las 'da' bar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par shes pa'i shing de grib ma dang 'dra ba'i tshor ba thams cad dang // mgo mnyam du mar me ltar mya ngan las 'da' bar rig par bya'o /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness, which is like a tree, and all of its feelings, which are like the shade of that tree, should be understood to pass into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa, like a fire that goes out.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni kun nas dkris pa spong ba dang po'i sgo nas ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni kun nas dkris pa spong ba dang po'i sgo nas ni zhi ba'o //
translated: The realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa that has no remainder of the heaps is peace because of the abandonment of the first type of obscuration.

original: spong ba gnyis pa'i sgo nas ni bsil bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba gnyis pa'i sgo nas ni bsil bar gyur ba'o //
translated: It is coolness because of the abandonment of the second type of obscuration.

original: spong ba gsum pa'i sgo nas ni tshangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba gsum pa'i sgo nas ni tshangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is purity because of the abandonment of the third type of obscuration.üîΩThere is no support for the consciousness that grasps the heaps because of three aspects.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis ni rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas med de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis ni rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas med de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur ma gyur pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i grogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur ma gyur pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i grogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not itself defiled, because it does not cause the defilement of others, and because it is not the companion of any other consciousness.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom la / spong ba'i yan lag yang dag snang //
analyzed: sdom la / spong ba'i yan lag yang dag snang //
translated: The limbs of abandonment, the correct view,üîΩthe similarity of aspect and objective,üîΩthe incomparable teaching,üîΩthe four kinds of spiritual gene,üîΩthe four aspects of the path,

original: rnam pa dang ni dmigs pa dang // bstan pa mtshungs pa med pa dang // sems can ris ni bzhi dag dang // lam gyi rnam pa bzhi po dang // mthar thug pa ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: rnam pa dang ni dmigs pa dang // bstan pa mtshungs pa med pa dang // sems can ris ni bzhi dag dang // lam gyi rnam pa bzhi po dang // mthar thug pa ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: and the five culminations.

original: spong bar byed pa'i spong ba ni yan lag lngas bsdus te //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa'i spong ba ni yan lag lngas bsdus te //
translated: Abandonment as the abandonment of the abandoning is included in five limbs.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed yang dag par snang bar byed pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed yang dag par snang bar byed pa 'gyur te /
translated: It is the correct view of the formative forces, just as they are, which is the correct view of the path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang @165b lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang rtag tu byang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang @165b lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang rtag tu byang bar byed pa'o //
translated: the isolation of the body, the isolation of the mind, the meditative concentration which is the side of calm, the meditative concentration which is the side of deep insight, and the constant practice.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par snang bar byed pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par snang bar byed pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The correct appearance of reality should be known as having twelve aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: They are as they occur in the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: thos pa dang / rang gis legs par zin pa dang / log par zin pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yul dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa dang / rang gis legs par zin pa dang / log par zin pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yul dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang /
translated: They are the domain of hearing, personal realization, wrong realization, trustworthy scripture, direct perception, inference, specific characteristics, general characteristics, reality as it is,

original: ji snyed yod pa dang mthong ba dang / mthar thug pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa dang mthong ba dang / mthar thug pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: reality as it appears, seeing, and entry into the ultimate stage.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par snang bar byed pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'i gzhi ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par snang bar byed pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'i gzhi ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The basis of the object of the knowledge that has the aspects of the correct appearance of reality is fourfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yul nye bar sbyor ba las byung ba'i tshor ba rnams mi shes pa'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de shes pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang khyim pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang srid par skye ba la mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa la brten pa'i mi shes pa'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yul nye bar sbyor ba las byung ba'i tshor ba rnams mi shes pa'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de shes pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang khyim pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang srid par skye ba la mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa la brten pa'i mi shes pa'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The afflictions of engaging in compositional activity due to ignorance of the feelings that arise from contact with objects of ordinary beings who are followers of this Dharma and the purification that comes from knowing that.üîΩThe afflictions of engaging in compositional activity due to ignorance of the delight in rebirth and so on of ordinary beings who are householders and the purification that comes from the opposite of that.

original: de las bzlog pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang phyi rol gyi mu stegs can rnams kyis 'dod cing brtags pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba rnams kyis dga' ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams la mi shes pa'i dbang gis 'du byed 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de las bzlog pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang phyi rol gyi mu stegs can rnams kyis 'dod cing brtags pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba rnams kyis dga' ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams la mi shes pa'i dbang gis 'du byed 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The afflictions of engaging in compositional activity due to ignorance of the meditative attainments and births that are asserted and imagined by non Buddhist tƒ´rthikas and the purification that comes from the opposite of that.

original: de las bzlog pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang chos 'di pa'i slob pa rnams kyi dbang po dang yul dang brjed ngas pa'i sgo nas 'du byed rnams mi shes pa'i lhag ma yod pa'i dbang gis 'du byed 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang lhag ma de spangs pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur
analyzed: de las bzlog pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang chos 'di pa'i slob pa rnams kyi dbang po dang yul dang brjed ngas pa'i sgo nas 'du byed rnams mi shes pa'i lhag ma yod pa'i dbang gis 'du byed 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang lhag ma de spangs pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur
translated: Moreover, for trainees of this Dharma, due to the remaining ignorance of formations through the faculties, objects and forgetfulness, there is the affliction of engaging in formations and due to abandoning that remainder, there is purification.

original: ba'o // de la phyogs thams cad kyi rnam par byang ba'i phyogs ni chos 'di pa rnams kyi nyi tshe yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ba'o // de la phyogs thams cad kyi rnam par byang ba'i phyogs ni chos 'di pa rnams kyi nyi tshe yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The side of purification in all aspects should be known as the side of trainees of this Dharma.

original: 'di dag ni dmigs pa'i gzhi rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dmigs pa'i gzhi rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four bases of objectification.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa ni rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis mtshungs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa ni rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis mtshungs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The teachings of the tathƒÅgatas are unequaled due to three causes.

original: @166a * // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @166a * // 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ston pa dang / phyin ci ma log par ston pa dang / nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ston pa dang / phyin ci ma log par ston pa dang / nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is not shared, in a way that is not erroneous, and in a way that is fully enlightened by Himself.

original: de la de 'jig tshogs kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de la de 'jig tshogs kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: In this regard, the path that is the origin of the perishing collection is the origin of suffering.

original: 'jig tshogs 'gog par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba yin pas na thun mong ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs 'gog par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba yin pas na thun mong ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the perishing collection is the cessation of suffering. Thus, He teaches in a way that is not shared.

original: de yang yod pas na phyin ci ma log par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pas na phyin ci ma log par ston pa yin no //
translated: Since He also exists, He teaches in a way that is not erroneous.

original: de yang rab tu shes pas na nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rab tu shes pas na nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ston pa yin no //
translated: Since He also fully knows, He teaches in a way that is fully enlightened by Himself.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams 'jug pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams 'jug pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: These three are synonyms for the engagement of the formative forces.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig tshogs ni sems can rnams kyi chags pa'i gnas kyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ni sems can rnams kyi chags pa'i gnas kyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The perishing collection is for the sake of the meaning of the basis of attachment of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten ni gang la chags pa de 'jig pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni gang la chags pa de 'jig pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The world is so called because it is subject to destruction, since it is what is clung to.

original: srid pa ni zhig pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: srid pa ni zhig pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyis so //
translated: Existence is so called because it is what arises, since it is what is destroyed.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can gyi ris yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can gyi ris yin te /
translated: These four are the realms of sentient beings.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gcig tu nges par sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams ni 'bras bu nye bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams ni 'bras bu nye bar spyod pa ste /
translated: Those who are definitely abiding in the result of pleasant action are those who enjoy the result.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lha'i skye gnas dag na bag med par spyod pa gang yin pa rnams dang / gcig tu nges par rgyu la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i skye gnas dag na bag med par spyod pa gang yin pa rnams dang / gcig tu nges par rgyu la gnas pa ste /
translated: Those who are heedless in the divine realms and those who are definitely abiding in the cause.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de 'dod pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams dang / sems can gyi rigs gsum pa ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'dren ma ste 'di na gnas pa rnams 'bras bu la yang gnas shing spyod la phyi ma la yang sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su gzung ba dang /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams dang / sems can gyi rigs gsum pa ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'dren ma ste 'di na gnas pa rnams 'bras bu la yang gnas shing spyod la phyi ma la yang sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su gzung ba dang /
translated: Those who are ascetics and brahmins who desire that result and those who are the third type of sentient being, namely, those who are in the process of attaining nirvana and those who are a mixture of the two.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs la yang dus dus su bag yod par byed pa gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs la yang dus dus su bag yod par byed pa gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: and in the assembly of those who are in nirvana, he is always conscientious.

original: de la sems can gyi ris gsum po dag las ci rigs par 'jig rten dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i mtha' rnams dang / 'jig tshogs dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i mtha' rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi ris gsum po dag las ci rigs par 'jig rten dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i mtha' rnams dang / 'jig tshogs dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i mtha' rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Among the three classes of sentient beings, one should know that the four noble truths are respectively the world, the origin of the world, the cessation of the world, and the path leading to the cessation of the world.

original: ris tha ma bzhi pa las ni 'jig tshogs dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / de'i 'gog pa dang / de'i 'gro ba'i lam gyi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ris tha ma bzhi pa las ni 'jig tshogs dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / de'i 'gog pa dang / de'i 'gro ba'i lam gyi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: In the fourth class, one should know that the four noble truths are the perishing of the aggregates, the origin of the perishing of the aggregates, the cessation of the perishing of the aggregates, and the path leading to the cessation of the perishing of the aggregates.

original: lam gnyis kyis rnam pa bzhi gdags @166b pa yang rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam gnyis kyis rnam pa bzhi gdags @166b pa yang rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: One should know that the four noble truths are designated by two paths:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi'o //
translated: the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: de dag gi rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four noble truths in these two paths?

original: yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i rnam pa rnams so //
translated: the aspects of knowing, abandoning, realizing, and cultivating.

original: de la gsum ni mthong ba'i lam gyi'o //
analyzed: de la gsum ni mthong ba'i lam gyi'o //
translated: Three of these aspects belong to the path of seeing,

original: gcig ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi'o //
analyzed: gcig ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi'o //
translated: and one belongs to the path of cultivation.

original: mthong ba'i lam la zhugs te bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mod la ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la zhugs te bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mod la ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
translated: When one has entered the path of seeing and is directly realizing the truths, one knows suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba'i phyogs gcig ni spong ngo //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i phyogs gcig ni spong ngo //
translated: One abandons one part of the origin.

original: 'gog pa'i phyogs gcig ni mngon sum du byed do //üîΩphyogs gcig ma spangs pa dang ; mngon sum du ma byas pa de ma lus par spang pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bdag gis lam ji ltar thob pa bsgom par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyogs gcig ni mngon sum du byed do // phyogs gcig ma spangs pa dang ; mngon sum du ma byas pa de ma lus par spang pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bdag gis lam ji ltar thob pa bsgom par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: One realizes one part of cessation.üîΩOne cultivates the path in order to completely abandon and realize the part that has not been abandoned and not realized.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la de ltar so sor brtags nas lam bsgom pa la brten te lhag ma spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la de ltar so sor brtags nas lam bsgom pa la brten te lhag ma spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Having thus reflected on the path of cultivation, one attains the abandonment and realization of the remainder by cultivating the path.

original: / des de ltar mthar thug pa thob pa'i mthar thug pa de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: / des de ltar mthar thug pa thob pa'i mthar thug pa de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The culmination of the achievement of that is also to be known as fivefold.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa ma lus par zad pa thob pa dang / gzhan gyi don la mthu yod pa dang / rang gi don rnam pa thams cad du phun sum tshogs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa'i shes pa thob pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa ma lus par zad pa thob pa dang / gzhan gyi don la mthu yod pa dang / rang gi don rnam pa thams cad du phun sum tshogs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa'i shes pa thob pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du zhugs pa dang /
translated: The attainment of the exhaustion of suffering and its cause without exception, the ability to benefit others, the perfection of one's own aim in every way, the attainment of the knowledge of complete abandonment, and the entry into the city of nirvana.

original: der zhugs nas kyang 'phags pa'i gnas pas de ltar lhag par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der zhugs nas kyang 'phags pa'i gnas pas de ltar lhag par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And having entered there, one abides in that way by the noble abodes.

original: de la rnam pa dang po la ni srid pa la sogs pa'i rgyun chad de /
analyzed: de la rnam pa dang po la ni srid pa la sogs pa'i rgyun chad de /
translated: In the first aspect, the continuum of existence is severed.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam grangs bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam grangs bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the four categories as before.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa la ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs su snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa la ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs su snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In the second aspect, it should be known as the four categories as before, such as the arhat who has exhausted the defilements.

original: rnam pa gsum pa la ni 'du byed kyi dngos po thams cad spangs pa'i phyir gtan du mthar thug pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa'i phyir gtan du dri ma med par 'gyur pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i lam thob pa'i phyir gtan du tshangs par spyod pa mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa la ni 'du byed kyi dngos po thams cad spangs pa'i phyir gtan du mthar thug pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa'i phyir gtan du dri ma med par 'gyur pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i lam thob pa'i phyir gtan du tshangs par spyod pa mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: In the third case, it is final and ultimate because it abandons all conditioned things, it is eternally stainless because it eternally abandons all afflictions, and it is the ultimate perfection of pure conduct because it obtains the path that is the antidote to those.

original: rnam pa bzhi pa la ni dper na 'jig rten na yang rnam pa lngas grong khyer du 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pa la ni dper na 'jig rten na yang rnam pa lngas grong khyer du 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: In the fourth case, it is like the five aspects of entering a city in the world,

original: gang yang rung ba ma tshang bas ni ma yin pa de bzhin du de dang 'dra bar mya ngan las @167a * //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba ma tshang bas ni ma yin pa de bzhin du de dang 'dra bar mya ngan las @167a * //
translated: because it is not by any deficiency.

original: 'das pa'i grong khyer du yang rnam pa lngas 'jug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i grong khyer du yang rnam pa lngas 'jug par rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that there are five aspects of entering the city of nirvana.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: grong khyer gyi sgo yang phye la 'obs kyang bkang ste /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi sgo yang phye la 'obs kyang bkang ste /
translated: The gate to the city is opened and the moat is filled in.

original: g-yang sa ma yin zhing zab pa ma yin pa dang / rgal bar nus pa dang / 'obs de rgal nas kyang sgo drung du thug par gyur pa dang / grong khyer der 'gro bar bdag nyid kyis gsol ba gdab kyang mi dgos la /
analyzed: g-yang sa ma yin zhing zab pa ma yin pa dang / rgal bar nus pa dang / 'obs de rgal nas kyang sgo drung du thug par gyur pa dang / grong khyer der 'gro bar bdag nyid kyis gsol ba gdab kyang mi dgos la /
translated: And after crossing over the moat, he would reach the door of the city without having to pray to anyone to enter the city.

original: gzhan dag gi don du rgyal mtshan bsgrengs nas 'jug par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi don du rgyal mtshan bsgrengs nas 'jug par yang mi byed de /
translated: He would not enter after hoisting a banner for his own sake or for the sake of others.

original: de ltar na de grong khyer du 'jug pa la bar du chod pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na de grong khyer du 'jug pa la bar du chod pa med do //
translated: Thus, his entry into the city would be without obstruction.üîΩIn the same way, in the entry into the city of nirvana, the five lower fetters are the open door.

original: de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa la yang tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas sgo phye bar gyur la mya ngan las 'das pa la g-yang sar 'du shes pas skrag par byed pa'i ma rig pa spangs pas ni 'obs
analyzed: de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa la yang tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas sgo phye bar gyur la mya ngan las 'das pa la g-yang sar 'du shes pas skrag par byed pa'i ma rig pa spangs pas ni 'obs
translated: The ignorance that is the fear of nirvana because of the perception of nirvana as a precipice is the moat.

original: bkang ba yin no //
analyzed: bkang ba yin no //
translated: It is filled with the four noble truths.

original: 'jig tshogs kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba dang / lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pas ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa la sgo drung du thug par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba dang / lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pas ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa la sgo drung du thug par gyur pa yin te /
translated: He is about to enter the door of the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: srid pa'i sred pa spangs pa de ni yul rnams la yang srid pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa spangs pa de ni yul rnams la yang srid pa mi 'jug la /
translated: He has abandoned craving for existence, and so he does not enter into existence in objects.

original: bden pa rnams la yang nga rgyal mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la yang nga rgyal mi 'jug ste /
translated: He does not enter into pride in the truths.

original: de ni snga ma bzhin du rgyu rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni snga ma bzhin du rgyu rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these five causes, as before, he should be known as one who has entered the city of nirvana.

original: de la zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i gnas pa yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i gnas pa yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: He who has entered has two kinds of noble abodes:

original: 'gro zhing rgyu ba dang / gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro zhing rgyu ba dang / gnas pa'o //
translated: that of going and coming, and that of staying.

original: de la 'gro zhing rgyu ba yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'gro zhing rgyu ba yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The going and coming should be known as threefold:

original: thun mong ma yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
translated: 1) uncommon, 2) unafflicted, 3) abiding in the right place.

original: de la tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spangs pas ni 'dod pa rnams la gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag nyid la spyod pas na thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spangs pas ni 'dod pa rnams la gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag nyid la spyod pas na thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: By abandoning the five fetters that are conducive to the lower realms, they are uncommon, since they are those who are permanently free from attachment to the desire realm and who practice the transcendent perfections.

original: rtag tu gnas pa drug gis yongs su zin pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa drug gis yongs su zin pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since they are sustained by the six constant abodes, they are unafflicted.

original: brtags nas chos kha cig yongs su spong ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtags nas chos kha cig yongs su spong ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having examined, they completely abandon some things,

original: glang po che dang / rta ma rungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta ma rungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as wild elephants and horses.

original: brtags nas kha cig rten par byed pa 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtags nas kha cig rten par byed pa 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having examined, they rely on some things,

original: gos dang zas la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gos dang zas la sogs pa ste /
translated: such as clothes, food, and so on.

original: de ni @167b yang dag pa'i gnas la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni @167b yang dag pa'i gnas la gnas pa yin no //
translated: That is abiding in the right place.

original: de la de ltar rgyu zhing 'gro ba dag par gyur pa'i gnas pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la de ltar rgyu zhing 'gro ba dag par gyur pa'i gnas pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The way of abiding of those who are pure in their conduct and who travel in that way should be known as fivefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gang gis gnas pa dang / gang la gnas pa dang / gang dang bral ba dang / gang la brten pa dang / gang dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gnas pa dang / gang la gnas pa dang / gang dang bral ba dang / gang la brten pa dang / gang dang ldan pa'o //
translated: that by which one abides, that in which one abides, that from which one is separated, that on which one relies, and that with which one is endowed.

original: de la mi bskyod pa'i sems rnam par grol bas ni gnas so //
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa'i sems rnam par grol bas ni gnas so //
translated: Therein, the unshakable mind is liberated by which one abides.

original: brtags nas chos kha cig sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtags nas chos kha cig sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: Having examined, one rejects some things.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rgyu zhing 'gro bas g-yeng ba'i ngal ba la sogs pas las dub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhing 'gro bas g-yeng ba'i ngal ba la sogs pas las dub pa'o //
translated: the fatigue of being exhausted by the troubles of wandering about, etc.

original: brtags nas kha cig dang du len par byed de /
analyzed: brtags nas kha cig dang du len par byed de /
translated: Having examined, one accepts some things.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: cold, heat, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum dang ni bral te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum dang ni bral te /
translated: One is separated from the three defilements.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / srid pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rtog pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / srid pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rtog pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the defilement of views, the defilement of existence, and the defilement of conceptualization.

original: de la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni yang srid par skye bar sems g-yo ba med do //
analyzed: de la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni yang srid par skye bar sems g-yo ba med do //
translated: Therein, due to being separated from the defilement of views, the mind does not move towards rebirth in existence.

original: sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni yul rnams la 'phrogs pa med do //
analyzed: sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni yul rnams la 'phrogs pa med do //
translated: He is not carried away by objects, being free from the defilement of craving.

original: rtog pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni rtog pa na dge ba 'ba' zhig la rtog par byed kyi mi dge ba la ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni rtog pa na dge ba 'ba' zhig la rtog par byed kyi mi dge ba la ma yin no //
translated: He is free from the defilement of conceptualization, for when he conceptualizes, he only conceptualizes the wholesome, not the unwholesome.

original: de ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog gis bde bar gnas so //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog gis bde bar gnas so //
translated: He dwells in the highest bliss in this life, based on the unshakable concentration of the fourth meditation.

original: mi slob pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / sred pa med pa'i lus phyi ma mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas la lhag par gnas pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pa thob pa dang ni ldan no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / sred pa med pa'i lus phyi ma mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas la lhag par gnas pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pa thob pa dang ni ldan no //
translated: He is endowed with the liberation of the mind of the non-learner, the liberation by wisdom, the non-arising of the future body without craving, the state of abiding in the state of nirvana, and the attainment of the unsurpassed perfection.

original: de ltar na de rnam pa lnga po de dag gis gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de rnam pa lnga po de dag gis gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be known that he dwells in the highest perfection through these five aspects.

original: sdom ni / phyogs gnyis po ni mdor bsdu dang / mi 'dra ba ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sdom ni / phyogs gnyis po ni mdor bsdu dang / mi 'dra ba ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The summary verse: The two sides are summarized briefly, and the differences are threefold.

original: mos pa spong dang 'jug pa dang // yod dang shin tu rnam dag dang // legs par gsungs dang nyes bshad la //
analyzed: mos pa spong dang 'jug pa dang // yod dang shin tu rnam dag dang // legs par gsungs dang nyes bshad la //
translated: Interest, rejection, and engagement, existence, and complete purity, well-spoken and badly spoken,

original: ston pa la sogs khyad par rnams //
analyzed: ston pa la sogs khyad par rnams //
translated: the differences in teachers, etc.

original: nag po'i phyogs dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos rnams ni gnas gsum gyis bsdus te /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩyongs su @168a * //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos rnams ni gnas gsum gyis bsdus te / 'di lta ste / yongs su @168a * //
translated: The dharmas of the dark side and the bright side are included in three topics:üîΩthe dharmas that are to be fully understood,

original: shes par bya ba'i chos rnams dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i chos rnams dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa bsrung ba'o //
translated: the full understanding, and the protection of the full understanding.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: Among them, that which is to be fully understood is the truth of suffering and the truth of the origin,

original: nag po'i phyogs su 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs su 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: which should be known as included in the dark side.

original: yongs su shes pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The full understanding is the truth of cessation,

original: dkar po'i phyogs su 'dus so //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs su 'dus so //
translated: which is included in the bright side.

original: yongs su shes pa bsrung ba'i gang zag ni lam gyi bden pa la gang zag tu btags pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa bsrung ba'i gang zag ni lam gyi bden pa la gang zag tu btags pa ste /
translated: The person who preserves the knowledge of the truth of the path is designated as a person in the truth of the path.

original: de yang dkar po'i phyogs su 'dug pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dkar po'i phyogs su 'dug pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: And that person should be known as being only on the side of virtue.

original: de yang 'phags pa nyan thos kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa nyan thos kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: The noble disciple is skilled in conventional truth and skilled in ultimate truth.

original: des ni gnyi ga'i tshul gyis kyang lan gdab pa'i mi rigs par yang dag par mthong nas shi ba'i 'og tu yod do zhes kyang khas mi len zhing lan mi 'debs so //
analyzed: des ni gnyi ga'i tshul gyis kyang lan gdab pa'i mi rigs par yang dag par mthong nas shi ba'i 'og tu yod do zhes kyang khas mi len zhing lan mi 'debs so //
translated: He sees that it is not right to answer in either way, and after death he does not accept or answer that the self exists.

original: med ces bya ba dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med ces bya ba dang / yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang khas mi len zhing lan mi 'debs te /üîΩdon dam par ni shi ba'i 'og tu yod pa'am /
analyzed: med ces bya ba dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med ces bya ba dang / yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang khas mi len zhing lan mi 'debs te / don dam par ni shi ba'i 'og tu yod pa'am /
translated: He does not accept or answer that the self does not exist, or that it both does and does not exist, or that it neither exists nor does not exist.

original: med pa gang yin pa de ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de ni mi dmigs so //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the existence or nonexistence of the self after death is not perceived.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'du byed rnams sam mya ngan las 'das pa la de bzhin 'ongs pa zhes gdags grang na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'du byed rnams sam mya ngan las 'das pa la de bzhin 'ongs pa zhes gdags grang na /
translated: If one says that the TathƒÅgata is imputed in the conventional sense in relation to formations or nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: de la shi ba'i 'og tu ni de bzhin 'ongs pa'i 'du byed gcig kyang 'jug pa med na de'i tshe ci la brten te de bzhin 'ongs pa gdags par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la shi ba'i 'og tu ni de bzhin 'ongs pa'i 'du byed gcig kyang 'jug pa med na de'i tshe ci la brten te de bzhin 'ongs pa gdags par 'gyur /
translated: then after death, not even one formation of the TathƒÅgata remains in existence, so at that time, in dependence on what would the TathƒÅgata be imputed?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa so so rang rig pa ni 'du byed med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye par zad pas na dngos por gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa so so rang rig pa ni 'du byed med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye par zad pas na dngos por gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the peace of nirvƒÅ·πáa, which is free of elaborations and is to be personally experienced, is distinguished by the mere absence of formations, it is not suitable to be imputed as an entity.

original: med par gdags pa'i sgo nas kyang gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: med par gdags pa'i sgo nas kyang gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not suitable to be imputed as a nonentity.üîΩBecause if nirvƒÅ·πáa were imputed as an entity,

original: mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa yod pa dang / zhi ba yin bzhin du /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gdags pa yod pa dang / zhi ba yin bzhin du /
translated: it would be a deprecation of nirvƒÅ·πáa, which is peace, which exists,

original: skur ba btab par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur ba btab par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and which is the imputation of nonexistence.

original: de yang shin tu rtogs par dka' ba dang cha phra bas na zab po ;
analyzed: de yang shin tu rtogs par dka' ba dang cha phra bas na zab po ;
translated: Moreover, since it is very difficult to realize and is subtle, it is profound.

original: /'khor ba'i 'du byed kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma spangs pas rab tu phye bas na rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: /'khor ba'i 'du byed kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma spangs pas rab tu phye bas na rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast because it is distinguished by the abandonment of the various kinds of defilement of the formative forces of cyclic existence.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma rnams kyis dpag tu mi rung bas na dpag tu med do //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma rnams kyis dpag tu mi rung bas na dpag tu med do //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is not within the range of direct perception, inference, or trustworthy scripture.

original: phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba'i sdug @168b bsngal bas ni nang gi khur khyer ba'i sdug bsngal rgyu gsum gyis khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba'i sdug @168b bsngal bas ni nang gi khur khyer ba'i sdug bsngal rgyu gsum gyis khyad zhugs te /
translated: The suffering of bearing the internal burden is distinguished from the suffering of bearing the external burden in three ways:

original: khur gang len pa dang / gang gis len pa dang / ji srid kyi bar du len pa'o //
analyzed: khur gang len pa dang / gang gis len pa dang / ji srid kyi bar du len pa'o //
translated: the burden that is taken up, that which takes it up, and the duration for which it is taken up.

original: de la phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba ni gzugs kyi phyogs 'gar gtogs pa tsam zhig khyer bar zad de sogs ma'i khur ram shing khur ram /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba ni gzugs kyi phyogs 'gar gtogs pa tsam zhig khyer bar zad de sogs ma'i khur ram shing khur ram /
translated: In this regard, the external burden is merely the carrying of a load belonging to the category of form, such as a load of grain or a load of wood.

original: gzhan yang de dang mthun pa len par byed pa la byis pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyi khur len par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang mthun pa len par byed pa la byis pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyi khur len par byed do //
translated: The child takes up the burden of all the formative forces.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba ni lus su gtogs pa'i phrag pas khur khyer bar byed la byis pa ni srid pa'i phrag pas khur khyer bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba ni lus su gtogs pa'i phrag pas khur khyer bar byed la byis pa ni srid pa'i phrag pas khur khyer bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, the external burden is carried on the shoulders of the body, but the fool carries the burden on the shoulders of existence.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba ni phrag pa de nyid yod bzhin pas phyogs gcig tu khur 'dor bar byed la byis pa ni srid pa'i phrag pa ji srid yod kyi bar du khur khyer bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi khur khyer ba ni phrag pa de nyid yod bzhin pas phyogs gcig tu khur 'dor bar byed la byis pa ni srid pa'i phrag pa ji srid yod kyi bar du khur khyer bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, the external burden is put down in one place, since the shoulders exist. But the fool carries the burden as long as the shoulders of existence exist.

original: de ni khur 'dor bar 'dod na yang phrag pa dang bcas pas 'dor nus kyi de ma yin gyi bar du mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni khur 'dor bar 'dod na yang phrag pa dang bcas pas 'dor nus kyi de ma yin gyi bar du mi nus so //
translated: And when he wants to put down the burden, he can do so with the shoulders, but not without them.

original: de ni ji srid 'dor mi nus pa de srid du khur cher po blangs pa dang / phrag pa nyam chung ba dang / de na mo ma yin pa dang / ma zhi ba blangs pa dang / yun ring por rgyun mi 'chad par khur khyer bas na khur sum rim du khyer ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur gyi cig shos ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ji srid 'dor mi nus pa de srid du khur cher po blangs pa dang / phrag pa nyam chung ba dang / de na mo ma yin pa dang / ma zhi ba blangs pa dang / yun ring por rgyun mi 'chad par khur khyer bas na khur sum rim du khyer ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur gyi cig shos ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: As long as one cannot put it down, one is carrying a heavy load, one has weak shoulders, one is not a woman, one is not peaceful, one is carrying a load for a long time without interruption, and one is experiencing the suffering of carrying a load in three stages. The other is not like that.

original: 'di ni de gnyis kyis mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de gnyis kyis mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: phyi rol gyi 'ching ba pas ni nang gi byis pa'i 'ching ba rnam pa lngas khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'ching ba pas ni nang gi byis pa'i 'ching ba rnam pa lngas khyad zhugs te /
translated: The external fetters are distinguished from the internal fetters of the childish in five ways.

original: phyi rol gyi 'ching ba ni gzugs kyi phyogs gcig gis bcings pa ste /üîΩshing ngam / lcags sam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'ching ba ni gzugs kyi phyogs gcig gis bcings pa ste / shing ngam / lcags sam /
translated: The external fetters are bound by one part of form.üîΩThey are bound by the fetters of wood, iron,

original: rtsva bal ba dza'i bcing bas bcings par zad la byis pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyis bcings so //
analyzed: rtsva bal ba dza'i bcing bas bcings par zad la byis pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyis bcings so //
translated: or grass and reeds. The childish are bound by all formations.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi ni gzhan gyis bcings pa yin la byis pa ni bdag gis bdag bcings so //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi ni gzhan gyis bcings pa yin la byis pa ni bdag gis bdag bcings so //
translated: Moreover, the external is bound by another, but the childish bind themselves.

original: phyi rol gyi ni bcings par gyur na 'ching ba de'i gzhi yang shes /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni bcings par gyur na 'ching ba de'i gzhi yang shes /
translated: When the external is bound, the basis of that bondage is known,

original: thar pa dang thar bar bya ba'i thabs kyang shes la byis pa ni thams cad mi shes so //
analyzed: thar pa dang thar bar bya ba'i thabs kyang shes la byis pa ni thams cad mi shes so //
translated: and liberation and the means of liberation are known, but the childish do not know anything.

original: pha rol gyi ni shi phan chad 'ching ba dang bral bar 'gyur la byis pa'i ni shi ba'i 'og tu 'khor ba na 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba byas kyang 'ching ba dang rjes su 'brel par 'dug go //üîΩphyi rol gyi ni rab tu byung ste 'dod pa spangs pas 'ching ba de las @169a * //
analyzed: pha rol gyi ni shi phan chad 'ching ba dang bral bar 'gyur la byis pa'i ni shi ba'i 'og tu 'khor ba na 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba byas kyang 'ching ba dang rjes su 'brel par 'dug go // phyi rol gyi ni rab tu byung ste 'dod pa spangs pas 'ching ba de las @169a * //
translated: The external, after death, becomes free from bondage, but the childish, after death, having come and gone in sa·πÉsƒÅra, remain connected with bondage.

original: thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thar par 'gyur te /
translated: The external, having gone forth and abandoned desire, is liberated from that bondage.

original: dgra rnams kyang de 'ching bar mi byed la byis pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad 'thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur kyang thar bar mi 'gyur na rab tu byung ba tsam lta ci smos de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs rnams su
analyzed: dgra rnams kyang de 'ching bar mi byed la byis pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad 'thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur kyang thar bar mi 'gyur na rab tu byung ba tsam lta ci smos de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs rnams su
translated: In the stages of being free from attachment,

original: yang shas kyi bdud kyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang shas kyi bdud kyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: they come under the power of Mara.üîΩIn the stages of not being free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs rnams su ni dbang 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs rnams su ni dbang 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: they are completely under his power.üîΩIn the stages of going forth,

original: rab tu byung ba'i gnas skabs rnams su ni chad pa na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i gnas skabs rnams su ni chad pa na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: they are like those who are executed.üîΩIn the stages of living at home,

original: khyim na gnas pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ni ci dga' mgur bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ni ci dga' mgur bya ba yin no //
translated: they do whatever they want.üîΩIn the stages of not being free from attachment,

original: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs rnams su ni bdud kyi 'ching ba rnams kyis bcings pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs rnams su ni bdud kyi 'ching ba rnams kyis bcings pa yin te /
translated: they are bound by the bonds of Mara.

original: 'jig rten gyi lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mor skyes na yang bdud kyi zhags pa rnams las yongs su ma grol lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lam gyis srid pa'i rtse mor skyes na yang bdud kyi zhags pa rnams las yongs su ma grol lo //
translated: Even if one is born in the peak of existence by the mundane path, one is not completely freed from the bonds of Mara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang dgra bcom pa shes rab rnam par grol ba ni spyir na rnam pa bzhis 'dra ba dang / mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang dgra bcom pa shes rab rnam par grol ba ni spyir na rnam pa bzhis 'dra ba dang / mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The Tathagata and the Arhat are similar and dissimilar in general with respect to the liberation of wisdom in four ways.

original: de la rnam pa gcig gis ni 'dra ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gcig gis ni 'dra ste /
translated: In one way they are similar:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: spyir rnam par grol bas so //
analyzed: spyir rnam par grol bas so //
translated: in general liberation.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis ni mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis ni mi 'dra ste /
translated: In three ways they are dissimilar:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mngon par byang chub pa dang / ston pa'i mthu dang / nan tan du sgrub pas so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa dang / ston pa'i mthu dang / nan tan du sgrub pas so //
translated: in the realization of enlightenment, in the power of teaching, and in the practice of earnest application.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni slob dpon med par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa ba bdun bsgoms nas nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa las brtsams
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni slob dpon med par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa ba bdun bsgoms nas nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa las brtsams
translated: The Tathagata, without a teacher, having cultivated the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, realized enlightenment by himself. Having thus realized enlightenment, he undertook the welfare of others in its entirety,

original: te tshe 'di nyid la skal pa yod pa gang yin pa rnams dang / skal pa med pa gang yin pa rnams dang / chos mthong ba gang yin pa rnams dang / chos ma mthong ba gang yin pa rnams de dag gi rnam pa thams cad mngon par mkhyen to //
analyzed: te tshe 'di nyid la skal pa yod pa gang yin pa rnams dang / skal pa med pa gang yin pa rnams dang / chos mthong ba gang yin pa rnams dang / chos ma mthong ba gang yin pa rnams de dag gi rnam pa thams cad mngon par mkhyen to //
translated: He knows all the aspects of those who have good fortune in this very life, those who do not have good fortune, those who see the Dharma, and those who do not see the Dharma.

original: de nyid kyis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la de ltar gzhan gyi don kyang mngon par mkhyen na sgrib pa gnyis po nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang / shes bya'i sgrub pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la de ltar gzhan gyi don kyang mngon par mkhyen na sgrib pa gnyis po nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang / shes bya'i sgrub pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: By that very [knowledge], he becomes fully enlightened, and thus, knowing the benefit for others, he becomes liberated from the two obscurations: the afflictive obscurations along with their traces, and the obscurations to the knowledge of all objects of knowledge.

original: zla med pa dang / lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi thar pa'i slob dpon du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla med pa dang / lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi thar pa'i slob dpon du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes the unsurpassed teacher of liberation for the world with its gods.

original: de'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam @169b pa bzhi po 'di dag ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam @169b pa bzhi po 'di dag ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These four kinds of full enlightenment of the Buddha should be understood as not shared in common with the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i mthu yang rnam pa lngas thun mong ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i mthu yang rnam pa lngas thun mong ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The power of teaching should be recognized as extraordinary in five ways, from the perspective of benefiting others.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni lam la yang lam yin par rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen la lam ma yin pa la yang lam ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni lam la yang lam yin par rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen la lam ma yin pa la yang lam ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathagata knows the path and what is not the path in all aspects and exactly as it is. He knows what is not the path as not the path.

original: mkhyen nas kyang lam ma yin par 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lam du 'gro bar mdzad pa'i phyir lam dang lam ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang lam ma yin par 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lam du 'gro bar mdzad pa'i phyir lam dang lam ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston to //
translated: Having known, he does not go on what is not the path, and he teaches what is and is not the path as it is, in order to make others go on the path.

original: lam ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du 'gro 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag la ni lam de la yang dag par nan tan du bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir thabs kyis yongs su zin cing rigs pas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa'i gdams ngag bstan pa'i sgo nas
analyzed: lam ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du 'gro 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag la ni lam de la yang dag par nan tan du bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir thabs kyis yongs su zin cing rigs pas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa'i gdams ngag bstan pa'i sgo nas
translated: To those who wish to go on the path as it is taught, he gives instructions on attention that is supported by method and generated by reasoning, in order to make them practice correctly on that path.

original: gsungs so // ji skad du rjes su bstan cing nan tan du bsgrub pa de'i bar du gcod pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi skyon gang yin pa de dag ni sel bar byed la mthun pa gang yin pa de dag ni sgrub par byed pa 'di ni bstan pa'i mthu
analyzed: gsungs so // ji skad du rjes su bstan cing nan tan du bsgrub pa de'i bar du gcod pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi skyon gang yin pa de dag ni sel bar byed la mthun pa gang yin pa de dag ni sgrub par byed pa 'di ni bstan pa'i mthu
translated: The concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the path of cultivation.üîΩThe concordant are the seven factors of enlightenment.üîΩThe discordant are the five faults.üîΩThe concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the path of the adept.üîΩThe concordant are the eightfold noble path.üîΩThe discordant are the five faults.üîΩThe concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the result of the arhat.üîΩThe concordant are the three foundations of mindfulness of the arhat.

original: mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: The discordant are the five faults.üîΩThe concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the result of the pratyekabuddha.

analyzed: de la nan tan du sgrub pa mi 'dra ba ni de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas /
