analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dag par nan tan du sgrub par byed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni su la yang brten pa med do //
translated: The concordant are the ten perfections.üîΩThe discordant are the five faults.üîΩThe concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the result of the Buddha.üîΩThe concordant are the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructednesses, and the eighteen exclusive qualities.üîΩThe discordant are the five faults.üîΩThe concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the result of the bodhisattva.

original: de dag ni nyan thos kyi rigs dang ldan pas nan tan du sgrub par byed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyid kyi rigs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni nyan thos kyi rigs dang ldan pas nan tan du sgrub par byed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyid kyi rigs dang ldan pas so //
translated: The concordant are the ten perfections.üîΩThe discordant are the five faults.üîΩThe concordant and discordant are the concordant and discordant conditions for the realization of the result of the Buddha.üîΩThe concordant are the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructednesses,

original: de dag las kha cig ni yongs su smin pa yin la kha cig ni phyi ma la yongs su smin par bya ba yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma ba'i rgyud la ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba med do //
analyzed: de dag las kha cig ni yongs su smin pa yin la kha cig ni phyi ma la yongs su smin par bya ba yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma ba'i rgyud la ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba med do //
translated: Some of them are fully matured, some are to be fully matured in the future. But in the continuum of the Bodhisattva in his final rebirth, there is no division into two kinds.

original: yongs su ma smin pa gang yin pa de dag ni lam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa gang yin pa de dag ni lam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Those who are not fully matured are on the path of following;

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa phyi ma la yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa phyi ma la yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: those whose continua are not fully matured will be fully matured in the future.

original: yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de dag ni tshe 'di nyid la ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du byed de /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de dag ni tshe 'di nyid la ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du byed de /
translated: Those who are fully matured act in accordance with the teaching of the Master in this very life.

original: gnyi ga yang ji skad du bstan pa de kho na bzhin du nan tan du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ji skad du bstan pa de kho na bzhin du nan tan du sgrub par byed de /
translated: Both of them practice earnestly just as they have been taught.

original: lam gyi rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma la mya ngan las 'das pa grub par byed do //
analyzed: lam gyi rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma la mya ngan las 'das pa grub par byed do //
translated: Those who are on the path of following will achieve nirvana in the future.

original: tshe de nyid la ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du byed pa gang yin @170a * //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du byed pa gang yin @170a * //
translated: Those who act in accordance with the teaching of the Master in this very lifeüîΩwill achieve nirvana in this very life.

original: pa de dag ni lus de nyid kyis lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa kho nar byed do //
analyzed: pa de dag ni lus de nyid kyis lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa kho nar byed do //
translated: They only achieve the path and the fruit of the path, nirvana, with that very body.

original: de la 'phags pa'i lam ni gnod pa med pa dang / bde ba yin pas na 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba dang / chos shes bya la phan pa'i phyir na dag pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i lam ni gnod pa med pa dang / bde ba yin pas na 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba dang / chos shes bya la phan pa'i phyir na dag pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since the noble path is non-harming and blissful, it is not contrary to reason and is proper, and since it is beneficial for the knower of Dharma, it is also called pure.

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag med par mos pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod do //üîΩthos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / bsgoms nas rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag med par mos pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod do // thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang / bsgoms nas rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'o //
translated: Faith in the selflessness of compounded phenomena is of two kinds.üîΩIt arises from the power of hearing and reflection, and it arises from the power of realization through meditation.

original: de la thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba ni bsgoms nas rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba skye ba'i rten gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de la thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba ni bsgoms nas rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba skye ba'i rten gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: Among them, that arising from the power of hearing and reflection performs the function of being the basis for the arising of that arising from the power of realization through meditation.

original: de yang legs pa yang yin la rab kyang yin mod kyi 'on kyang dad pas rab tu byung ba'i rigs kyi bus ni de tsam gyis chog par gzung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang legs pa yang yin la rab kyang yin mod kyi 'on kyang dad pas rab tu byung ba'i rigs kyi bus ni de tsam gyis chog par gzung bar mi rigs te /
translated: Although that is good and excellent, still it is not proper for a son of noble family who has gone forth out of faith to be satisfied with just that.

original: de la brten nas 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i rim pas rtogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba bdag med pa la mos pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa kho nar bya'o //

translated: Therefore, based on that, he should strive only to realize the conviction in selflessness that arises through the power of realization, by the process of cultivating the perception of impermanence in conditioned things, and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi spang ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi spang ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: kun nas dkris pa spang ba dang / bag la nyal spang ba dang / yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyu spang ba dang / de ltar gyi 'du byed kyi nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i spyod pa spang ba'o //

translated: The suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.

translated: The suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.

original: rgas pa'i rgyu dang dbang po rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur bas ni rga she'i sdug bsngal gyis dkris so //
analyzed: rgas pa'i rgyu dang dbang po rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur bas ni rga she'i sdug bsngal gyis dkris so //
translated: The suffering of suffering is the suffering of change because it is suffering in the nature of suffering.

original: 'du byed rnams mngon par mi @170b 'grub pa'i phyir thog ma dang / bar ma dang tha mar 'gog par 'gyur bas ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum 'gog par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mngon par mi @170b 'grub pa'i phyir thog ma dang / bar ma dang tha mar 'gog par 'gyur bas ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum 'gog par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because formations are not actualized, one should know that the three kinds of suffering are stopped in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: yod pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yod pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of existence:

analyzed: de dag spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos 'bad par byed de /
translated: The noble disciple strives to abandon them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:üîΩThrough the past, when one goes forth from home to homelessness, having seen the danger in that, one abandons the desires that one will later take up again.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ba na de nyid kyi nyes dmigs mthong nas 'dod pa spang ba gang yin pa de dag phyis yang len par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yod pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni 'du byed mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yod pa dang /

translated: Through the future, there is the existence of the cause for the actualization of formations.

original: de ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni ma spangs pa'i bag la nyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yod do //
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni ma spangs pa'i bag la nyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yod do //

original: de la yod pa rnam pa gsum po de spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yod pa rnam pa gsum po de spang ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of abandoning those three kinds of existence,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.üîΩOne strives with three aspects:

original: mi lta ba dang / mngon par mi dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa med pa rnam pa gsum gyis 'bad par byed de /
analyzed: mi lta ba dang / mngon par mi dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa med pa rnam pa gsum gyis 'bad par byed de /
translated: not seeing, not delighting, and not being attached.

original: spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i khams yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i khams yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro /
translated: One strives in order to accomplish the realms of abandonment, freedom from attachment, and cessation.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /üîΩbam po lnga pa /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba / bam po lnga pa /
translated: The Compendium of Bases in the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi says:

analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'du byed rnams la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i bdag med pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: These two are the insight into selflessness that is not inflated about formations.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: They are not very pure and very pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig dpen pa na gnas te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig dpen pa na gnas te /
translated: It is like this. Here, some abide in solitude.

original: 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa'i bzod pa la brten nas 'jig rten pa'i shes pas bdag med pa la mos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa'i bzod pa la brten nas 'jig rten pa'i shes pas bdag med pa la mos par 'gyur la /
translated: Based on the acceptance of the impermanence of formations, they become interested in selflessness with mundane knowledge.

original: des kyang mos pa'i rgyus mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams nas yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma kun tu spyod pa'i sgo nas spangs par yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: des kyang mos pa'i rgyus mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams nas yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma kun tu spyod pa'i sgo nas spangs par yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: He also sees that, through the cause of faith, the signs of grasping at self and grasping at self and what belongs to self with regard to objects of knowledge, from forms that are objects of eye consciousness up to phenomena that are objects of mental consciousness, are abandoned.

original: phyi rol pa'i mdud pa bzhir bsdus pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i mdud pa bzhir bsdus pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four knots of non-Buddhists are also included in those.

original: 'dod chags tha chad dang / zhe sdang tha chad dang / gti mug tha chad de /
analyzed: 'dod chags tha chad dang / zhe sdang tha chad dang / gti mug tha chad de /
translated: They are: the lowest attachment, the lowest aversion, and the lowest delusion.

original: de la brnab sems lus kyi mdud pas ni 'dod chags tha chad bsdus so //
analyzed: de la brnab sems lus kyi mdud pas ni 'dod chags tha chad bsdus so //

original: gnod sems kyi mdud pas ni zhe sdang tha chad bsdus so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi mdud pas ni zhe sdang tha chad bsdus so //
translated: The knot of malice is included in the lowest aversion.

original: de ma yin pa gnyis kyis ni @171a * //üîΩgti mug tha chad bsdus so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gnyis kyis ni @171a * // gti mug tha chad bsdus so //
translated: The other two are included in the lowest delusion.

original: tha chad kyi don ni ngan pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha chad kyi don ni ngan pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúlowest‚Äù should be understood as meaning ‚Äúbad‚Äù.

analyzed: 'di ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i bdag med pa shes pa ste /
translated: This is the knowledge of selflessness without manifest pride.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is associated with proper mental attention and because it is a stage of meditative concentration.

original: / de yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not very pure due to two causes.

original: de nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa de'i tshe nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rags pa la cha phra ba'o snyam du spyod pa yid la byed pa la zhugs pa spel mar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa de'i tshe nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal rags pa la cha phra ba'o snyam du spyod pa yid la byed pa la zhugs pa spel mar 'dug ste /
translated: When it enters the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrations, it is accompanied by the mental attention that is engaged in the subtle pride of thinking I, which is a gross pride.

analyzed: des na de 'di snyam du sems te bdag ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa'o //

original: bdag ni de thob pa yin no //

original: bdag la ni stong pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: bdag la ni stong pa nyid yod do //

analyzed: de kun tu spyod pa'i rgyu 'dod pa rnams sam 'jig tshogs la rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa de yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / 'jig tshogs la chags pas bsgyur ba nas bsam pa thag pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa la mi 'jug cing sems kyang phyir ldog pa gang yin pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The cause of its occurrence is the desire for sense-pleasures or the consciousness that is accompanied by attachment to the perishable aggregates. It is due to the non-understanding of that consciousness that is accompanied by attachment. From the desire for sense-pleasures and from attachment to the perishable aggregates, one is transformed, and one does not enter into nirvana even with a sincere mind, and one turns back from the mind.

original: de yang des rnam pa brgyad kyis yongs su shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang des rnam pa brgyad kyis yongs su shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is to be understood in eight aspects:

analyzed: de la zhig par gyur pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas na mi rtag pa'o //

translated: In this regard, the absence of self in all things is called the seal of all things.

original: de yang ston pa chos kyi rgyal po bla na med pas gsungs pa 'phags pa thams cad kyi rgyud la rdugs pa med pa 'phags pa'i nor thams cad thob pas dga' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang ston pa chos kyi rgyal po bla na med pas gsungs pa 'phags pa thams cad kyi rgyud la rdugs pa med pa 'phags pa'i nor thams cad thob pas dga' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: And that is taught by the unsurpassed Dharma King, the Blessed One, in the noble ƒÄrya-Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra, which is the cause of all the noble dharmas, which is the cause of the attainment of all the jewels of the ƒÄryas, and which is the cause of the joy of all the ƒÄryas.

original: des ni bdag nyid 'khor ba'i gcong rong chen po lam ring po las bde legs dang / bde ba gnyis kyis yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni bdag nyid 'khor ba'i gcong rong chen po lam ring po las bde legs dang / bde ba gnyis kyis yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, one is completely delivered from the great abyss of cyclic existence, by means of the two kinds of happiness and the two kinds of well-being.

original: bde bas na de las 'phags pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde bas na de las 'phags pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: Since one is happy, it is called the seal of the Dharma that is superior to that.

original: de ni shes pa snga ma shos kyis rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shes pa snga ma shos kyis rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is realized by the former kind of knowledge.

original: phyi ma shin tu rnam par dag pa shos kyis ni mthong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma shin tu rnam par dag pa shos kyis ni mthong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is seen by the latter kind of knowledge, which is extremely pure.

original: chos 'di pa rnams dang / phyi rol pa rnams kyi ston pa rnams dang slob ma rnams ni rnam pa lngas mtho ba dang dma' bar rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams dang / phyi rol pa rnams kyi ston pa rnams dang slob ma rnams ni rnam pa lngas mtho ba dang dma' bar rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The teachers and disciples of the insiders and outsiders are to be understood as being high or low in five ways:

original: gnas pa dang / tshogs yongs su bskyang ba dang / 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges par 'byed par byed pa dang / lam gdags pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / nan tan du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / tshogs yongs su bskyang ba dang / 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges par 'byed par byed pa dang / lam gdags pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / nan tan du sgrub pa'o //
translated: in terms of their abode, their retinue, their conversation, their teaching of the path, and their practice.

original: de la 'di las phyi rol pa'i ston pa slob mar bcas pa rnams ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dres par gnas pa yin la chos 'di pa rnams kyis ni dus dus su nang du yang dag 'jog pa lhur len par byed de 'di ni mtho ba
analyzed: de la 'di las phyi rol pa'i ston pa slob mar bcas pa rnams ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dres par gnas pa yin la chos 'di pa rnams kyis ni dus dus su nang du yang dag 'jog pa lhur len par byed de 'di ni mtho ba
translated: Here, non Buddhist teachers and their disciples always live in a state of confusion, but those who follow this Dharma sometimes strive to attain perfect inner peace. This is the first

original: dang dma' ba dang po yin no //üîΩgzhan yang phyi rol pa'i ston pa rnams ni rang gi slob ma rab tu byung ba'i tshogs tshad nges pa'i tshogs @172a * //
analyzed: dang dma' ba dang po yin no // gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i ston pa rnams ni rang gi slob ma rab tu byung ba'i tshogs tshad nges pa'i tshogs @172a * //
translated: difference in terms of high and low.

original: can dang slob ma khyim pa'i sde tshan gyi sde tshan can yin te /
analyzed: can dang slob ma khyim pa'i sde tshan gyi sde tshan can yin te /
translated: Moreover, non Buddhist teachers have a fixed number of ordained disciples and a fixed number of lay disciples.üîΩAll of them are called teachers of the assembly because they are revered as masters.

original: de dag thams cad kyi nang na slob dpon du bkur bas na tshogs kyi slob dpon rnams zhes bya ba dang / skye bo byis pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yon tan yod du re bas na shin tu dge bar bkur ba yin la ;
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi nang na slob dpon du bkur bas na tshogs kyi slob dpon rnams zhes bya ba dang / skye bo byis pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yon tan yod du re bas na shin tu dge bar bkur ba yin la ;
translated: They are also called very virtuous because they are revered by childish beings who hope they have good qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya ste /
translated: But the TathƒÅgata is the opposite of that.

original: lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi yang slob dpon nyid yin pa'i phyir slob dpon du bkur ba yin no //
analyzed: lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi yang slob dpon nyid yin pa'i phyir slob dpon du bkur ba yin no //
translated: He is honored as a master because he is the master of the world with its gods.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i slob dpon rnams ni rang rang gi slob ma rnams dang lhan cig tu 'bel pa'i gtam rnam par nges par byed pa la zhugs shing phan tshun mi mthun pa dang / 'brel pa med pa'i gtam dang / rmongs par byed pa dang shes pa rnam par dag par byed pa ma yin pa'i gtam gyis dus 'da' bar byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i slob dpon rnams ni rang rang gi slob ma rnams dang lhan cig tu 'bel pa'i gtam rnam par nges par byed pa la zhugs shing phan tshun mi mthun pa dang / 'brel pa med pa'i gtam dang / rmongs par byed pa dang shes pa rnam par dag par byed pa ma yin pa'i gtam gyis dus 'da' bar byed la /
translated: Moreover, the non-Buddhist masters spend their time in idle chitchat with their own disciples, and they pass the time in conversation that is irrelevant, incoherent, and pointless, and that does not purify the mind.

original: chos 'di pa rnams ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: But the Buddhists are the opposite of that.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol pa rnams kyi ston pa rnams ni slob ma rnams la rgyu med pa'am rgyu mi mthun pa'i sgo nas lam 'dogs par byed cing ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa rnams kyi ston pa rnams ni slob ma rnams la rgyu med pa'am rgyu mi mthun pa'i sgo nas lam 'dogs par byed cing ston par byed de /
translated: Moreover, the non-Buddhist teachers teach their disciples a path that is either causeless or caused by an incompatible cause.

original: chos ngan pa thos pa'i srin po chen pos sems dkrugs pa rtog pa ngan pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis sems dkrugs pa gzhan dag la glags tshol ba'i bsam pa can yin te /
analyzed: chos ngan pa thos pa'i srin po chen pos sems dkrugs pa rtog pa ngan pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis sems dkrugs pa gzhan dag la glags tshol ba'i bsam pa can yin te /
translated: The great demons of hearing bad doctrines disturb the mind, and those who are associated with bad thoughts and incorrect minds disturb the minds of others.

original: des na de dag gzhan dag gis dris na gya tshom du thog tu ma bab cing ma brtags pa'i tshig smra bar byed de /üîΩbdag nyid kyis kyang rgyu med pa'am /üîΩrgyu mi mthun pa bzung bas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas na de'i phyir byis pa'o //
analyzed: des na de dag gzhan dag gis dris na gya tshom du thog tu ma bab cing ma brtags pa'i tshig smra bar byed de / bdag nyid kyis kyang rgyu med pa'am / rgyu mi mthun pa bzung bas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas na de'i phyir byis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when questioned by others, they speak words that are confused, incoherent, and unreflective.üîΩThey are confused because they have grasped at causes that are either nonexistent or incompatible.

original: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas na de'i phyir rmongs pa'o //üîΩrnam par byang ba rnam par spangs pas na mi gsal pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas na de'i phyir rmongs pa'o // rnam par byang ba rnam par spangs pas na mi gsal pa'o //
translated: They are childish because they do not understand the causes of their own and others‚Äô addictions.üîΩThey are dull because they do not understand the causes of purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i rgyu la mi mkhas pas na mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rgyu la mi mkhas pas na mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are unskilled because they are ignorant of the causes of purification.

original: tshig ci tsam zhig smra bar bya ba dang / ji skad smra bar bya ba dang / gang du smra bar bya ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas na tshod mi shes pa dang / zhing mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ci tsam zhig smra bar bya ba dang / ji skad smra bar bya ba dang / gang du smra bar bya ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas na tshod mi shes pa dang / zhing mi shes pa'o //
translated: One does not know the extent of what should be said, how it should be said, and where it should be said, so one does not know the measure and one does not know the field.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos 'di pa rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos 'di pa rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these are the qualities of those who are insiders.

original: gzhan yang @172b phyi rol ba rnams kyi ston pa rnams kyi slob ma rnams ni ma nyams pa rnams dang phyi ci ma log par smra ba'i phyir ston pa la yang skur pa mi 'debs pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang sgro 'dogs pa med par smra ba'i phyir 'gal bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang @172b phyi rol ba rnams kyi ston pa rnams kyi slob ma rnams ni ma nyams pa rnams dang phyi ci ma log par smra ba'i phyir ston pa la yang skur pa mi 'debs pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang sgro 'dogs pa med par smra ba'i phyir 'gal bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the disciples of the teachers of non-Buddhists do not disparage their teachers because they are not degenerate and they speak without error. They do not contradict because they speak without remainder and without exaggeration.

original: don mthun pa'i phyir ji skad bstan pa bzhin du smra ba dang / tshig mthun pa'i phyir chos bzhin du smra ba yang yin pa dang / chos mthun pa de dag gi 'dod pa'i phyogs su smra ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyis lan 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: don mthun pa'i phyir ji skad bstan pa bzhin du smra ba dang / tshig mthun pa'i phyir chos bzhin du smra ba yang yin pa dang / chos mthun pa de dag gi 'dod pa'i phyogs su smra ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyis lan 'debs pa dang /
translated: Because they are in accord with the meaning, they speak in accordance with the teachings. Because they are in accord with the words, they speak in accordance with the Dharma. Because they speak in accordance with the position that is desired by those who are in accord with the Dharma, they answer with a Dharma that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: bag yod pa yin du zin kyang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du sgrub pa'i rang gi don thob par bya ba la bslu ba 'ba' zhig byed par rig par bya na /
analyzed: bag yod pa yin du zin kyang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du sgrub pa'i rang gi don thob par bya ba la bslu ba 'ba' zhig byed par rig par bya na /
translated: Even if they are heedful, they should be known as being solely deceived about the attainment of their own goal, which is the practice of a Dharma that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: bag med pa rnams la lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bag med pa rnams la lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention the heedless?

original: de dag gi ni de ltar rang gi don la yang bslus par 'gyur la pha rol smra ba rnams kyis kyang tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / log par bzung ba'i chos de dang bcas par yang smod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ni de ltar rang gi don la yang bslus par 'gyur la pha rol smra ba rnams kyis kyang tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / log par bzung ba'i chos de dang bcas par yang smod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, they are deceived about their own goal, they are defeated by others who speak, and they are criticized along with the Dharma that they have wrongly grasped.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos 'di pa rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos 'di pa rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Those who are the opposite of that should be known as being insiders of this Dharma.

original: 'di ni mtho ba dang dma' ba lnga pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtho ba dang dma' ba lnga pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the fifth pair, high and low.

original: de la 'du byed rnams ni rnam pa bzhis sdug bsngal ba yang gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ma yin la rnam pa bzhis ni bde ba yang gcig tu nges par rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams ni rnam pa bzhis sdug bsngal ba yang gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ma yin la rnam pa bzhis ni bde ba yang gcig tu nges par rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, conditioned states are suffering in four ways, but they are not definitely and always defiled. They are happy in four ways, but they are not definitely and always purified.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang gzhi gsum gyi skabs su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang gzhi gsum gyi skabs su rig par bya ste /
translated: These four ways should be understood in terms of the three bases,

original: skye ba'i gnas dang / tshor ba dang / dus so //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas dang / tshor ba dang / dus so //
translated: namely, the place of birth, feeling, and time.

original: de la bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum /
analyzed: de la bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum /
translated: Happiness is in the three meditations.

original: pa'i'o // bde ba dang 'brel pa ni mi rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: pa'i'o // bde ba dang 'brel pa ni mi rnams kyi yin te /
translated: Happiness is associated with humans,

original: gang na gnyi ga yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang na gnyi ga yod pa'o //
translated: where both exist.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: Possessing happiness and mental pleasure is in the first and second meditations.

original: bde ba las ma 'das pa kho na ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad do //
analyzed: bde ba las ma 'das pa kho na ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad do //
translated: Not beyond happiness is in the fourth meditation and above.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba ni dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba ni dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyi'o //
translated: The animals and hungry ghosts have suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa ni mi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa ni mi rnams kyi'o //
translated: Humans have suffering and its cause.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa ni sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa ni sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Hell beings have suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: sdug bsngal ba las ma 'das pa ni steng gi lha'i ris rnams kyi yin te /üîΩphyi ma la sdug bsngal ba dang 'brel @173a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba las ma 'das pa ni steng gi lha'i ris rnams kyi yin te / phyi ma la sdug bsngal ba dang 'brel @173a * //
translated: The gods have suffering, but not to the extent that they are beyond suffering.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are bound to suffering in the future.

original: de la bde ba'i 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe'o //
translated: The formations of pleasure are neither suffering nor pleasure when a neither pleasure nor suffering feeling is manifest.

original: bde ba dang 'brel pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang 'brel pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i tshe'o //
translated: They are bound to pleasure when suffering is manifest.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe'o //
translated: They are associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction when a pleasant feeling is manifest.

original: bde ba las ma 'das pa ni thams cad la yang bde ba'i rgyu dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba las ma 'das pa ni thams cad la yang bde ba'i rgyu dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not beyond suffering because they are always associated with the cause of suffering.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal pa'i rnam grangs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal pa'i rnam grangs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the synonyms of suffering.

original: de la bde ba'i 'du byed rnams ni bde ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba'i gnas 'gags pa gang yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i 'du byed rnams ni bde ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba'i gnas 'gags pa gang yin pa de dag go //
translated: Among them, the formative forces of pleasure are those that are associated with pleasure, which are the cessation of the basis of pleasure.

original: bde ba dang 'brel pa ni bde ba'i rgyu yod pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang 'brel pa ni bde ba'i rgyu yod pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is related to pleasure is that which will arise in the future because of the existence of the cause of pleasure.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas bde ba dang mthun pa gang yin pa de dag ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas bde ba dang mthun pa gang yin pa de dag ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are conducive to pleasure in the present moment are associated with pleasure and mental happiness.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dus gsum pa rnams ni bde ba las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dus gsum pa rnams ni bde ba las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: Those that are in the other two times are not beyond pleasure.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam grangs bzhi ste ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam grangs bzhi ste ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four synonyms of suffering should be understood in the opposite sense to that, as appropriate.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / shes pa gnyis ni gzhi dang bcas //
analyzed: sdom ni / shes pa gnyis ni gzhi dang bcas //
translated: The two knowledges, with their bases,üîΩThe transformation of pleasure,üîΩThe sutra that was taught on purpose,

original: bde ba yongs su 'gyur ba dang // ched du gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang // mya ngan 'das pa gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba yongs su 'gyur ba dang // ched du gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang // mya ngan 'das pa gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: And the two kinds of nirvana.

original: shes pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: shes pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Cognition is twofold:

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: right cognition and wrong cognition.

original: de la yang dag pa'i shes pa yang gzhi dang bcas par 'byung ba la log pa'i shes pa yang gzhi dang bcas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i shes pa yang gzhi dang bcas par 'byung ba la log pa'i shes pa yang gzhi dang bcas par 'byung ste /
translated: Right cognition arises with a basis, and wrong cognition also arises with a basis.

original: de gnyi ga yang gzhi dang bcas pa yin mod kyi yang dag pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba'i gzhi la 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang gzhi dang bcas pa yin mod kyi yang dag pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba'i gzhi la 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Both of them have a basis, but right cognition grasps the basis as it really is,

original: log pa'i shes pa ni rnam par brtags pas yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa'i gzhi la 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa ni rnam par brtags pas yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa'i gzhi la 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: and wrong cognition grasps the basis as it is not, because of conceptualization.

original: shes bya sngon du 'gro ba yod na yang dag par bstan pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i shes pa 'byung la shes bya yod na log par bstan pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus log pa'i shes pa 'byung ba yin mod kyi yang dag pa'i shes
analyzed: shes bya sngon du 'gro ba yod na yang dag par bstan pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i shes pa 'byung la shes bya yod na log par bstan pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus log pa'i shes pa 'byung ba yin mod kyi yang dag pa'i shes
translated: When there is a knowable object that precedes it, right cognition arises from the cause of attention to right teaching. When there is a knowable object, wrong cognition arises from the cause of attention to wrong teaching.

original: pa ni byung nas kyang shes bya 'jig par mi byed de /
analyzed: pa ni byung nas kyang shes bya 'jig par mi byed de /
translated: But right cognition, even though it has arisen, does not destroy the knowable object.

original: shes bya yod pa de nyid log par mngon par zhen pa spangs nas /
analyzed: shes bya yod pa de nyid log par mngon par zhen pa spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the false adherence to the existence of the object of knowledge,üîΩone remains in the real alone. For example, when a lamp is lit in a dark room, it does not destroy the forms but simply illuminates them.

original: yang dag pa nyi tshe la mngon du gnas pa kho nar zad de dper na mun pa'i @173b nang du 'dug pa'i gzugs rnams la mar me byung na gzugs rnams 'jig par mi byed kyi yod pa nyid gsal bar byed par zad de de dang 'dra bar rig
analyzed: yang dag pa nyi tshe la mngon du gnas pa kho nar zad de dper na mun pa'i @173b nang du 'dug pa'i gzugs rnams la mar me byung na gzugs rnams 'jig par mi byed kyi yod pa nyid gsal bar byed par zad de de dang 'dra bar rig
translated: One should understand it in the same way.

original: par bya'o // bde bar tshor ba'i 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis gang gi tshe sdug bsngal pa'i gnas skabs su gyur na de'i tshe gnod par gyur to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par bya'o // bde bar tshor ba'i 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis gang gi tshe sdug bsngal pa'i gnas skabs su gyur na de'i tshe gnod par gyur to zhes bya'o //
translated: When the formations that are felt as pleasant become the occasion for suffering, by the method of the characteristic of impermanence, then they are said to be suffering as a misfortune.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su gyur na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su gyur na ni de'i tshe /
translated: When they become the occasion for neither suffering nor pleasure,

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la brten nas sdug bsngal bar gyur to zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la brten nas sdug bsngal bar gyur to zhes bya ste /
translated: then they are said to be suffering in the sense of the suffering of the formations.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig gtan du yod par gyur cing //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig gtan du yod par gyur cing //
translated: If only the feeling of pleasure existed permanently,

original: gzhan dag gi gnas skabs ni ye 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i gnas 'di ni rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi gnas skabs ni ye 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i gnas 'di ni rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The state of others will never be such that they do not come into existence.

original: skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid dang 'brel pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid dang 'brel pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Conditioned states that are connected with the reality of birth, aging, etc., are suffering.

original: de dag las kyang nad kyi gnas skabs su gyur ba ni gnod par gyur to zhes bya'o //üîΩskye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs su gyur pa na ni sdug bsngal bar gyur to zhes bya ste 'du byed de rnams la skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'brel pa bzhin du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su ye ma gyur cig
analyzed: de dag las kyang nad kyi gnas skabs su gyur ba ni gnod par gyur to zhes bya'o // skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs su gyur pa na ni sdug bsngal bar gyur to zhes bya ste 'du byed de rnams la skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'brel pa bzhin du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su ye ma gyur cig
translated: And when they are in the state of disease, they are said to be afflicted.üîΩWhen they are in the state of suffering, such as birth, etc., they are said to be suffering.

original: ces bya ba'i gnas 'di ni rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i gnas 'di ni rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The state of conditioned states being such that they never come into the state of being the effect of the causes of birth, etc., and suffering will never be obtained.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pas na rang dbang med pa dang bdag po med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pas na rang dbang med pa dang bdag po med pa yin te /
translated: Since all conditioned states are dependent origination by nature, they are powerless and ownerless.

original: gang bdag por gyur pa de ni 'du byed 'di dag mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rgyun du 'jog par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang bdag por gyur pa de ni 'du byed 'di dag mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rgyun du 'jog par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: That which is the master, even though these compounded phenomena are impermanent, can be made to remain as long as one wishes.

original: yang na nam ma shi'i bar du gzhan rnams skyed par mi byed pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: yang na nam ma shi'i bar du gzhan rnams skyed par mi byed pa'i rigs so //
translated: If it were the self that is the master, then even though these formations are impermanent, it would be able to make them remain as it wishes, or else it would not cause others to arise until it itself ceases.üîΩBut this is not the case.

original: mdo sde 'di gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two kinds of sutras:

original: ched du bstan pa dang / ched du bstan pa ma yin pa'i mdo sde'o //
analyzed: ched du bstan pa dang / ched du bstan pa ma yin pa'i mdo sde'o //
translated: those that are explicit and those that are not explicit.

original: de la ched du bstan pa ni gang zag gang 'du byed bstan pa'i rnam pa gang gis gdul bar bya ba de'i ched du de'i rnam pa'i 'du byed bstan pa 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la ched du bstan pa ni gang zag gang 'du byed bstan pa'i rnam pa gang gis gdul bar bya ba de'i ched du de'i rnam pa'i 'du byed bstan pa 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The explicit sutras are those that are taught for the sake of a particular person, in a particular way, in order to discipline him.

original: ched du bstan pa ma yin pa ni gang du 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i nang du rnam grangs du mar dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gtam mdzad pa'am yang na ston pa'i drung du gnas pa kun dga' bo'i mdun du gtam mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ched du bstan pa ma yin pa ni gang du 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i nang du rnam grangs du mar dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gtam mdzad pa'am yang na ston pa'i drung du gnas pa kun dga' bo'i mdun du gtam mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The non-explicit sutras are those in which the Buddha speaks in many ways for the sake of many hundreds of assemblies, or else those in which he speaks in the presence of Ananda.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,
the Sutra of the Questions of Sagaramati.

original: pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the Dharma to remain for a long time.

original: yan lag gsum gyis yongs su zin na mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gsum gyis yongs su zin na mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that nirvana is complete when it is accompanied by three factors:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang 'du byed thams cad yang dag par brtags pa dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'o //üîΩde la mthun pa'i gdams ngag ni kun brjod pa'i rjes su ston pa /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang 'du byed thams cad yang dag par brtags pa dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'o // de la mthun pa'i gdams ngag ni kun brjod pa'i rjes su ston pa /
translated: the instructions that are in conformity with it, the thorough investigation of all the formative forces, and the abandonment of all the afflictions.

original: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis bsdus pa'i bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis bsdus pa'i bstan pa ste /
translated: The instructions that are in conformity with it are the teachings that are included in the miracle of instruction.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi sems kun brjod par bzhed pa na nyid thugs mnyam par bzhag pas gzhan gyi sems ma lus par rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas khyad par mdzad de /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi sems kun brjod par bzhed pa na nyid thugs mnyam par bzhag pas gzhan gyi sems ma lus par rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas khyad par mdzad de /
translated: When the TathƒÅgata wishes to reveal the minds of others, he, with his mind in a state of meditative concentration, completely reveals the three types of minds of others without exception.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa gang yin pa dang / 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar gyi dmigs pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa gang yin pa dang / 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar gyi dmigs pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The mind that has just ceased, and the mind that is presently engaged with its object.

original: de ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas /
translated: Having arisen from that meditative absorption,üîΩhe declares, in accordance with his realization, the minds of others, which are the objects of his meditative absorption, without exception, just as he has experienced them.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis nyams su myong ba'i pha rol gyi sems thugs la dgongs nas ji ltar myong ba de kho na bzhin du ma tshang ba med par lung ston par mdzad de sems 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes bya ba ni 'gags nas yun ringüîΩdu lon pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis nyams su myong ba'i pha rol gyi sems thugs la dgongs nas ji ltar myong ba de kho na bzhin du ma tshang ba med par lung ston par mdzad de sems 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes bya ba ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'o //
translated: He declares, ‚ÄúThis mind is like this,‚Äù in reference to the mind that has ceased a long time ago.

original: yid ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes bya ba ni 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes bya ba ni 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He declares, ‚ÄúThis thought is like this,‚Äù in reference to the mind that has just ceased.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi yin pa ste /
translated: He declares, ‚ÄúThis consciousness is like this,‚Äù in reference to the present mind.

original: de yang rigs nges pa'i sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang rigs nges pa'i sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, he declares this in terms of the certainty of the spiritual gene,

original: skad cig pa nges pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa nges pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: not in terms of the certainty of the moment.

original: de yang de bzhin du kun du brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la brten nas gnas gsum du gdams ngag ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du kun du brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la brten nas gnas gsum du gdams ngag ston par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, in the same way, he teaches the precepts in the three situations, based on the miracle of telling all.

original: 'gro zhing rgyu bar gtogs pa la ni yul mngon sum du gyur pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la ni gnang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'gro zhing rgyu bar gtogs pa la ni yul mngon sum du gyur pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la ni gnang bar mdzad do //
translated: He permits the direct perception of objects in the case of those who are engaged in going and coming, and he permits proper mental attention in the case of those who are engaged in abiding.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'gog par mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'gog par mdzad do //
translated: He prohibits improper mental attention.

original: gnas par gtogs pa la ni rtog pa ngan pa ni 'gog par mdzad do //
analyzed: gnas par gtogs pa la ni rtog pa ngan pa ni 'gog par mdzad do //
translated: He prohibits bad thoughts in the case of those who are engaged in abiding,

original: rtog pa bzang po ni gnang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rtog pa bzang po ni gnang bar mdzad do //
translated: and he permits good thoughts.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la brtson pa la ni spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa @174b mngon sum du byed pa gnang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la brtson pa la ni spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa @174b mngon sum du byed pa gnang bar mdzad do //
translated: He permits the realization of nirvana through the abandonment of all the motivating dispositions to be abandoned and through the abandonment of all the afflictions in the case of those who are engaged in the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: gnas gsum du gtogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems yongs su dag pa de ni gdams ngag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas gsum du gtogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems yongs su dag pa de ni gdams ngag bstan pa yin te /
translated: The mind is completely purified from the three kinds of secondary mental afflictions. This is the teaching of the instruction.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The three kinds of secondary mental afflictions are:

original: rgyu zhing 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / gnas par gtogs pa dang / rten du gtogs pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams rtag pa na 'du byed thams cad rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhing 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / gnas par gtogs pa dang / rten du gtogs pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams rtag pa na 'du byed thams cad rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: 1) those that occur in the context of going and coming, 2) those that occur in the context of remaining in place, and 3) those that occur in the context of the support.

original: zag pa gsum dang / zag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dun pa'i phongs pa dang / 'dun pa'i phongs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rtog pas gdungs pa dang rtog pas gdungs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yul du tshol bas 'khrugs pa yang dag par spangs pas na nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa gsum dang / zag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dun pa'i phongs pa dang / 'dun pa'i phongs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rtog pas gdungs pa dang rtog pas gdungs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yul du tshol bas 'khrugs pa yang dag par spangs pas na nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The complete abandonment of all mental afflictions is the complete abandonment of the three kinds of mental afflictions, the distress of longing that is preceded by the three kinds of mental afflictions, the agitation of searching for objects that is preceded by distress, and the agitation of conceptual thoughts that is preceded by agitation.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas ni sems rnam par grol te yongs su yi 'chad pa med pas mtshan ma med pa'i bde bar gnas pas gnas shing tshe 'di nyid la yongs su rdzogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grangs su 'gro'o
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas ni sems rnam par grol te yongs su yi 'chad pa med pas mtshan ma med pa'i bde bar gnas pas gnas shing tshe 'di nyid la yongs su rdzogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grangs su 'gro'o
translated: Since they have abandoned all afflictions, their minds are liberated and they are free from regret. They abide in the bliss of the absence of signs and in this very life they attain the complete nirvana of the transcendence of suffering.

original: // chos gsum la rang gi don gyi sgo nas de la skyabs su gnas pa dang / gzhan gyi don gyi sgo nas de la gling du gnas te /
analyzed: // chos gsum la rang gi don gyi sgo nas de la skyabs su gnas pa dang / gzhan gyi don gyi sgo nas de la gling du gnas te /
translated: They abide in the three dharmas in terms of their own welfare and in terms of the island in terms of the welfare of others.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: nang gi yid la byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / chos mthun pa'i skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nang gi yid la byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / chos mthun pa'i skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: They are: practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma preceded by inner mental attention, listening to the sublime Dharma taught by the Tathagata, and relying on sublime beings who are in accord with the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag la ni brten par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni brten par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not rely on others.üîΩWhat are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: not sublime beings,

original: 'di las phyi rol pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa las brtsams te /
translated: The opposite of this is the opposite of the outsider.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du bsten par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du bsten par mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not rely on him in any way.

original: chos gsum po 'di dag gis ni mir gur pa la dben pa'i chos bzhi bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gsum po 'di dag gis ni mir gur pa la dben pa'i chos bzhi bstan pa yin te /
translated: By these three dharmas, the four dharmas of solitude in the human condition are taught.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la yang dag par brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Relying on the holy person, listening to the holy Dharma, proper mental attention, and practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yan lag des mya ngan las 'das pa ni rgyu gsum du rig par bya'o //üîΩrnam pa lngas sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas 'du byed thams cad kyi nyes @175a * //
analyzed: yan lag des mya ngan las 'das pa ni rgyu gsum du rig par bya'o // rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas 'du byed thams cad kyi nyes @175a * //
translated: By this branch, nirvana should be known as having three causes.

original: dmigs mthong ba dang / mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs mthong ba dang / mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: By five aspects: understanding suffering, seeing the disadvantage of all conditioned things which are the basis of suffering, and transcending all suffering such as sorrow.

original: de la sdug bsngal pa'i rigs la brten pas mya ngan la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni de dag gi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal pa'i rigs la brten pas mya ngan la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni de dag gi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of these is the knowledge that sorrow, etc., arise in dependence on the types of suffering.

original: rang gi sa bon yod na skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni rgyu yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon yod na skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni rgyu yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the cause is the knowledge that they arise when their seeds exist.

original: rang gi spyod yul gyi yul la brten pa 'di ni rkyen yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi spyod yul gyi yul la brten pa 'di ni rkyen yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the condition is the knowledge that they depend on the objects of their own spheres.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas 'du byed de dag la bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dang / bdag tu yang dag par mthong ba 'di ni grogs yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas 'du byed de dag la bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dang / bdag tu yang dag par mthong ba 'di ni grogs yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the companion is the knowledge that the companion is the manifest clinging to the idea of mine in regard to those formative forces which are the basis of suffering and the manifest view of self.

original: dus gsum du 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi nyes dmigs yang dag par mthong na mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa ni yan lag des mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi nyes dmigs yang dag par mthong na mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa ni yan lag des mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of nirvana through that limb should be understood as the abandonment of all the sufferings of sorrow, etc., through the correct perception of the disadvantage of the formative forces associated with the three times.

original: de la sdug pa'i dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba la mya ngan byed pa'i sgo nas sems gzir ba ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sdug pa'i dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba la mya ngan byed pa'i sgo nas sems gzir ba ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
translated: Grief is the disturbance of the mind that occurs when one experiences the transformation of a pleasant thing.

original: de las byung ba'i tshig brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshig brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the expression of grief in words.

original: brang brdung ba'i phyir ni sdug bsngal ba'o //üîΩnang gi yid gdung ba'i phyir ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: brang brdung ba'i phyir ni sdug bsngal ba'o // nang gi yid gdung ba'i phyir ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is the pain that arises from the body.üîΩDepression is the burning of the mind.

original: kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Vexation is the confusion that arises from the mind's distress.

original: gzhan yang longs spyod dang nad med pa dang / gnyen gyi sdug bsngal las gang yang rung ba'i sdug bsngal gsar du 'byung ba la brten te /üîΩyid mi bde bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang longs spyod dang nad med pa dang / gnyen gyi sdug bsngal las gang yang rung ba'i sdug bsngal gsar du 'byung ba la brten te / yid mi bde bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, grief is the mental distress that arises from the suffering of loss, the suffering of the separation of what is pleasant, and the suffering of the occurrence of what is not pleasant.üîΩLamentation is the expression of grief in words and the burning of the body that occurs immediately after the occurrence of grief.

original: de la brten nas de'i rjes thogs su tshig tu brjod pa dang lus yongs su gdungs pa ni smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de la brten nas de'i rjes thogs su tshig tu brjod pa dang lus yongs su gdungs pa ni smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Sorrow is the pain that arises from the body.üîΩDepression is the burning of the mind.üîΩVexation is the confusion that arises from the mind's distress.

original: smre sngags 'don pa dang / lus yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i yid mi bde ba las 'das pa de'i nyin par cung zad zhi bar gyur te /
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa dang / lus yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i yid mi bde ba las 'das pa de'i nyin par cung zad zhi bar gyur te /
translated: The mental dissatisfaction of lamentation and bodily distress is absent.

original: sems mi dga' bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni yid mi bde ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sems mi dga' bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni yid mi bde ba'i gnas skabs so //
